loans.name: Wael

texts.ar:
وائل في عمر 45 سنة يعمل في نقل الخضار والفواكه الموسيمية متزوج وله على عاتقه اربعة
اولاد يحب عمله وله في المصلحة اكثر من 15 سنة يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى تكملة شراء ارض وزرعها
يريد ان يعتمد على نفسه وان يؤمن مستقبل افضل له ولعائلته يسعى جاهدا الى تحسين الوضع المادي والاجتماعي يلقى 
دعم كبير من محيطه فهو مميز بعمله ومتطور وطموح
texts.en: Wael, 45, is married with 4 children.  He has been working in transporting vegetables and seasonal fruits for 15 years. Wael has a passion for his work. He wishes to get a loan from Al Majmoua to fulfil the price of buying a plot of land and planting it. He wishes to be independent and to secure a better future both for himself and his family. Wael works hard to improve his family's social and economic conditions. He enjoys huge support from people who know him. Wael is known for his outstanding work, ambition and willingness to develop.

loans.use: To fulfill the price of buying a plot of land and planting it

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Don Juan de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos de 20, 17, 12 y 10 años de edad, residen en Lolotiquillo departamento de Morazán,  se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías, su trabajo específicamente es fabricar faldones de montura de caballos, yaguales y petates, estos últimos son hechos con tule, estos son los productos que comercializa dedicándose a tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para mantenerse activo con su fabricación de productos, la compra seria en tule y cuero, de esta manera contar con lo necesario para realizar los trabajos.
Sus propósitos son trabajar para mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Mr Juan, age 51, lives with his wife and four children ages 20, 17, 12 y 10. They live in Lolotiquillo, in the Morazán department. He makes crafts. Specifically, he makes saddles, woven rings and bedrolls. He makes the bedrolls from reeds. This is a full-time business.

He is requesting this loan for the purchase of basic materials to keep making his products. He will purchase reeds and leather in order to have the necessary items to do his work.

He intends to work in order to improve his home and to support his children with their studies.

loans.use: the purchase of reeds and leather

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn G. is a married woman who lives in Pangobilian, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: food production, buying and selling medicines, and buying and selling rice. Her husband, Orly G., who is 41 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living. They have one child who is 11 years old. Marlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marlyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 10,300 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use to buy spices and ingredients for the food she makes. She would like to continue to save up for the future education of her children and family needs. Marlyn G. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Fund the operations of food production

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David S. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child.  His child is not currently in school.  David has a small hardware shop, which he has had for two years.         

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase hardware items for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, David hopes to generate greater profits and buy basic needs for the family.  In the future, David hopes to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware items for resale

loans.name: Fabiola  Tomasa

texts.es:
Fabiola es una madre de familia de 31 años de edad que reside  en su casa propia junto a su  esposo y sus hijos en el caserío Yencala Boggiano, zona agrícola  y ganadera que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque.

Fabiola se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales ganado ovino, caprino y aves de corral, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 03 años conoce el negocio a la perfección por ello cuenta con clientela establecida.

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos que le permitirán realizar arreglos e el ambiente donde cría a su ganado.  Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fabiola is a 31-year-old mother who lives in her own house with her husband and children in the Yencala Boggiano hamlet, a farming area that is located in the Lambayeque province.

Fabiola raises and sells sheep, goats, and poultry in a corral near her residence. She feeds them natural grains and pasture. Once they hit the optimum level in their development, she sells them to buyers who frequent her area. She has been in business for 3 years and knows the trade to perfection, which is why she has a well-established clientele.

She would like to obtain more livestock and feed in order to expand her business and earn bigger profits, which will allow her to repair her farmyard. Thus, she sees fit to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa, which will help her reach her goal.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Fanny Marilu

texts.es:
Fanny Marilu G. C. tiene 28 años, Vive en Unión Libre vive con el compañero y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. No tienen hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Fanny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una tienda de abarrotes.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Fanny Marilu G. C. is 28 and lives with her common-law husband in Bolívar Province. They have no children.

The members of CALZADO SOLIDARIO [Calzado Solidarity] communal bank live in Calzado Recinto in San Miguel Canton, a half hour from the Cooperativa office. The 12 members of this group do short cycle agricultural work, planting corn, potatoes and beans, and raise farmyard animals and cattle.

Fanny does agricultural work growing corn, potatoes and beans, and raising farmyard animals. She purchases her products in the San Miguel market each week and sells them at the Thursday market in San Miguel. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase seeds for her crops and to buy food for the animals. The support of this loan will help her financially meet her needs, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. Her dream is to have a small grocery store.

She likes playing sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds for her crops and to buy food for the animals.

loans.name: Bobbie

texts.en:
Bobbie G. is an independent insurance agent with The Woodlands Financial Group (TWFG) Insurance Services.  Bobbie, who has been in the insurance business for nine years, started her business with TWFG Insurance Services in 2007.  Her business offers personal and commercial insurance lines to customers, including health and life insurance.

Bobbie has two employees who work with her in Corpus Christi, as well as agents in Laredo, New Braunfels, and Lufkin (all cities in Texas).  Until now, Bobbie has relied on referrals and word-of-mouth advertising to bring in business, in addition to networking extensively with local realtors and the Hispanic Chamber of Commerce.  With this loan, she will print and distribute a brochure promoting the services TWFG offers.  Having already established a strong clientele in Corpus Christi, this mail-out will focus on reaching potential clients in nearby towns.  This marketing effort will hopefully generate new business and provide a better understanding of possible new markets.  Bobbie’s long-term goal is to open a second local office, and she will use the response from this mail-out to evaluate potential locations.

For Bobbie, owning her own business means that every day is interesting.  With the insurance industry as competitive and time-intensive as it is, she says that “burn-out” is a major problem for insurance agents.  She thinks that she stays engaged because she is always doing different things.  As a single mother, Bobbie says that owning her own business allows her to set her own schedule.  She loves being able to spend time with her son and attend his various activities.

This is Bobbie’s second loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  Her first loan provided the capital to start her business.  She says that without ACCION Texas-Louisiana’s help, her business never would have survived.

loans.use: to pay for advertising brochures.

loans.name: Rwemengo Tumanyane Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Prosper is the leader of Rwemengo Tumanyane group in Ibanda. He is 53 years old and married with seven children, out of whom four are in school. Prosper has a grocery store plus being in charge of selling produce, which includes selling coffee, beans and bananas, and he is able to make over $22 in weekly profits. His store is in the Rwemengo trading center.

Fourteen years ago he started his business after selling a cow.  He is very hard working and social and he says that working with his wife has enabled him to succeed. He is also involved in the sale of milk from his cows and this supplements his income. He needs a loan to be able to purchase produce for the store.

loans.use: to purchase produce for the store

loans.name: Uheri Group

texts.fr: Kubuya B. Luendo est entrepreneur, vice présidente du groupe d’affaire de Trio « Uheri »,  âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants et tous fréquentent l’école. Son mari est un constructeur Maitre maçon. La cliente Kubuya B. Luendo est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle s’installe au long de la rue, au centre commercial Birere  parfois devant les grands dépôts, près de la mosquée Musulmane de Birere. Elle vient de réaliser 5 cycles opérationnels en bénéficiant de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des nouveaux produits vers Kichanga dans le Masisis, ancien fief du chef rebelle du CNDP (2 sacs de haricots, 4 sacs de maïs, 4 sacs de sorgho, etc.).  En plus, elle ambitionne agrandir son entreprise et construire une maison.  La cliente Kubuya B. Luendo remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kubuya B. Luendo is an entrepreneur, vice-president of the Trio « Uheri » group. She's 32 years old, married, and the mother of six children, who all attend school. Her husband is a master mason.

Kubuya B. Luendo sells food products. She finds a spot along the road, at the Birere commercial center, sometimes in front of large depots, or near the Birere muslim mosque.

She has completed her fifth loan cycle with Kiva's partner, MFI Hekima. She will use her new loan to buy new products in Kichanga in Masisis, former stronghold of the CNDP rebel's chief. She will buy 2 sacks of bean, 4 sacks of corn, 4 sacks or sorghum, etc. 

Furthermore, she ambitions to expand her business and build a house. Kubuya B. Luendo thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of the poor who are excluded from classical banks.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of bean, 4 sacks of corn, 4 sacks or sorghum, etc.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel vive en el municipio de El Sauce del departamento de León, es acompañada y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo  quienes son su razón y motivo de sus esfuerzos. Trabaja actualmente en su propio negocio en una pulpería en su casa de habitación donde también vende refrescos y  tiene 1 año de estar dedicándose a esta actividad.
El destino del crédito es para darle un mejor surtido a su negocio, comprando productos tales como comestibles, golosinas y productos varios como jabones. Esto le permitirá obtener mejores ganancia diarias y sus ventas se han con un mejor aprovecho. Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Maria Isabel lives in the municipality of El Sauce in the department of Leon. She has 2 children in her care, who are the source of her motivation to work hard. She currently has her own business. It is a small grocery and soft drinks business, installed in her own home. She has been in business for 1 year. Her loan will be used to purchase inventory for her business. She will purchase various products such as food, snacks and variety products such as soap, which will help her obtain better daily earnings and to increase her sales. This will help her improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of grocery store merchandise.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 45 years old and married with 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a Sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 24500 loan through NWTF, to buy items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her store .

Ma. Luisa has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the Sari sari store for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables and spices.

Ma. Luisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: Buy items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena is married and has three children. Her husband works with Zoom Lion Company, a waste management company. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. 

Mena sells gari, detergent, sugar, rice and other items in both small and large quantities in Elmina. Her loan will be used to buy more gari, Omo-brand detergent, rice and other items. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy gari, Omo-brand detergent, rice and other items.

loans.name: Jean Batiste

texts.en: Jean Batiste is 36 years old. He has three children who are ages 6- 16 years of age. He sells different kinds of items which include sugar, salt, cooking oil and soap. Jean Batiste has had this business for 8years and his business is doing well. Jean Batiste is requesting a loan to buy  more items such as sugar, salt for  his store. He hopes to make profits from this capital and plans to save all his profits

loans.use: To buy items such as sugar and salt.

loans.name: Numan

texts.en: Numan is a 42-year-old man, married, and a father of two daughters and two sons. Numan lives in the Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. He is a taxi driver; he took out a loan from FATEN to perform car maintenance. The taxi is the only source of income for the six family members. Numan doesn't have enough cash to pay for the car maintenance, therefore FATEN's loan is necessary to improve the family's financial situation. Numan appears in the picture next to the taxi. About this loan product: FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information, please visit Kiva's article on Lending in the Muslim World

loans.use: to pay for taxi maintenance so the car works for longer hours and increases his income

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Maria Auxiliadora está constituido por 16 mujeres, todas amigas y vecinas de Ciudad del Este. Ellas se encuentran en el décimo tercer ciclo. Son señoras muy activas y solidarias, ellas realizan actividades en el barrio para recaudar fondos.
Ellas se denominan como mujeres luchadoras y muy trabajadoras. Ellas luchan día a día por conseguir un mejor estilo de vida y brindarle a sus hijos una educación adecuada.
La Sra Francisca se dedica a la venta de ropas. Se dedica a esto hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene un grupo de clientes que siempre vienen a comprar de ella. Se siente muy conforme con lo que hace, pues ayuda a solventar los gastos que día a día surgen. Comenta que todo lo que ella hace es para brindarle un mejor futuro y una vivencia diga a todos aquellos que de ella dependen.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de ropas de estación, lo cual le ayudara a cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The 'Maria Auxiliadora' committee is made up of 16 women who are all friends and neighbors from Ciudad del Este.  They are on their 13th loan cycle.  The ladies are all very active and supportive, and they carry out activities in their neighborhood in order to collect funds.  They describe themselves as very hard-working and tenacious women.  They work hard every day in order to achieve a better lifestyle and provide their children with a decent education.

Francisca sells clothes.  She has been in this business for some time now and already has a group of customers who always come to buy from her.  She feels very happy with what she does as it helps to cover her daily expenses.  She says that everything she does is aimed at providing a better future and a decent home for everybody who is dependent on her.

Francisca is requesting this loan to buy seasonal clothes which will help her to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothes to sell

loans.name: Veronica Petrona

texts.es: Esta señora es originaria de de san Isidro las marías , es maestra y está ubicada  en el colegio de la comarca cruz de apante, tiene 10 años de laborar, su núcleo familiar  consta de 2 personas que son su hijo,  y su esposo, esta señora solicito su segundo financiamiento atraves del convenio con el mismo colegio, los mismos le han ayudado a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida, ya que este ultimo lo utilizara para la compra de cemento, ladrillo, clavos, madera y mano de obra, para la remodelación de su casa y de esa manera ha mejorado sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en:
This woman is originally from San Isidro las Marías. She is a teacher at a school located in the town of Cruz de Apante. She has been working for ten years. Her nuclear family consists of two people, her child and her husband.

She is requesting her second loan through an agreement with her school, which has helped her improve her condition and standard of living. She will use this last loan to purchase cement, bricks, nails, wood and to pay for manual labor to remodel her house. In this way she will improve her condition and standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, nails, wood and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona, a 39-year-old married mother of four children, works hard to provide for her family. The operator of a variety store in the Philippines for the past six years, she has requested her fourth loan for PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional supplies to sell in her store. She also earns an income from selling vegetables.

Melitona aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies to sell in her store

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 39 years old. She is married to a local farmer and together they raise four children. Mercy and her husband did not finished their education due to financial hardship. To generate income and provide support for the education of her children, they are both involved in the farming business. They plant and harvest rice and have been managing a half-hectare rice field for almost 10 years. 

Mercy wants to improve her crop production.  That is why she is requesting a loan of P12,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor cost in transplanting the rice seedlings. 

In the future, with the help of this loan, she will save enough money to continuously send her children to school so they can have a degree someday to achieve a successful life.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon is 41 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and has four children. 

Marlon owns and operates a motorcycle to earn a living. It is called habal-habal, a single motorcycle capable of carrying two to six passengers and commonly seen in remote or rural areas. He has been doing this for over six years already. Each month, he earns approximately PHP 2,000. 

He has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to repair the motorcycle and provide better service to passengers.  

Marlon joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2010. This is his second loan cycle from the cooperative. 

In the future, Marlon hopes to pursue business operations sooner and improve service offerings. He also plans to lay aside a portion of his earnings for the education of his growing children.

loans.use: To repair the motorcycle.

loans.name: Ife Lodou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe IFE LODOU est formé de trois personnes qui mènent des activités complémentaires. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est âgée de 29 ans et est mariée à Alain, un conducteur. Le couple a trois enfants. Des trois enfants, deux sont scolarisés. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants, et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Marie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marie mène comme activité depuis cinq ans environs, la vente de bijoux et de vêtements par le système de distribution. Marie s'approvisionne au Bénin et au Togo. La demande de sa clientèle devient de plus en plus grande et compte tenu de ses moyens limités, Marie n'arrive plus à bien répondre à leurs exigence. Eu égard à cela et compte tenu de leurs ressources limitées, Marie et les autres membres du groupe IFE LODOU sollicitent ensemble un second crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: IFE LODOU group consists of three people who run complementary activities. The representative of this group, Marie, is the one with the raised hand in the picture. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDé to improve the level of their activity. Marie is 29 years old and is married to Alain, a driver. The couple has three children, two of which are attending school. Marie lives with her husband and their children and together with her husband she takes care of family expenses. Marie does not have a school education. To deal with her different responsabilities, including the business that she has been running for five years, the sale of jewelry and clothing by distribution system. Marie purchases her supplies in Benin and Togo. The customer demand is growing and given her limited resources, Marie can no longer respond to it. For this reason Marie and the other members of the IFE LODOU group are requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry and clothing

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia D. 56 años, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con el servicio sólo D. luz, ubicado en el distrito D. Cayaltí que pertenece a la provincia D. Chiclayo.  Zona D. actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Lidia cuenta con su negocio D. comida, el cual es ambulatorio y lo tiene en el parque principal D. lazona donD. vive, actividad que realiza desD. hace varios años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocida por la limpieza y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá tener una mejor calidad D. vida.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  D. 800 nuevos soles para comprar insumos para seguir preparando sus ricas comidas, brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir sus gastos familiares.  Lidia con su trabajo y sus ganas D. salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza D. sus clientes, con la finalidad D. que más adelante tenga un negocio granD. D. todo tipo D. comida.
texts.en:
Lidia, 56, lives with her family in her own house that only has electricity and is located in Cayatlí District that belongs to Chiclayo Province; it’s a farming and livestock raising area.

Lidia has an ambulatory food business located in the park in the neighborhood where she lives.  She’s been doing this activity for many years and has an established clientele.  She’s known for her cleanliness and tasty preparations.  Income obtained will help her have a better quality of life.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for an 800 new sol loan to buy the ingredients she needs to continue preparing her delicious meals providing good customer service so that she can uses profits earned to cover family expenses.  With her work and drive to get ahead, Lidia has earned the trust of her customers with the aim of having a large business with all types of food.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María, es soltera ella se dedica a vender pupusas de queso, chicharon, revueltas y bebidas, gaseosas, chocolate y refrescos  por las tardes sábado y domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar materia prima como (maíz, quesillo,chicharon y aceite) de esa forma podrá tener más ingresos y tendrá siempre lo necesario para mantener el negocio.
El sueño de María es que el negocio crezca y poder aumentar en sus ingresos y tener lo necesario para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
María is single and sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas) made of cheese, pork crackling, scrambled eggs as well as drinks and sodas, chocolate and soft drinks on Saturday and Sunday evenings. 

She will use the loan to buy raw materials such as: corn, cheese, pork crackling and oil. In this way she will have more income and she will always have what she needs to stay in business. 

Maria's dream is that the business grow, her income increase and that she have enough to live a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, pork crackling and oil.

loans.name: Ndella

texts.fr: Madame Ndella vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons. C’est une activité qu’elle a choisi  par nécessité pour augmenter ses revenus. Elle  est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs qui est prévu pour la réfection de la table sur laquelle elle expose les poissons qu’elle commercialise. Le reste de l’argent sera investi dans l’achat de poissons à revendre. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra d’améliorer son niveau de vie et de soutenir son mari.
texts.en: Madame Ndella lives in Sénégal. She sells fish, an activity she chose out of necessity to increase her income. She is a member of a branch of U-IMCEC and is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs intended to be used to repair the table on which she displays her fish for sale. The rest of the money will be spent to buy fish to sell. Growing her profit will permit her to improve her standard of living and help her husband.

loans.use: to repair her table and buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Mahammadali

texts.en: Mahammadali is a 36-year-old man who raises and sells fruits and vegetables. He has seven years of experience in this field. He usually sells his crops in the central bazaar and his monthly income is 200 AZN. He applied for a 1000 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He wishes to increase his income and improve the life conditions of his two children.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Amba C Group

texts.en:
Irine is the facilitator of the Amba C group. Anne and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Irine and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Irine takes care of four children at home with her husband. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s affordable input prices.In the recent 2011 season, Anne had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Irine was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1  acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Irine will pay for major yearly expenses, such as school fees and livestock investments.

In 2012, the members of Amba C group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Irine is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Sorn is 27 years old and is a mother of one school-aged child. Sorn is a responsible housewife who always looks after her children and household. The family's main source of income is from her husband, who is a baker. He has operated this business since 2005 and he usually earns in the neighborhood of $5.00 per day. 

Presently the market demand is on the increase, and Sorn’s husband is going to take this opportunity to produce as many cakes as possible so he can satisfy his customers. He hopes to earn more profit and expand his business in the future. 

As shown in the picture, Sorn's house is currently under construction and she needs some funds from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to pay for labors performing the construction.

loans.use: build her house

loans.name: Rommel Ali

texts.es:
En el Municipio del Sauce, departamento de León, el joven Rommel Ali se ha identificado por ser una persona responsable debido a que ha sabido manejar las condiciones de su familia. Él tiene dos hijos bajos su cargo, se caracteriza por ser un excelente trabajador. 
 
 Actual mente se presentó a Ceprodel El Sauce, con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejoramiento de su casa con el fin de vivir en mejores condiciones con sus seres queridos, para ello está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de materiales de construcción, tales como: cemento y Arena con esto le permitirá, mejorar su casa de habitación
texts.en:
In the municipality of Sauce in the state of León, the young Rommel Ali has stood out as a responsible person due to the fact that he has supported his family. He has 2 children that he supports. He is an excellent worker. 
 
He came to Ceprodel's office in El Sauce to request a loan to improve his home so that he and his family may live in better conditions. He is requesting the loan for construction materials such as cement and sand. This will allow him to make improvements to his home.

loans.use: buy iron, cement and sand.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina, a 53-year-old energetic woman, lives with her family: a husband and six children who are 28, 25, 23, 21, 19 and 12 years old. Besides her eldest son, all of her children are free and don’t do anything. Her son is a government employee. 

Her husband is a driver by profession. His business is going well and generates good income every month. 

Sakina is a talented lady, and she owns and operates a business making flower testers (canopies, as over a bed). She offers her services for marriages and parties. She prepares beautiful-looking flower testers and also decorates them for her regular clients for their marriage functions. 

She has been operating her business for over 28 years and has a good reputation among her clients for her services.  

With this loan, she will purchase artificial as well as fresh flowers and thread in larger quantity for preparing beautiful looking testers for growing her business. 

She is quite hopeful that her business will return her good profits after the loan investment. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sakina”.

loans.use: To buy artificial and fresh flowers and thread for a business making flower testers (canopies, as over a bed)

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es: Mario de Jesús su actividad económica  a la que se dedica es a una carpintería en cual tiene experiencia en el negocio, es un emprender que es un ejemplo para su familia ya que el mismo se abrió puertas para buscar los ingresos de la familia. Fundación León 2000, le apoyo con el crédito para que invirtiera en su negocio, en el cual nos expresa que gracias al apoyo ha salido adelante y que hoy en día sea cumplido su sueño de tener su propio negocio. Actualmente Mario está solicitando crédito para invertir en materia prima para el negocio ya tiene los pedidos de sus clientes en cual necesita dinero para poder abastecerse.
texts.en: Mario de Jesús makes his living as a carpenter. He has experience in this business. He is an entrepreneur who is an example for his family because he has opened doors to find income for his family. Fundación León 2000 supported him with a loan to invest in his business. Mario says that thanks to the support, he has been able to survive and now his dream of having his own store has come true. Currently Mario is requesting a loan to invest in raw materials for the business. He has requests from his customers and needs money to stock the business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yaneth, de 30 años es una mujer soltera; vive en casa alquilada y se esfuerza por salir adelante. Yaneth  trabaja arduamente desde hace 06 años. Tiene  una tienda de abarrotes, en donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, su puesto le genera buenas ganancias económicas. Es así que abre las puertas de su negocio desde muy tempranas horas en espera de sus primeros compradores. Menciona que la clave de captar consumidores es atender amablemente y apoyarlos en sus compras. En su negocio le va muy bien ya que gracias a ello pudo adquirir más espacio de terreno para cultivar donde trabaja su amado esposo. Con el dinero comprará suministros en cantidad para su puesto de ventas. Con el tiempo, espera poder ampliar su vivienda y así agrandar su  bodega. Este es el crédito número 10 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que contará una vez más con el apoyo de los financistas para seguir creciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia participe y muy puntual en las reuniones. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles, podrá agrandar su  bodega comprando mercaderías.
texts.en:
Yaneth, 30, is a single woman who lives in a rented house and works hard to get ahead.  For six years Yaneth has been working hard in her grocery store, where she offers a variety of essential goods and earns a good profit.  She opens very early in the morning to receive the first shoppers.  She says that the key to attracting consumers is to treat them kindly and help them with their purchases.

Her business is doing very well and has allowed her to acquire more cropland where her beloved partner works.  With the loan she will buy more goods for her store.  In the future she would like to expand the house she lives in and make the store bigger.  This is her tenth loan through MFP.  She is content knowing that she can count on financial support once again and continue growing.  In her communal bank she is an active member and very punctual at the meetings.  With the 2,500 PEN loan she will increase her inventory buying more goods.

loans.use: To buy products to restock her store.

loans.name: Misael Francisco

texts.es:
El joven Misael es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su negocio propio, el vive con su hijo y su esposa. En el departamento de Choluteca, en el  sur de Honduras. Misael tiene más de 6 años de tener este tipo de negocio de venta de semillas de marañon. El  préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de marañón y el proceso de la misma. Misael de  esta manera  incrementara más sus ventas  y  también mejorara las necesidades y la  exigencia de sus clientes. El espera tener mejores  ingresos  para  tener  mejor  forma  de  vida. Los sueños de Misael es poner una procesadora  de  mayor  tamaño  para  poder  generar más  empleo familiar,  y de  esta manera   poder  darle  a su hijo  lo mejor.
Choluteca  Honduras - Abril del 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Semillas de Marañon para su negocio

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: A loan of $1,000 will help Manuel to send his children to secondary school.He hopes that by continuing his children’s education, they will have more opportunities and a better life.The money will be used to cover educational costs, including textbooks  and a backpack for his  daughter.

loans.use: To buy textbooks and a backpack.

loans.name: Esteban Alberto

texts.en:
Esteban is a friendly, entrepreneur and very hard-working person; 8 years ago he started his business because he did not have employment, besides he has had a family to which he needs to support. So he started to sell lunches on the streets, and this gave him very good result and allowed him increase his sales products. At the moment Esteban sells his products in some groceries stores, however his production capacity is limited.

He needs a loan of $475 USD to purchase raw materials that will allow him to increase the quantity of his production. To Esteban it is the unique job that he has and with this he obtains an income to cover all the family necessities, so that he requires your help and support.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Esteban es una persona amigable, emprendedora y muy trabajadora; hace 8 años inició su negocio ante el problema de no tener empleo, además de tener una familia a la cual tiene que mantener. Por lo que empezó vendiendo lonches por las calles, lo cual le dio muy buen resultado, esto le permitió aumentar los productos que vende. Actualmente Esteban vende sus productos en algunas tiendas de abarrotes, sin embargo su capacidad de producir es limitada.

Por lo que necesita un préstamo de $475 USD para comprar insumos, esto le permitirá aumentar la cantidad de producción. Para Esteban este es el único trabajo que tiene y con el que obtiene un ingreso para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, por lo que requiere de tu ayuda y apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Mrs. Julie A. is 32 years old, lives in the urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She studied the  fashion business for 6 years after which she opened her her busines in 1999. She is happily married with three children. She is asking for a loan of $800 for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines and materials

loans.name: Maria Belem

texts.en:
Maria Belem is the mother of three small children, 1, 2 and 10 years of age. She lives with her partner. In order to improve her children's quality of life she began a business out of her home renting videogames, then sold snack foods and soft drinks, products which proved popular. She is now asking for a loan of $200 to increase and diversify her inventory, and promises to repay the loan in 3-6 months. This is the time to help one in need. Maria needs your help to support her family and appreciates your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Maria Belem es madre de tres pequeños, de 1, 2 y 10 años de edad, ella vive en unión libre con su pareja. Para poder mejorar la calida de vida de sus hijos, Maria tuvo la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra por lo que inició rentando videojuegos en su propio domicilio, después comenzó a vender botanas y bebidas que tuvieron buena aceptación entre sus clientes.

Ahora para incrementar la variedad de productos que ofrece, Maria requiere un préstamo por $ 200 dólares, mismo que regresará en un plazo de 3 a 6 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesita, María necesita de tu apoyo para poder sacar adelante a su familia, y agradecen tu generosidad.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and snack foods.

loans.name: Faapisa

texts.en:
Working is Faapisa T.’s life. As a 26-year-old wife with one child, she works hard to provide for her family. Presently, there are not too many expenses as her child is only three years old. Faapisa's husband is the handyman. He helps grow the crops and does little jobs here and there.

Much gratitude goes out to S.P.B.D. for the loan that has enabled her to meet the business needs as well as buy equipment needed.

loans.use: Purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Zabil

texts.en: Zabil fled to Baku from the district of Khojavend in Azerbaijan. He is 33, married, and has one child. He has been engaged in his butcher business for eight years. He covers his family living expenses only from this business. He first borrowed $500 from Normicro and used it for buying sheep to expand his business. Now he wants to borrow another $500 to further expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 8 sheep

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 43 years old and has five children. She chose taxi-driving as her business because she believes it is a way to earn money fast. Her loan will be used to buy very expensive parts, such as tires. Her husband drives the taxi 6 days a week, during the daytime. She makes 100 Tala ($40 US) of net income per day and she continues to operate her business because of the financial support it has provided her family. It has especially helped with her children’s school fees. She hopes that her next loan will be used to repair her home, which is damaged, and replace parts for the taxi. She really appreciates the help she has received from the loan program and hopes to remain with the program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy auto parts for her taxi

loans.name: Bahri

texts.ru:
Bahri is a nurse in an emergency facility of a hospital. She is 56 years old. She lives with her mother and her grandson. She would really like to give her youngest son a wedding present. Her oldest son lives in Russia and can not send her money often. Bahri's salary is too small to make a large purchase by herself. This is why she turned to Microinvest for credit.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Шарифова работает медсестрой в Скорой помощи ей 56 лет. Она живет с матерью и внуком. Она решила сделать младшему сыну свадебный подарок, поэтому поводу обратилась в Микроинвест и посчитала это удобным. Так как старший ее сын находится в Росии, деньги отправляет очень редко. Ее месячная заработная плата не позволяет сделать крупные покупки.

loans.use: Consumer credit

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Mrs. Franca I. is 41 years old, married with two children and lives in Benin City. She sells frozen chickens and turkeys. She solicits a loan of $875 to buy more frozen chickens and turkeys for sale. She learned her business for 12 months and started hers in 2000. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more frozen chickens and turkeys for sale

loans.name: Dolly

texts.en: Dolly I. is a mother of 8 children and married. She is 42 years old. She has been a LAPO client for 8 years and is the secretary of her group. She sells moimoi to the people in her community and she has been in the business for 8 years, and learned it for 3 years as a caterer. She seeks a loan of $425 to enable her to buy more beans, groundnut oil and other ingredients for the preparation of moimoi for sale.

loans.use: To buy bags of beans, groundnut oil and other ingredients to make moimoi for sale

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap C. (pictured with sugarcane juice machine), 45, is a widow with three children; one son and two daughters. All of her children have been married. Her oldest daughter lives in a separate household and her second daughter and the youngest son live with her on Koh Dach Island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her second daughter is a hairdresser and her son sells sugarcane juice and meatballs around the village via his old motorbike.

Mrs. Sopheap is in the business of weaving silk. She learned weaving from her mother and started silk production 1981. She sells her finished products in her village.

She is requesting a loan for the third time in the amount of $500 to buy a motorbike to replace the old one for her son’s business.

loans.use: For purchasing a motorbike

loans.name: Salelavalu Uta Centre – Group 2

texts.en:
For these 6 women of Salelavalu Uta on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

The women are requesting the loans for the following purposes:

Faimafili O., 54, is married to a farmer and they have 8 children together. She will be using her first loan to purchase iron roofing, timber, nails and cement in order to build a food stall. At the stall, she will sell cabbages, coconuts, and other vegetables.

Gase S. (20, married, 1 child) wants to purchase a canoe, a pair of fins, fishing torch (flashlight), spear and goggles. She sells her fish at the Saelelologa market. Her keen knowledge of parts of the sea where the fish are located provides her with an edge over the competition.

Isapela S. (43, married, 4 children) intends to buy chemicals, a knife, and pots to sell potted plants, taro and bananas.

Manifo T. ( 19, single, no children) plans to use her loan to purchase iron roofing, nails and cement in order to build a shop to sell vegetables, coconuts, coconut oil and other products.

Malaine S. (26, married, 5 children) sells cabbages, tomatoes and cucumbers 5 days per week. With her loans, she will purchase seeds, weed killer, knives, a pick, a rake, a hose and other equipment to tend her vegetable garden.

Miriama T. (30, married, 5 children) creates Elei sarongs. Elei printing is a traditional Samoan method of fabric printing. She will make lavalava (wraparound skirt worn by men) using the sewing machine, plain sarongs; paints and x-ray films will be purchased with her loan.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, weed killer, bush knives, etc

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Soun K. is 57-year-old and her husband, Mr. Leng Sam Ay, is 47 years old. They both sell groceries and make about $2 per day. They live with their four children in Sneng Krabei Village, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia. Two of their four children are in school and two others work by shoveling sand for a private entrepreneur.

With growing family expenses, K. needs to expand her business to earn more income. She is seeking a loan of $250 to purchase more groceries for her business. This loan can help her to expand her business and improve her income so that she can pay for her children's school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Taimoe

texts.en: Taimoe H., 40, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the Taro, taamu, bananas and yams business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has had 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Taimoe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use her earnings to improve the business and pay for the children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and pesticides

loans.name: Alizadeh

texts.en: Alizadeh M. is a 47-year-old man who lives and works in Sabirabad. Since 2001, his main business activity has been selling fruit and vegetables in the local Sabirabad bazaar. Alizadeh has applied for a $1000 loan to expand his business and purchase more fruit and vegetables for sale. Fruit and vegetables are very popular in Azerbaijan. Expanding his business will help him to increase his income.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia D. is a thirty-one year old widowed mother of five children. She believes in hard work and dedication. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like fufu and banku. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantains and is taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. Afia needs the loan to enable her inject more working capital into her business to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to beat up cost. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase savings to support  two of her kids in school. She is a member of the community group called "Amen" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access a loan and provide support for members to repay. Afia's photograph was taken at her busy group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like maize,  cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a little daughter Anastasia who is only 2. She is an aspiring entrepreneur from Melitopol. Irina runs a kiosk selling household items in the central marketplace. Her enterprise is well-known for a flexible discount system she offers to her customers. Irina has always wanted to be self-employed. Her parents have been very supportive of the idea which is why she ventured to make her dream come true about a year ago. Presently, she is already making about $700 in net profit. She has $2000 in inventory.

Irina wants to keep her enterprise running to be able to provide for her family and support her elderly parents, too. She has many bright ideas she is hoping to implement along the way. Irina is a lively optimist and tries to mirror that attitude in her work as well. She is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan for 12 months and is hoping to repay the loan without any delinquencies. One of her personal wishes is to finish remodeling in her private house to make it a more comfortable place to live.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Eddy

texts.en: Eddy O. is 35 years old and is married with 2 children. He lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. The picture shows him standing with his wife and children. Eddy sells provisions and foodstuffs. He buys his goods from Benin City and Onitsha. He hopes to own a supermarket some day. He is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. He believes this will help to increase his profits. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru:
Алиева Малохат, 1972 года рождения. Начала свой бизнес с продажи женской одежды. У нее 10 лет опыта в предпринимательской деятельности. Она торгует на центральном рынке Гисарского района. У нее широкий ассортимент мужской и детской одежды, начиная с комплектов нижнего белья до одежды младенца и детей до школьного возраста. Это комплект мужского нижнего белья, джемпера, носки, детская обувь белье и т.д.. У Малохат есть мечта, увеличить товарооборот и получать большую прибыль Она хочет обновить свой товар и закупить сезонную одежду и обувь. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Малохат хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 2000 сомони чтоб закупить детскую обувь.
texts.en:
Malohat A. was born in 1972. She began her business selling women's clothing and has 10 years experience as an entrepreneur. She sells her goods at the Muboriz Gisarski district central market. She carries a wide variety of men's and children's clothing, from underwear to outerwear for babies and for school age children, as well as men's underwear, jumpers, socks, children's shoes, and children's underwear. Malohat dreams of increasing her turnover and making a big profit. She hopes to renew her stock and purchase clothing and footwear for the upcoming season. She buys her stock from the Korvon wholesale market. With the help of Kiva, Malohat hopes to take out a loan in the amount of 2000 somoni, in order to stock up on children's footwear.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of children's footwear

loans.name: Evila

texts.es:
La señora Evila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Tigresas”, ubicado en la Carretera Federico Basadre Nº 5800, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 52 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos mayores de edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como mecánico de motos. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en una peluquería. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta de plásticos y lencería, viaja a la cuidad de lima a comprar su mercadería para vender a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará ¼ de ropa interior, ½ decena de bandejas, 1 docena de jarras, etc.

Evila agradece a su familia por apoyarla en todo momento y al banco comunal por confiar en su persona.
texts.en:
Mrs. Evila belongs to the “Las Tigresas” Communal Bank , located in the Highway Federico Basadre Nº 5800, district of Callería, in the Colonel Portillo province of the Ucayali department. She is 52 years old. She is a mother of 3 children of age. She is married and her husband works as a motorbike mechanic. With the first loan of $97 granted by Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest it in a hairdressing salon. She has been working with the communal bank for the past 2 years. At present she sells plastics and lingerie, and she travels to Lima city to buy the merchandise she sells to her clients. With this loan of $325, which will be repaid over a period of 6 months, she will buy ¼ dozen pieces of lingerie, ½ dozen trays and 1 dozen pitchers, etc. Evila is grateful for the support her family has given her at all times and to the communal bank for trusting her.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ¼ dozen pieces of lingerie,  ½ dozen trays and 1 dozen pitchers, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Yom Soth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This is group loan. The fifteen members live in Damrei Chhlang Village in Kandal Province. Each will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Yom S. is a village bank president and is the group leader. She is 55 years old and the mother of four children. One of her children is employed at a garment factory while the remaining three attend the local school. Mrs. Yom S. is a farmer who owns a 1 hectare farm on which she cultivates rice for a living. However, she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds this season. She is requesting a loan to buy them. The loan will also allow her to buy more fertilizer and pesticides to increase her crop yield. Her husband, Mr. M. Gnoy, is a laborer.

This is a village bank loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main loan type. Borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Borrowers can repay portions of the principal earlier T. the end of the term if they are financially able, which most clients tend to do. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa K. is 53 years old. She is married with 2 children. Latifa is a devoted mother who struggles day after day to provide the best for her family. Fourteen years ago, she got the idea to start breeding sheep to contribute to the family finances, taking advantage of the space she had available in her house for this business. She is engaged in this business together with her husband.

Slowly the number of sheep increased and her customers started asking for more and more. With an endless list of requests, she has finally decided to increase the number of sheep she keeps and for this reason she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for a term of 15 months. Be an important part of the growth of Latifa’s business!

loans.use: purchase 10 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Gloria Eufemia

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Gloria Eufemia V. se dedica a su negocio de venta de mariscos los cuales son comercializados en su propio tramo con el propósito de mantener su núcleo familiar ya que requiere de su apoyo.

Hoy en día ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel por medio de un crédito para la compra de los mariscos y por este motivo es que espera que su crédito sea otorgado para de inmediato comprar dichos mariscos para continuar en su negocio en el mercado de Chinandega.
texts.en:
In the Central Market in the city of Chinandega, Mrs. Gloria Eufemia V. works selling seafood with the purpose of maintaining her nuclear family who now require her support. Today she has searched out support from Ceprodel by means of a loan to buy seafood and for this reason she hopes her loan is granted for the immediate purchase of wonderful seafood to continue in her business in the Chinandega market.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seafood

loans.name: Vacilia,

texts.es:
Vacilia ha trabajado por su cuenta la gran parte de su vida. Siempre se ha visto en la necesidad de buscar un ingreso económico propio para el mantenimiento de su hogar y en un principio, de sus siete hijos de los cuales, cinco ya son independientes.
Hace veinticinco años cuando recién se mudó a Huaycán  empezó a vender frituras en la calle, a veces ofrecía la comida que preparaba de casa en casa cuando aún el distrito no estaba muy habitado; sin embargo, la mayor parte del tiempo vendía en el paradero principal de su localidad. 
Hoy en día continúa con la venta de frituras, pero solo por las tardes. Por el día y en sus tiempos libres vende gaseosas y cervezas en su casa. Este último negocio ya ha cumplido diez años, y empezó a raíz de que la clientela iba a buscarla en su casa pidiéndole gaseosas, pues ya conocían su negocio en el paradero.
Ella se encuentra separada de su esposo, pero aun cuenta con su ayuda económica para el mantenimiento de su hogar y educación de sus dos menores hijos de veintidós y diecinueve años. Más adelante quisiera abrir un kiosco en la puerta de su casa para vender mayor cantidad de mercadería, por ahora no ya que hay mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Vacilia has supported herself for the majority of her life. She has always felt the need to seek her own income in order to maintain her home and her seven children, of which five are now independent. 25 years ago when she had just moved to Huaycan, she began to sell fried foods on the street, sometimes she would offer food that she prepared at home (even before the district became more populated). However, the majority of the time she would sell in the general area of her home. Nowadays she continues selling fried foods, but only in the evenings. During the day and in her spare time she sells soda and beer in her home. She has had this business for 10 years, and she started it with the customers that already knew her from the neighborhood. She now is separated from her husband, but still relies on his economic support for the maintenance of her household and the education of her two younger children, aged 22 and 19 years. In the future she would like to open a kiosk in the front of her home in order to sell a greater quantity of merchandise, since right now there is not much competition.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of soda

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan I. es un muy buen cliente que ingresó a nuestra institución el día 5 de junio de 2006 solicitando un crédito para apoyar su actividad de venta de ropa usada. Actualmente él trabaja con un crédito individual. Él y su esposa, la señora Leonor Juárez Mamani, trabajan mucho para criar a sus tres hijos con mucha dedicación y cariño. Ellos viven en la calle 6  de la zona Santa Rosa, popular zona de la ciudad de El Alto. Don Juan se dedica principalmente a la venta de ropa, como ser pantalones, chamarras y poleras. Y de esta manera Don Juan ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y correcta.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan I. is a very good client who joined our organization on June 5, 2006 when he requested a loan to support his business selling used clothing. Currently he is working with an individual loan. He and his wife, Mrs. Leonor Juárez Mamani, work hard to raise their three children with dedication and affection. They live on 6th Street in the Santa Rosa neighborhood, a popular area of the city of El Alto. Mr. Juan primarily works selling clothing such as pants, jackets and skirts. In this way, Mr. Juan has demonstrated that he is a very responsible and correct person.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy secondhand clothing such as jackets and skirts

loans.name: Abduraup

texts.ru: Абдурауп - молодой человек 24 лет, женат, но пока детей не имеет. У него среднее образование. После окончания школы изза финансовой проблемы он не смог поступить в Университет. Жена занимается производством и продажей козьей пряжи. Абдурауп занимается куплей дешевого молодого скота и откормив, через 4-5 месяцев продает скот. Таким образом он зарабатывает на жизнь, чтобы прокормить жену, и они готовятся стать родителями. Узнав у соседей что при помощи кредита можно расширить свой бизнес он решил взять займ. Абдурауп очень рад выдаче ему кредита. Он постарается использовать свой займ для получения большей прибыли.
texts.en:
Abduraup is a young man of 24, married, but has no children at the moment. He received a secondary school education, but due to financial difficulties, after graduating from school was not able to enter the university. His wife spins and sells cashmere yarn. Abduraup buys inexpensive young cattle and fattens them for sale in 4-5 months' time, and is thus able to make a living, enough to feed his wife. They are preparing to become parents. Having learned from his neighbors about using credit to expand his business, he decided to take out a loan. Abduraup is very pleased that he has been granted a loan, and he will try to use his loan to earn a good profit.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and sale of cattle

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura A. runs a beautiful salon at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with three school-aged children. She purchases the items needed for her salon from the wholesale shops in Kariakoo. She has been in the business for six years. The income generated from her business is used to meet the daily demands of her family as well as to pay school fees.

She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to expand her salon business.

loans.use: To expand her salon business.

loans.name: Muhsin

texts.ru: Мухсин Бобоев молодой мужчина 1987 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. У него неполное высшее образование. Мухсин учится на заочном отделении Таджикского государственного Университета. Мухсин занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Мухсин пришел брать кредит в первый раз. Мухсин надеется увеличить количество своего скота с помощью кредита. Мухсин благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Muhsin B. is a young man who was born in 1987. He is married and has one child. He has an incomplete high education. Muhsin studies in the Tadjik state university in the extramural department. Muhsin feeds and sells cattle and his wife processes and sells milk. Muhsin came to take out a loan for the first time. Muhsin hopes to increase the number of his cattle with the use of the loan. Muhsin is thankful to all our lenders for their help in realizing his plans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of cattle and milk processing

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio S., a 47-year-old father, is married and blessed with five children. He lives in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. He wants to start a new business, a sari-sari (variety) store.

Antonio, being a father and head of the family, decided to start a new business. He saw that the demand and market for a store is large, especially since their village in five kilometers away from the city. By applying for a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to PHP 5,000.00, he can now purchase the materials needed and the grocery items to be sold at the store. This loan will help them to have a good and comfortable living. This will be Antonio's first loan with HSPFI.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en: Jinky B. is from the town of Damayuhan, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old, married, and has two infant children. Jinky owns and operates a business selling different varieties of vegetables, selling through peddling in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Jinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell, like cabbages, potatoes, eggplants, string beans, squash and others. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell like, cabbages, potatoes, eggplants, and others

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora R. is from the village of Kinuman Sur, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, and is widowed with one adult-aged child. To make a living, Leonora owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Leonora joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Flor De Mariscal Group

texts.es:
Doce personas conforman la asociación “Flor de Mariscal, trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer  hace seis años en el centro focal Panamericana ubicado en  la ciudad de El Alto.
Varias son las actividades que realiza este grupo algunas se dedican a la venta de mantas, otras tienen tiendas de barrio, pero la mayoría del grupo tiene a los alimentos  como base principal de sus negocios, es decir; elaboran y venden comida, venden pan, papa, verduras y frutas. La asociación Flor de Mariscal afirma que necesitan generar mayores ingresos, ya que lo que obtienen no les alcanza para mantener económicamente a sus familias, para esto necesitan de créditos para comprar insumos en mayor cantidad.(arroz por Quintal, frutas de la temporada, harina y otros dependiendo el caso)
texts.en:
Twelve members make up the "Flor de Mariscal” Association. They have been working with Pro Mujer for 6 years in the Pan American community center in the city of El Alto.

The group is involved in a number of different business activities. Some members sell blankets, some own storefronts in the neighborhood, but most of them sell food as the mainstay of their businesses. These include preparing and selling bread, potatoes, vegetables, and fruit. The "Flor de Mariscal” Association claims they need to generate better earnings because their current incomes are not enough to support their families. For this reason, they need a loan to purchase supplies in large quantities (bags of rice, seasonal fruits, flour, and other items depending on the type of business).

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies & merchandise

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Kak J. sells onions and paste and is requesting a loan to improve her stock by purchasing more onions and cooking oil to sell.  She is 23 years old, married and her husband is a business man. They have three children who all go to school. Kak intends to build a house for rent in the future if there is possibility of extra profits from her loan amount.  

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more onions and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Aorng

texts.en: Mrs. Aorng S. lives in Roeu Sei Srouk village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Uk Bouy, is a car repairer. Since his business is doing well, he needs many car's accessories to fix the car for his customers. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Aorng S. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She is 53 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom are electricians while another is attending the local school and the others stay at home to do housework. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loa to buy car's accessories to fix the car for his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase red oil and other accessories.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Angélica es soltera, tiene 24 años y vive con sus padres, estudiante de Contabilidad en la universidad, Angélica junto a su hermana tienen una tienda de abarrotes en la casa de sus padres, donde vende frutas, verduras, carnes.
Angélica necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azucar.
Los sueños de Angélica son comprar una casa, ampliar su negocio y vender ropa por mayor.

loans.use: Para la compra de arroz, azucar.

loans.name: Mare

texts.en:
Mare C. is in the business of baking and selling bread and is requesting a loan to purchase more baking materials like flour, cooking oil etc. 

Mare is 31 years old and is married to a soldier. She has 6 children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a restaurant at the nearby market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more baking materials like flour, cooking oil etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the quantity and range of stock for her business.

loans.name: Salvadora Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora M. es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado mantener su pulpería haciéndola crecer poco a poco a medida que el tiempo ha venido transcurriendo. Ella habita en el departamento de León y a diario abre la pulpería desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Es importante destacar que ella viaja dos veces a la semana al mercado de la capital para realizar las compras y de esta manera continuar generando ingresos para el mantenimiento de su negocio y de su familia que depende de ella.
texts.en:
Salvadora M. is a hard-working person who has managed to keep her small general store growing little by little as time has gone by. She lives in the department of León and she opens her store for business every day from very early in the morning until nightfall. It is important to stress that she travels twice a week to the market in the capital to buy supplies to continue generating income to support her business and her family that depends on her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn C. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 28 years old. Jonalyn is single. To make a living, Jonalyn runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Jonalyn is just starting this business.

In 2009, Jonalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Jonalyn from ASKI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: José Osmín

texts.es: José Osmín M. de 40 años de edad, reside en San Marcos, en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Él posee una venta de papas en el mercado de San Marcos, lugar donde obtiene muy buenas ventas diarias. José desea poder comprar más verduras y así mismo poder surtir su negocio comprando frutas, es por esto que el solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda cumplir su sueño de poder vender más productos. José es un señor muy amable el cual agradece a Dios por contar con su propio negocio el cual le ha permitido hasta ahora suplir todas las necesidades de su familia y de esta forma poder pagarle los estudios a sus cuatro hijos, dos de los cuales ya  colaboran en el negocio, ya que son consiente de la importancia de que contribuyan con el negocio de la familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 40 years old and resides in San Marcos, Department of San Salvador. He lives with his wife and their 4 children. He has a business selling potatoes in the San Marcos Market, a location where he obtains very good sales.

Jose wants to be able to buy more vegetables and also, supply his business with fruits. For this reason, he is requesting a loan that will enable him to fulfill his dream of being able to sell more products. Jose is a very pleasant man who thanks God for being able to count on his own business, which has permitted him, up to the present, to supply all the necessities of his family, and in this form to pay for his 4 children's studies.
