She needs to increase the stock of these items before the rainy season is at its peak. During rainy season the supply of food from the "up country" is mininmal. The rainy season in the coastal areas of Tanzania is from March to June. She is in need of USD 750.

loans.use: to add Stock

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
For the past five years, Juana has dedicated herself to the manufacture and sale of tamales, a typical Mexican dish. Her product has been in great demand among her customers, and little by little she has increased her production to fulfill their orders. She started her business because of the need to pay for the education of her children, since her husband's salary is very low and doesn't cover all the necessities of the home.

Juana makes tamales for special events and banquets. Right now she needs to fulfill large orders and in order to invest in the supplies she needs a loan of $250, which she will repay over a period of 3 to 6 months. Your help will contribute to the growth of this business and the well-being of this family. They need you, and they are grateful for your generosity.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Desde hace cinco años, Juana se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tamales, este es un platillo típico de México, estos productos han tenido gran demanda entre sus clientes y poco a poco ha tenido que incrementar su producción para cubrir los pedidos. Ella inició su negocio ante la necesidad de pagar la educación de sus hijos, ya que el salario que recibe su esposo en su empleo es muy bajo y no cubre todas las necesidades de su hogar.

Juana elabora tamales para eventos especiales y banquetes, actualmente tiene que surtir grandes pedidos y para invertir en los insumos necesita de un préstamo de $ 250 dólares, que devolverá en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Con tu ayuda contribuyes al crecimiento de este negocio y al bienestar de esta familia, ellos te necesitan y agradecen tu generosidad.

loans.use: To buy supplies

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
Carmela is a very hard-working woman. She is single and she has a 15-year-old daughter, who is in school. She started selling jewelry 16 years ago, later she took a course to make traditional candies. She started her own business to be able to support her daughter and to have the resources to send her to school. Little by little she has been investing more in her business and thanks to the good quality of her products, she has managed to increase her sales considerably.

Now, she is requesting for a loan of $750 that she will use to buy the ingredients that she needs to make her candies. She hopes to increase her production and to cover all the orders that she has. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Help Carmela and her daughter, they are very grateful for the opportunity that you offer them to improve and to keep on growing with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmela es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene una hija de 15 años de edad, que se encuentra estudiando. Desde hace 16 años inició con las ventas de joyería, después tomó un curso de elaboración de dulces regionales y para poder obtener los recursos necesarios para el sustento y la educación de su hija inició su propio negocio, poco a poco ha ido invirtiendo más en su negocio y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos ha logrado incrementar sus ventas considerablemente.

Ahora esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para la elaboración de sus dulces, con lo que espera incrementar su producción y cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Decídete a apoyar a Carmela y a su hija, ellas agradecen mucho la oportunidad que les brindas de mejorar y continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy

loans.name: Etimad

texts.en: Etimad is a 28 year old resident of the town of Saatli. He is single and lives with his parents. He buys cattle, raises them and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. He has been engaged in this business since 1997 and is now quite experienced in this business. As cattle breeding is traditional in the nearby region, it can bring in a good income. Etimad wants to develop his cattle rearing business by increasing the number of cows. He is requesting a $500 loan to buy two more calves to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna has seven married children, and one child who is still single and living at home. When the children were young, the family lived on her husband’s earnings. Now that most of the children are married, her husband no longer works. They rely on a small pension that he receives which is not enough to cover their living expenses. Reyna therefore decided to start selling plastic products and now, between her neighbors and other acquaintances, she has a good customer base. Because she was often asked about clothing, she began selling apparel as well.

Unfortunately, she receives numerous orders that she cannot fill since she relies on any earnings she makes for living expenses. She is asking for a loan of $675USD, to be repaid over a six month period, to purchase more merchandise such as clothing and other items that her customers request. With your help we can improve Reyna and her husband’s standard of living, despite their not having stable work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna, es una mujer que tiene ya 7 hijos casados y uno soltero, quien vive todavía con ella. Desde que estaban chicos sus hijos la familia vivió de lo que ganaba el esposo, sin embargo ahora que todos sus hijos están casados, el esposo ya no trabaja y el único sueldo que reciben es el de la pensión con la que quedó, sin embargo con esta no les alcanza para vivir, por lo que Reyna se decidió a vender artículos de plástico, entre sus vecinos y conocidos, hoy ya tiene más clientela que poco a poco le hace pedidos, y la gente después fue preguntándole por ropa y hoy maneja las dos cosas.

Sin embargo hoy tiene varios pedidos que ella no puede surtir, puesto que vive al día con lo que gana, y está solicitando un crédito de US $675 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y así poder comprar mercancía como ropa de la temporada y artículos que ya le solicitaron. Con tu ayuda, lograrás que Reyna y su Esposo, tengan una manera de superarse y salir adelante a pesar de no tener un empleo estable.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell over the holiday season.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam K. is a dynamic 34-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Mariam is a farmer and owns a piece of land that her parents gave to her. She cultivates several vegetables, such as tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots and eggplants. Mariam sells her products wholesale in the markets of Sassandra, a rural city on the southwest Atlantic coast of Cote d'Ivoire. Mariam belongs to some women's trade cooperatives. She would like to acquire new equipment, such as watering cans, shovels and wheelbarrows.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural equipment

loans.name: Osawu

texts.en: Mrs. Osawu A. is 38 years old. She is married with five children and lives in Benin City. She sells foodstuffs. She learned the business for a period of 18 months, after which she started hers in 1992. She is soliciting a loan of $875 to enable her buy more foodstuffs for sale. She is a LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Busei A South E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Nuru Z.. She is currently in the retail shop business and is requesting a loan to increase stock in the shop. Nuru is 26 years old and is married with a husband who works as a farmer. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 12, and her children go to school. Each week, Nuru makes approximately UGX 35000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to bank the money and save it.

Nuru is joined in her small group by Zainabu N., Fida K. and Sania K.. Zainabu N. has a business in tailoring and wants to uplift the business. Fida K. is currently operating a business in tailoring and selling new clothes, and wants a loan to trade old clothes as well. Sania K. operates a business of retail shop and wants to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To stock more shop items and boost business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the range of  products she sells in her gift shop

loans.name: Amela

texts.en: Amela is 24 years old, a married woman  from the town of Zenica. Her husband  is a seasonal worker and he can earn  approximately  700 KM (about US$ 550).  Amela works at the market selling clothes. This is her first loan  in the amount of  US$ 1200 and Amela plans to use it to buy additional clothing for sale. Her goal is to invest the money in new clothes, and to earn additional money  for her and her husband.

loans.use: To buy additional clothes for re-sale

loans.name: Awura

texts.en: Awura P. sells soft drinks and mineral water. She is married and has two children. Business is going very well and she wishes to increase sales but she is running out of stock. She is asking for additional capital to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tofu

texts.en: Tofu L., 51, is divorced with 6 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the potted plants and flowers business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days per week. She has received 3 previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Tofu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will also use the loan to buy cement and timber for home repairs. Three of her children are assisting her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase new potted plants, fertilizers, tools and plastic bags

loans.name: Samiq

texts.en: Samiq Q. is a 32-year-old trader who has kept a food store in the small village of Imishli since 1998. His shop is located in a very good place near to the road. In addition to locals, other people who pass his store while traveling to other villages come to buy something from his store. Now Samiq has applied for 1000 USD to expand the inventory of the products he sells.

loans.use: To expand his inventory

loans.name: Señor De Luren Group

texts.es:
The Cangallo community is in the capital of the district. Most people grow fruit trees, but some also grow cereals.

Marlene sells clothing and small livestock that she sells at the Cangallo market. Marlene dreams of opening a clothing store, but right now her most important investment is in the education of her children. Marlene would like Finca Perú to teach her more about business and values.

Erika sells kebabs, and every afternoon she washes clothing in her home. Erika also sells vegetables on the weekends, and sometimes she buys and sells cereals. Erika would like to improve her family life, buying things for her home so that her children can have a comfortable place to live. Erika would like to save to expand her house. She’d also like to buy tools for her husband, who is a shoemaker. Erika says that before Finca Finca Perú, no institution has ever taught the people, or held their hands so that they can walk. She has learned that the best legacy that she can give her children is an education.

Lucydonia has a clothing store in Alcamenca. She also buys and sells cereals, as well as tara and suckling pig. Lucydonia was at a Finca Perú meeting in Huancaraylla, but she never thought that she’d also find a chapter in Cangallo. Lucydonia came to Finca through a friend, and now she is a partner. She’d like to build a house, own her own grocery store, and educate her children so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

La comunidad de Cangallo esta ubicado en la capital del distrito, esta comunidad mayormente se dedican a la producción de frutales, pero es poco la producción de cereales y la mayoría de la gente se dedica a este negocio

Marlene, se dedica a la venta de ropa, también vende animales menores los compra y lleva a la feria de Cangallo Marlene sueña con abrir una galería de ropa, por ahora lo mas importante es la educación de sus hijos. Marlene quisiera que Finca Perú le enseñe muchas cosas más, como valores y les eduque sobre los negocios.

Erika, se dedica a la venta de anticuchos, pero todas las tardes lava ropa en su casa. También vende verduras los días sábados y domingos, y otras veces compra y vende cereales. Erika, quiere mejorar su vida familiar, comprar cosas para la casa y ver más por sus hijos para que tengan un buen lugar donde vivir. Quiere ahorrar para poder ampliar su casa y comprar las herramientas para su esposo que es zapatero y necesita muchas herramientas. Erika dice: Nunca ninguna institución nos enseño y nos lleva de la mano para poder caminar, aprendí sobre las mejores herencias que tengo que dar a mis hijos es el estudio.

Lucydonia, tiene un negocio de ropas, ella vive en Alcamenca, y estuve en una reunión de Finca Perú en Huancaraylla, nunca pensó encontrar nuevamente a FINCA Perú en Cangallo, se enteró mediante una amiga y ahora es socia. Lucydonia, se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales, tambien compra tara y cochinilla. A Lucydonia le gustaría tener una tienda de abarrotes, hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales. Quiere ahorrar para poder construir su casa, hacer su tiendita y educar a sus hijos.

loans.use: The partners need different loan amounts. Some need 600 soles, some need 400 soles, for a total of 4,500 soles to the Community Bank.

loans.name: Hands Together Group

texts.en: This group is called Hands Together. Its members are Hawa F. and Kadiatu T.. They are petty-traders in Makeni City. These entrepreneurs have received previous loans from Kiva through SMT. Those loans have created significant impacts on the businesses and lives of these people.  Nevertheless, they want a new loan of Le 1,600,000.00 to further enhance their businesses. Hawa is the leader of this group. She is 30 years old, married with 5 children.

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Favour

texts.en: Favour O. owns a tailoring store. He sews clothes of different styles for people. His customers are both male and female. He is 35 years old and is married with four children. He lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Since the festive season is fast approaching, he is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more clothing materials for sale and also for sewing. He thanks all those that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials for sale

loans.name: Yory

texts.en:
Mrs. Yory C. is a farmer in Doeum Pring village in Kandal province.  Since her field is far from irrigation, and she does not have any irrigation to generate water for her field, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to water her crop.  With the rest of the money, she will buy rice seeds to cultivate.  

Her husband, Mr. Kuy Cheng, is a wedding chef who is able to make a small income to support his family.  Mrs. Yory C. is 50 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom help their parents in their current business, while the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy a pump in order to water her crop, and rice seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Juana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Juana pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 440, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda y madre de 4 hijos mayores de edad. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de ropa usada. Tiene 7 años trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con 2 motokar como herramienta de trabajo. Tiene el apoyo de sus hijos para el manejo de la movilidad.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 4 llantas, arreglará el motor, tapizará los asientos, comprará 6 focos, amortiguadores, etc.

Juana manifiesta que su familia es unida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ms Juana belongs to the community bank "La Positiva", located in Jr. Huancavelica Nº 440, district of Callería, in the province of Coronel Portillo, department of Ucayali. She is 62 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 adult children. With the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos for S/. 300, she invested in the sale of used clothing. She has been a member of the community bank for 7 years. She currently has 2 motorized carts which are a source of income. She has the support of her children, who drive the motorized carts. With this loan of S/. 3,000, which she will repay in 5 months, she will buy 4 tires, fix the motor, upholster the seats, buy 6 lights, shocks, etc. Juana says that hers is a close family. She thanks Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 tires, fix the motor, upholster the seats, buy 6 lights, shocks, etc.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi: Chị Lê Thị Huệ 50 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện nay ngoài chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị Huệ còn làm thêm nghề đánh bắt cá trên biển, đây cũng là công  việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.00đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để mua thêm dụng cụ  phục vụ cho công việc đánh bắt cá tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị Huệ is 50 years old. She participates in TYM fund since 2004. Beside raising poultry and some cultivation, she and her family also fish at sea, this is their main source of their income which amounts to 3.000.000 VND a month. This round of loan she is requesting 9.000.000 VND to buy fishing gear to catch more fish and increase their revenue.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fishing gear

loans.name: Johana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora de Nombre Johana Patricia G. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Johana tiene 2 hijas su edades son las siguientes su hija mayor de 17 años cursa el 1 año de estudios generales y su otra hija de 12 años cursa el 6 grado de primaria, sus propósitos con este nuevo crédito es de satisfacer su demanda ya que con ello depende su ganancia por consiguiente tiene que proporcionar el aporte económico al hogar   sus sueños son de adquirir una vivienda propia por que en la que habita actualmente es de su Mama su deseos es sacar a su hijas adelante por lo que su importancia es que sus hijas logren tener una buena educación para que proporcionen progreso para nuestra sociedad y al país.


La actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y ropa, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 9 años, Doña Johana inicia este negocio por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos ya que tenia a su familia a cargo y tenia que cumplir con la responsabilidad de proporcionarle a sus hijas lo necesario por lo que decide ofrecer ropa y cosméticos por lo que sus clientes eran trabajadores de oficina y  empresas locales por lo que decide incursionar en este negocio pero decide empezar con pocos productos como lo es camisas, pantalones y perfumes y es así como obtiene este medio de trabajo por lo que ahora necesita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que realizar compras en los diferentes departamentos por lo que no quiere perder a sus clientes por no ofrecer lo que estos le piden ya que su mayor interés es obtener mas mercadería para ofrecer.
texts.en:
Ms. Johana Patricia G. is 36 years old and single. She has two daughters, one of whom is 17 years old and has one year of general studies, while her other daughter is 12 years old and has six years of primary education. The purpose of this credit is to meet the demand that already exists since she depends on the profits of her business to support her home economically. Her dream is to acquire her own home because she currently lives in the home of her mother and would like her children to gain a better life. Getting a good education is an important part of her children's progress and for society and the country. Ms. Johana's economic activity is the roaming sale of cosmetics and clothes. She has worked in this business for nine years. Ms. Johana started this business because of the necessity of having an income stream to care for her family and to meet the responsibility of giving her children basic necessities. She decided to offer clothes and cosmetics because her clients are office workers at local businesses. She started with just a few products such as shirts, pants and perfumes and in this manner was able to obtain work. She now needs working capital to purchase products from different departments in the country, since she doesn't want to lose clients if she cannot offer them the products they request and her main goal is to obtain a greater variety of merchandise to offer them.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.es: Jorge Enrique R. S. tiene 66 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos. Todos sus hijos trabajan y tienen 38, 25, y 23 años individualmente. El negocio da inicio con el dinero que ha ganado vendiendo lotería, es por medio de este trabajo que logra establecer una pulpería en su vivienda. Ya que la administración de cada uno de los financiamientos ha sido provechosa para sacar adelante su negocio. Es por eso que solicita el monto de C$ 4.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses. Sus sueños son de ampliar su negocio para que pueda más adelante pueda proporcionarle a su familia lo que ellos necesitan con la ayuda de las diferentes organizaciones.
texts.en:
Jorge Enrique R. S. is a 66-year-old married father of three children. His children are 38, 25, and 23 years old and are all currently employed. He started his business with the money he earned from selling lottery tickets, which is how he was able to set up a general store in his house. Each loan that he has received has been beneficial in helping his business thrive. For this reason, he is requesting a loan for C$ 4,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas, which will be repaid in 12 monthly installments. He dreams of expanding his business in the future so that he can provide his family with everything they need with the help of different organizations.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Silvia  Elena

texts.es:
En el municipio de Cinco Pinos de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Silvia P. con mucho esfuerzo se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual posee desde hace tres años con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su hogar y brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias a sus hijos. Se dedica arduamente a asu actividad día a día y ha logrado salir adelante en su negocio. Ademas es importante destacar que ella posee conocimientos en la actividad de ganadería por lo que también puede desempeñarse en esta por medio de la crianza de ganado.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería ya que sus estantes se están agotando. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente y beneficia a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
For the past three years, in the city of Cinco Pinos, in the town of Chinandega, Mrs. Silvia Perez has dedicated herself and put all efforts toward a convenience store business. She wanted to able to provide support to her household and the necessary living conditions for her children. She works very hard everyday in order to make her business prosper. Additionally, it is important to mention that she possess cattle raising knowledge and she could work in this area as well. The reason she was lead to Ceprodel was to benefit from a credit line that could enable her to purchase merchandise to fill up her business' emptying shelves. This loan would greatly benefit herself and, specially, her family that needs so much support.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise purchase

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith A. is married and has 1 child. She has received schooling through junior high. Edith sells ladies' underwear, and also bakes bread for sale at Kissi in Elmina, which she has done for the last year. Her husband is a taxi driver. Edith uses her income to help her husband pay rent, utility bills, and other basic expenses of the family. Edith plans to use the loan as additional capital to enable her to increase the sale of ladies' underwear, and also the bread she bakes for sales to meet the increase in demand by her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Edith plans to reinvest in her business to expand her trade.

loans.use: Additional capital to purchase more ladies' underwear to sell and ingredients to make more bread to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel G. is 37 year old father of three children. Two of his children are currently in school. He is very supportive of his wife in taking care of the children. He has operated a tailoring shop for the past twelve years, and is currently training two apprentices in sewing to equip them with skills and experience for their future careers. He sews all sorts of male and female wear with various kinds of styles; executive suits, shirts, kabas and slits, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. He is very creative and always want to come up with new styles. 

He wants to use the loan to buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase output and efficiency. He also hopes to increase savings to support his kids through school.

loans.use: To buy more sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 28-year-old man who lives in the Bekaa region. Ali has owned a grocery store since 2000. Ali has requested a loan of $2,000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan.

Ali considers himself special because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Ali decided to start his business because he wanted to improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz R. is fifty-four years old and lives with his wife and three children. He owns a cattle-breeding business and has more than twenty years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Avaz has become a very successful businessman. His wife and son help with the business because their family is always trying to help one another. Avaz works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he has applied for a loan. With your help Avaz can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Mojeed

texts.en: Mojeed is 43 years old and married with three children. He sells VCDs (Video CDs) and building materials. He also has a phone booth. He is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more building materials and VCDs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials and VCDs to sell

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en: T. Jane is a hard working and bold lady who knows what she wants, no matter what. She is the leader of Kanyansheko Bakyara Twimukye group in Ibanda and a widow, with 7 children. All of her children are in O level school. She also cares for many relatives, although they do not stay with her. Jane has had a business of rearing goats for sale for 3 years, in Nyakigando village. The main business challenge is the failure to access drugs for her animals. She is able to make 50,000 UGX as profits per week, hence being able to look after her children. Jane is also a farmer, though on a small scale, and the food helps to feed her children and the excess is sold off for money. She has a dream of buying more goats and of growing more crops so as to turn into a modern farmer for more profits from more customers. She needs a loan to be able to buy more goats for her farm.

loans.use: Buying more goats for her farm.

loans.name: Matron

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Matron M. from Mbeya. She is married with one  2-year-old child.  Matron has been running a tailoring business since 2007. Her business is making different types of clothes.

She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week. Matron currently earns about US$50 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase additional stock of tailoring material. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of her business. Matron thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through microleasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of tailoring material

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
Los socios son un número de 16, ellos pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”, ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento del Cusco. 

Nuestros socios alternan sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, ellos requieren este capital de trabajo para invertir en sus diferentes negocios pequeños, ellos venden comida, algunos tienen sus stand en colegios y laboran en el recreo de los alumnos, otros solicitan para aumentar su negocios en el mercado de confraternidad, otras socias tienen un pequeño cafetín y tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual solicitan el préstamo.

Los socios agradecen y valoran el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
There are 16 members in the Señor de Puquin Community Bank, which is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province and department. The members have different small businesses. They need working capital to invest in their different small businesses. They sell food. Some of them have stands in schools and work at the students’ break time. Others are asking for a loan to increase their businesses in the fellowship market. Other members are asking for a loan for their small café and grocery store. The members are grateful for and value the loan given through this medium. They promise to make their payments according to the established timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Omotovo

texts.en: Omotovo is 49 years old and married with seven children. She sells drinks, wine and juice in her shop. She has been in this business for the past 15 years, and has been borrowing from Kiva partner, LAPO, for the past two years. Omotovo is requesting the loan amount of 150,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and juice to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Dicko

texts.en: Dicko J. lives in Gudele near the army baracks. She is 22 years old, married to a cashier in the Bank of Southern Sudan, and has five children. She retails in the bar selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan from Kiva in order to build a shop at the market. With the extra profits from her loan, Dicko is considering sending her children to school, paying their fees, and supporting them by providing scholastic materials like bags, uniforms and the many other requirements needed in school. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a shop for her alcohol sales

loans.name: Gricelda Antonieta

texts.es: La señorita es originaria de la comunidad de chiyax a un kilometro de la ciudad su principal fuente de ingreso es la elaboracion blusas, y delantales para damas dicha actividad lo aprendio de su querida madrecita hace diez años con una maquina sencilla hasta la fecha ha incrementado su produccion al utilizar una maquina ya moderna hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materilales, como tela, conos models forros ya que tiene un pedido por ser la fiesta del municipio y la cual ella quiere aprovechar esta ocaccion.
texts.en:
Gricelda is from the community of Chiyax, one kilometer outside the city. Her principal source of income is through the production of blouses and aprons for women. She learned how to do this from her mother 10 years ago with a simple machine, but now that her production level has increased, she uses a modern sewing machine. She currently needs a loan for the purchase of materials such as cloth and other supplies so that she can take advantage of an order she has for the upcoming town hall party.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Man

texts.en: Man R. is an older woman, 61 years old, and is the mother blessed with a daughter and a son. Two of her children are employed: her son sells baggage in the market and her daughter is a staff for an entertainment center. They also provide their income to contribute their family’s living expenses. Man R. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. To earn a living, Man R. sells Khmer noodle to her nearby neighbors who live in the village. Man R. will be using her first loan to help increase her son business capital. Note: Man R. was not available for photographing, so her son is shown instead.

loans.use: To help increase her son business capital

loans.name: Tobereh

texts.en: Tobereh sells poultry birds. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to be able to meet the requirements of her clients. She is 38 years-old and married with six children. She is hoping for a loan of  NGN 150,000 in order to purchase more poultry. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Mrs. Chann S. is a farmer in the Tuol Pong Ro village in Takeo province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In her farming, she faces a problem because her field is infertile, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to stimulate growth on her field.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pesticide to kill insects. Her husband, Mr. Thun Mab--on the right of the photo--is a duck breeder. Mrs. Chann S. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is staying at home because this child is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to stimulate growth on her rice field.

loans.name: Barbara

texts.es:
Bárbara vive con su esposo, quien es trabajador dependiente, ellos tienen 2 hijos, pero éstos ya tienen sus propias familias y radican en otros lugares.

Ella adecuó un espacio de su vivienda para vender comida y bebidas (sólo menú). Se decidió por este negocio debido a que está ubicada frente a una empresa constructora de yates, siendo los trabajadores de esta fábrica quienes acuden a degustar de su buena sazón. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 y lo que más le gusta es preparar platos al gusto de sus comensales y que éstos se sientan satisfechos.
Para el futuro, como un negocio adicional, le gustaría vender zapatos.

Con MFP ya tiene 14 préstamos y lo que más le de su banco  comunal es sus compañeros son personas muy trabajadoras y solidarias, además se entretiene mucho durante las reuniones de grupo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina, mesas y sillas; también adquirirá comestibles para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Bárbara lives with her husband, who is a sales clerk. They have two children who have their own families and live elsewhere. She modified a space in her house to sell prepared meals and beverages (menú only - a kind of prix-fixe, 2 or 3 course meal). She decided to go into this kind of occupation because she lives across from a yacht-building business and it is the employees of this place that love to eat her meals. She has had this occupation for the past 15 years and what she most likes about it is preparing dishes that her diners enjoy and that insures they leave satisfied. For the future, as an additional line of work, she would like to sell shoes. She has had 14 loans with MFP and what she most likes about her communal bank are her fellow members, who are very hard-working and cooperative. Besides, she enjoys the group meetings very much. The funds requested this time will be used to buy kitchen utensils, tables and chairs; she will also buy ingredients with which to prepare her meals

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture and utensils.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria D. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 40 years old. Gloria is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately PHP 300 daily for these activities.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Fe owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month. In 2007, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Fe is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Erdenesuvd

texts.en:
Erdenesuvd is a single mother who lives with her three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent called “ger”. Her oldest daughter, 19 years old, attends university and her younger daughter and her son, aged 10 and 7, go to a local secondary school.

Erdenesuvd operates a vegetable and dairy retail business in her town. She sells the vegetables that she grows herself. She plants a variety of vegetables in her fields such as potatoes, carrots, cabbage, onions, garlic, etc.

Erdenesuvd started her business in 1998 by borrowing 150,000 tugruks (~100 USD) from Xacbank, Kiva’s partner. In addition to her vegetable trading, she began selling dairy products two years ago. Over the years, she has been able to establish herself in the local business community.

Erdenesuvd is a hardworking and open-minded lady who is trying to better the quality of her children's lives. She says, “I am doing my best in order to provide a happy life for my children.” She is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase a large amount of dairy products to sell this coming winter season.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of dairy products

loans.name: Trinidad De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Trinidad de Jesús A. T., se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como cultivo de frijol y maíz, y al manejo de ganado bovino, la razón para la cual utilizara este financiamiento. Es para comprar una vaca parida de raza lechera, este cliente comenzó cultivando granos básicos como frijol y maíz únicamente en épocas de invierno, el trabajo lo hacía y lo continua haciendo con ayuda de su familia, el es casado tiene una esposa y 4 hijos quienes son menores de edad pero si ayudan por ejemplo: la madre cocina en casa y los hijos menores llevan la comida al campo o lugar de trabajo, este cliente todo el tiempo se ha dedicado a esta actividad de trabajo y actualmente continua haciéndolo sembrando frijol y maíz, con esto el espera seguir mejorando su actividad de trabajo y poder llegar a producir más y mejor en sus áreas de cultivos, con el ganado lechero aumentar la cantidad de ganado en su finquita, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos, produciendo y cosechando un grano básico alimenticio como lo es el grano del frijol y maíz producto muy importante en la dieta de los nicaragüenses y con el ganado lechero obtener y producir más leche la cual también es de consumo importante en nuestra dieta, esto le permitirá alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida más digna.
Don Trinidad de Jesús A. T. ha tenido 8 créditos  desde el año 2004 lleva 6 años de trabajar con Ceprodel.
El impacto y beneficios que ha tenido con los financiamientos  es bastante importante ya que le permitieron mejorar sus actividades de trabajo y también incrementar su hato ganadero lo que le han dado como resultado tener e ir mejorando su nivel de vida teniendo mejores ingresos lo que le ha permitido que sus hijos puedan estudiar y tener mayores oportunidades en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Sr. Trinidad de Jesús A. T. raises cattle and grows beans and corn. He is requesting a loan in order to buy a dairy cow. Trinidad began planting beans and corn only in the winter. He does the planting by himself and his family helps him with the rest of the work. Trinidad is married and has four dependent children who help his wife. For example, while his wife his cooking, the children are responsible for bringing in food from the field. Trinidad has been dedicated to agriculture his entire life and continues to plant crops of beans and corn. He hopes to continue improving in his work so that he can produce a higher quantity of crops that of better quality. In addition, he hopes to increase the number of dairy cattle on his small farm. Staples such as beans, corn, and milk are essential to the Nicaraguan diet and Trinidad hopes that producing more of these goods will help him achieve a better standard of living.

Don Trinidad de Jesus A. T. has been working with CEPRODEL since 2004 and has received eight loans over a six year period. The impact and benefits of these loans have been very important, since they have allowed him to improve his business. The increase in his cattle herd has improved his earnings, which has raised his living standards and provided his children with a chance to study and pursue greater opportunities for their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan Ramón C. tiene la edad de 46 años vive en la humilde comunidad  de San Caralampio es soltero pero tiene 3 hijos de las edades de 18 y 15 años los cuales estudian y le ayudan a su padre en los trabajos agrícolas, ya que este se dedica a la siembra de café y pitahaya desde hace 15 años y comenzó en el trabajo de agricultura gracias a un programa agrario, en el cual se integro a la cooperativa y consiguió los recursos para comenzar a trabajar.

Uno de los principales problemas que ha sufrido han sido los robos a sus cosechas que lo han golpeado en varias ocasiones, dentro de las planificaciones que tiene para sus tierras esta la incorporación de la siembra de la piña, pero necesita brindarle el mantenimiento optimo a sus tierras de tal manera que comprara insumos y fertilizantes, para la siembra posterior de las semillas de piña.

Agradecería se le apoyara para diversificar su cosecha, y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de toda su familia, así como el capital necesario para la inversión de otros proyectos.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón C. is 46 years old and lives in the humble community of San Caralampio. He is single, but he has three children between the ages of 15 and 18 who attend school and also help their father with the work around the farm. Juan has been growing coffee and pitaya (also known as “dragon fruit”) for 15 years. He began farming as a result of an agricultural program that allowed him to join a cooperative and acquire the necessary resources to get started.

One of the major problems he faces is having his harvested crops stolen on various occasions. For his next planting schedule, Juan would like to incorporate pineapple but he needs to maintain his land at an optimal level. For this reason, he needs to purchase supplies and fertilizers so that he will be able to plant the pineapple seedlings.

Juan appreciates the support in helping him diversify his crops, improve the conditions for his entire family, and acquire investment capital needed to fund other projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer & supplies

loans.name: Maria Flor

texts.es:
Maria Flor S. S. tiene 46 años, es casada, y vive con su esposo y 2 de sus 7 hijos.  Sale uno de sus hijos en la foto.

La socia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Mushuc Nan", la cual está en Quechua y en español significa "Camino Nuevo".  Es un grupo de 18 mujeres que trabajan en la agricultura.  Pertenecen a la comunidad de Guantug Cruz en el cantón de Guaranda.  Todas tienes buenas ganas de trabajar con créditos para poder salir adelante en su vida.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando mora, papas, maiz, frejol, y habas.  Vende la mora en la comunidad porque vienen unos comerciantes.  Siembra la mora todo el año pero más en el verano.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos, liquidos, y remedios para la mora.

Quiere que estudien los hijos y que estén preparados.  Maria les da ella misma los estudios a sus hijos y es dificil porque le absorbe mucho tiempo.

En sus tiempos libres, le gusta leer y estudiar la Biblia para aprender la palabra de Dios.
texts.en:
Maria Flor S. S. is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and two of her seven children. One of her children appears in the photo. She is a member of the rural service point "Mushuc Nan" which translates to "New Road". It is a group of 18 women that work in farming. They belong to the Guantug Cruz community in the Guaranda cantón (subdivision). They all are eager to work with loans in order to get ahead in their lives. Maria dedicates herself to farming. She plants blackberries, potatoes, corn, beans and lima beans. She sells the blackberries in the community to merchants. She plants the blackberries all year but does so more in the summer. She is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, liquids and remedies for the blackberries. She wants her children to study and to be trained. Maria herself teaches her children and she finds this difficult because it takes up a lot of her time. In her free time she likes to read and study the bible to learn the word of God.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers, liquids and remedies for blackberries.

loans.name: Santos Bernabe

texts.es:
el señor Santos Bernabe R. V. tiene 40 años de edad, trabaja como guardia de seguridad, tiene mas de 11 años de trabajar en esa empresa. esta solicitando el credito para construir un baño sanitario y una pila para almacenar agua en su casa de habitacion, con el salario que percibe de su trabajo pagara el credito. gracias a su trabajo a logrado ir construyendo poco a poco su casa de habitacion.
Santos es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales los tres estan estudiando. Su esposa le ayuda a cubrir con los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja en el area de limpieza en diferentes lugares.
su sueño es poder terminar de construir su casa y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Bernabe R. V. is 40, and he works as a security guard. He has worked for this company for over 11 years. He is asking for the loan to build a sanitary bathroom and to get a large recipient to store water at his house. He will pay the loan with the salary he is paid for his work. Thanks to his work he has been slowly building his house. Santos is married and has three children who go to school. His wife helps him cover the household expenses. She works cleaning in different places. His dream is to be able to finish building his house and to give his children a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build a sanitary bathroom and a large recipient to store water

loans.name: José Ruhdy

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a un hijo en el sector Tambo Real del distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar desde muy joven a la agricultura, actualmente posee un terreno de cultivo de una hectárea y media en el cual ha sembrado maíz, esta actividad es la principal fuente de ingreso familiar con la que cuenta por lo que trata siempre de dar lo mejor de si para sacar a su cultivo adelante. Adicionalmente José brinda servicio de yunta (arado impulsado por bueyes) las cuales alquila a sus vecinos para labores de labranza. Con estos ingresos el trata de sacar adelante a su familia.

José desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, aplicándole abonos y foliares, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

José es un padre bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es poder instalar un establo de producción lechera. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus pagos. En la imagen aparece junto a los bueyes que posee para ofrecer servicio de yunta.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old and the father of a family. He lives with his wife and son in the Tambo Real sector in the Pítipo district, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He’s been farming since he was very young and he now has a one and a half hectare plot of farmland, where he raises corn. This is the main source of income for his family, whom he depends on, so he gives his best to have a good harvest. José also offers oxen services (work provided by oxen) which he rents to his neighbors for farming tasks. He tries to move his family ahead with this income. José wants to maintain his corn crop by adding fertilizer, so he has seen the need to request a 2,000 PEN ($725) to help him meet his objective. José is a very hard working father, dedicated to his family. His greatest desire is to be able to add a dairy cow stable to his farm. He has worked with our institution in the past and has demonstrated that he is responsible and punctual with his payments. He appears in the photograph with the oxen he uses to provide oxen services.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Ernesto's Group

texts.en:
Ernesto D. F. Jr. is 52 years old and from the town of Sto. Domingo Echague. She is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is the Ernesto D. F. Jr. group.

Ernesto is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from serving local foods to customers in the local community. Ernesto has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ernesto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. As with her previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI which she has successfully repaid, this new loan of 9000 PHP will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This will be the third loan she has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and north-eastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Las Violetas Group

texts.es:
Hace muchos años  Teresa vendía diferentes tipos de comidas como son tamales, humitas, y demás variedades pero aun así no cubría los gastos en casa, pero como ella es una mujer muy optimista y trabajadora, invirtió su dinero en el negocio de golosinas que le resulto favorable, pudo pagar algunas deudas en casa, ahora desea invertir el dinero en la compra de gaseosas y nectares para surtir su mercadería.
Edita al igual que Teresa vende golosinas en la puerta de un colegio, Sabe que su arduo trabajo tiene que tener recompensa ella brinda las necesidades básicas a sus 4 hijos. Con su reciente préstamo planifica comprar una congeladora para mantener sus productos.
Los socias cursan el ciclo 11 y desean continuar con los préstamos. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
For many years, Teresa sold different types of food such as tamales, a similar dish called humitas, and other products, but she still was not able to cover the household expenses. But, as she is a very optimisitic and hardworking woman, she invested her money in a business selling candy, and this worked out well and she was able to pay some household debts.She now wishes to invest money in buying sodas and juice drinks to stock her business. Also note that Teresa sells candy at the entrance to the school. Know that her hard work must be rewarded so she can offer the basic necessities to her four children. With her recent loan, she plans to buy a freezer to keep her products. The members of this loan group are in their eleventh loan cycle, and they want to continue with the loans. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products and supplies

loans.name: Teresita's Group

texts.en:
Teresita R. is from the village of Olango. She is 40 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Teresita R. Group'.

Teresita is married and has 8 school-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. This will be the second loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Jealyn

texts.en:
Jealyn D., 26, is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two small children. She owns a half-hectare corn field and also runs a small  sari-sari (variety) store at her house. She also sells dry goods at the market together with her harvest of corn. Jealyn is a very active entrepreneur and has also started raising ducks. She hopes to maintain her businesses and keep balance in her family life.

Jealyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer for the corn field, feed for the ducks, and additional supplies for her store. This will be the second loan taken out by Jealyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and supplement her family's income. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Enh-Undral

texts.en:
Enh-Undral G. is 23 years old and lives with her family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her family operates a grocery business in their own container in the town. Her father is a truck driver and operates a transportation business throughout the province.

Enh-Undral began her business in 2004 with the help of her mother and has become very established in the many years since. She plants vegetables in the summertime in order to supplement her business earnings and has become successful in that endeavor as well. Enh-Undral is very modest and dreams of having a profession. She would like to expand her business even further in the future by building a greenhouse and a storehouse and is requesting a 1,945,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products and vegetables in bulk for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the harvest of fruit such as avocado, mango and cactus fruit (pitaya)

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita Z. is from the village of Baluarte, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Lolita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling electronic cell phone load credits and from selling home-made longganiza (sausage) and thirst-quenching refreshments like ice candies and halo-halo (shaved ice and milk dessert) in the local community. Lolita has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Lolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the third loan taken out by Lolita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Maria Jose

texts.es: Maria José, de 42 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. El arduo trabajo que realiza todos los días en su negocio como es la venta de mercadería en general, le ha traído buenos resultados. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hablar con sus clientes de los diferentes productos que le solicitan, ya que siente que sus esfuerzos están dando frutos, lleva más de 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es superara la competencia. Este es el primer crédito, sabe que tiene que poner todo de su parte y trabajar muy duro para pagar puntualmente sus cuotas con esto comprara calzado, perfumes, cremas y ropa en general.
texts.en:
Maria José is 42 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman, living in a house that she owns and whose biggest dream is to improve the quality of her life. She has obtained very good results from the hard work she does every day in her shop, where she sells various goods. What she likes the most about her job is talking to her customers about the different products they ask for, because then it’s when she feels her efforts are giving the best results. She has been running this activity for more than 6 years, and she considers facing competition to be the most difficult part. This is her first loan: she knows she has to make great efforts and work very hard to punctually repay her dues; the loan will be used to buy shoes, perfumes, creams and items of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José Luis, es un hombre muy trabajador, el trabaja en una empresa donde hacen tarimas de madera, el vive solo, ya que es soltero. El señor José hace poco tiempo pidió una casa de interes social, pero el quiere acondicionarla, para estar mas cómodo en ella.  Necesita construir una barda por motivos de seguridad para la casa, ya que el señor José Luis sale muy seguido de la cuidad ya que si trabajo así lo requiere, y la casa se queda sola en su ausencia, ya han entrado a robarle y no quiere que vuelva a suceder.
texts.en:
José Luis is a hardworking man. He works for a company that makes wooden flooring. He lives alone and is single. José recently got a house from social welfare, but he wants to renovate it so he can live in it comfortably. He needs to build a protective wall to make it safer. He is often away in the city or at work, meaning that the house is unoccupied for long periods. He is afraid that he will be robbed and does not want this to happen.

Translated from Spanish by Ross Forman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a protective wall

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma H. is from the city of Bagakay Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Gemma is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a transportation services business. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle in order to provide better transportation service.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem N., 54, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. N. is a housewife. Her two children are employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 4 each per day to help cover the family expenses.  N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase groceries to resell and to start a business at home. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. N.'s daughter, who work at the factory, appears in the photograph because N. was not available.

loans.use: To buy groceries to start a new business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 46 años, vive en casa de su suegra en compañía de ella y de su esposo Pelayo de 45 años y de sus 2 hijos que son mayores e independientes, juntos habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Siendo profesora en un centro educativo particular, tiene además otro ingreso económico que es la venta de productos de primera necesidad así como también vende algunos artículos y útiles escolares. Sus hijos la apoyan en la atención hacía los clientes, cuando ella tiene que salir a adquirir más productos; por otro lado elabora materiales didácticos hechos a base de corrospum (material micro poroso parecido al plástico), ya que los clientes fijos son sus colegas y alumnos del colegio donde trabaja. Manifiesta que le va bien en su negocio, pues obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Como es una mujer emprendedora en adelante tiene planeado surtir mejor su negocio ya que quiere ofrecer variedad de mercadería a sus clientes. Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete cumplir con sus pagos puntualmente pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. María tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en corrospum, pues tiene varios pedidos pendientes;  también algunos comestibles y útiles escolares  para abastecer mejor su negocio.
texts.en: 46 year old María lives in her sister-in-law's house along with her sister-in-law and her husband, 45 year old Pelaya, and their 2 children who are grown-up and independent. They live together in a crowded neighborhood to the north of the city. She is a teacher in an education center and gets additional income from selling staple goods and some other items and school supplies. Her children help her attend to her customers when she has to leave to buy more goods. She also makes decorations from corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic.) Her regular clients are colleagues and students at the school where she works.  She says that her business is doing well and she is making a good profit that enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. As she is a hardworking woman, she has future plans to better supply her business so that she can offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers. This is the 10th loan that she has had from MFP and she promises to make her repayments punctually as she does not want to be in bad standing with the people who have made this loan possible and enable her to keep working towards greater success. María plans to use the loan to buy corrospum supplies as she has various orders in hand. She will also buy some food and school supplies to better stock her store.

loans.use: To add products to supply her store, also to buy corrospum (a plastic-like material) to make decorations.

loans.name: Jazmín Amparo

texts.es: La Sra. Jazmín Amparo C. H.  ella es Trabajadora activa de la Alcaldía Municipal de San Rafael del Sur  desempeñándose como Secretaria tiene un año de trabajar en esta institución, tiene dos hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y mejorar su casa de habitación, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Jazmín Amparo C. H. is an active worker in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur where she has been working as a secretary for a year. She has two school-aged children. Jazmin has had two loans with field partner CEPRODEL and she has used each one to buy building materials to improve her home. The loans from CEPRODEL have benefited her greatly because she has improved living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: Buy sand, cement and stone quarry.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Eduardo, de 26 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, que convive con Cecilia, de 22 años, ambos tienen 2 hijos, Sarai, de 5 y Tany, de 2 años, los cuatro viven en su casa propia ubicada en la zona rural de Santa Clara. Sus planes futuros, son adquirir terrenos agrícolas propios, por ello, hace 5 años que viene trabajando con ahínco en sus terrenos alquilados, donde siembra, papa, arveja, habas y demás hortalizas, las que después de cada cosecha las comercializa, en el mercado central de la ciudad de “Tarma”. Cada cosecha, producto del esfuerzo, de Eduardo, le brinda buenas utilidades, con las que, gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal, cada día esta ahorrando y ya le falta muy poco para obtener su propio terreno, con ello augura tener más ganancias y poder comprar muchos más. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y agradece las enseñanzas bridadas por los miembros de su entidad, los que le impulsaron a salir adelante y pensar en el futuro. Con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará abono orgánico, que esparcirá en la papa de la variedad “arenosa”, que cosechará en estos meses, asimismo comprará semillas de arvejas.
texts.en: 26 year old Eduardo is a cheerful and hardworking man who lives with 22 year old Cecilia. They have 2 children, 5 year old Sarai and 2 year old Tany, and the four of them live in their own home located in the rural area of Santa Clara. Their future plan is to acquire their own farm land. For 5 years they have been working hard on rented land where they sow potatoes, peas, beans, and other vegetables which, after each harvest, they sell in the central marked of the city Tarma. Each harvest is a result of Eduardo's hard work and brings him good profits which, thanks to the support of the community bank, he is saving up. In very little time he will be able to buy his own land. He predicts that this will bring him greater income and he will be able to buy much more. This is his sixth loan from MFP, and he is grateful for the lessons offered to the bank members which motivate him to be successful and think of the future. He will use this loan to buy organic fertilizer which he will apply to his "arenosa" variety potatoes which he will be harvesting in the coming months. He will also buy pea seeds.

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy American rice, oil, beans and sugar

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen belongs to Lahore which is the 2nd largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. She lives there in the area named Mughalpura in a 2-room brick house with her family. She came here after her marriage. She is 48 years old, married to A. M., and has a son who is 27 years old and works in a school for a little income. 

Her husband is a waiter in a restaurant, while Nasreen operates her sewing business at her home to supplement the income of her family. She is an expert in her work and can sew every designer's clothes. Due to her quality work, she gets regular orders from her neighboring clients and generates income for the family. Her income allows her to pay off the utilities expenses of her family.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete the orders even faster and allow her take more orders in a month. Her old sewing machine is very slow in producing quality work. She started this business 3 years ago and is hopeful that through this investment she will be able to improve her business further.  She has a desire to marry off her son soon, and she is hopeful that she will be able to buy the dowry of his marriage from the loan profit. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 5th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with a hand raised is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.fr: Alphonsine N. a 50 ans, elle est veuve, et elle a 6 enfants entre 16 ans et 15 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans d’école primaire, et 3 de ses enfants vont a l’école.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour renouveler sa maison en nouveau charpente, sable, et ciment.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de valoriser de plus sa maison pour élever les revenus qui viennent de la location.  Elle voudrait continuer sa carrière jusqu'à l’âge qui lui obligera de se reposer (elle est agent d’IMF).  Elle voudrait aussi payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants jusqu’au niveau, et assurer le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en: Alphonsine N. is 50 years old and is a widow with 6 children between the ages of 16 and 15 years. She completed 4 years of primary school, and 3 of her children go to school. She is going to use her loan to repair her house with a new frame, sand and cement. Her strategy for the growth of the business is to make her house attractive in order to increase the revenue that comes from renting it out. She would like to continue her career until the age at which she will be obliged to retire (she is an IMF official). Alphonsine would also like to pay the educational expenses of her children and assure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: Repairing her house with a new frame, sand and cement.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: The purchase of 8 boxes of DVDs

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
