Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Don Evelio trabaja desde hace muchos años con el ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Evelio M. J., age 40, is married and has two children who are his greatest priority. One child is 7 years old, the other 4. The loan that he wants is for the purchase of a cow. His idea is to have more, better quality animals on his farm. He wants to take good care of his cattle in order to obtain the best income possible when he sells them.

This is the first time he has had a loan with FUDESCOR, and he is very happy with the services that have been provided. Don Evelio has worked with cattle for many years. He hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more stable income in the future and to continue improving as a person and as a farmer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a cow.

loans.name: Khalida Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Khalida parveen is a 40-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in a city named Borewala (famous for its shrines) in Pakistan. She owns a small two-roomed house and has been living in it with her family for over twenty-years. She is a caring mother as well as a caring wife. She performs her duties very efficiently. She stays at home and gives proper attention to her kids. Although she is not educated, she sends her kids to school so they can make their future bright and judge the good or bad in their own lives. 

Her husband is involved in a dairy business. He purchases milk from the milk shops and sells in the community. He gets up early in the morning and goes to the milk shops for purchasing the milk. He works hard to manage the financial expenses of its family. By going to milk shops for purchasing milk, it affects his earnings. Therefore, Khalida has decided to apply for a loan from Asasah to purchase a dairy cow. This will allow her husband to get the milk directly from the cow and sell it to the required customers. They hope that, if they earn a good profit, they will be able to purchase another dairy cow and then open their own milk shop and provide milk to their customers.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for selling milk.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is from the town of Banga. She is 53 years old. Josephine is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising and selling "tilapia" (St. Peter's fish) and "hito" (catfish) to the market. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over 20 years.

Josephine joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional fish to sell

loans.name: Duong Nhan 1-2 Group

texts.en:
Ngu D. N. was born in 1959. He lives in Duong Nhan village, Xuan Non commune. He is a farmer. He has two sons. 

He not only grows rice and raise pigs, he also catches fish to sell. He has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 Vietnam dong (VND). 

His life is difficult. So, he has to work hard to earn money. He has punctually participated in SEDA (a Kiva partner) since 2007. He feels happy because he can save money weekly. In this loan cycle, he would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND in order to buy food for pigs.
 
About the other borrowers in his group: 

Thach T. N. was born in1970. She has two children (a girl and a son). She breeds pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She would like to borrow 4,142,000 VND in order to invest in livestock.

Thuy T. N. was born in 1965. She raises pigs. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND. She would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: To buy food for pigs

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs. H. is a middle-aged woman whose husband is shown in the photo. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham where she makes a living raising pigs and crops on her land next to her house. She raises pigs in order to raise their offspring for meat and she plants crops for the dual propose of eating and selling.

Since the beginning of 1999 up to the present, she has done work in this sector with great success. H. is taking out this loan to purchase fertilizer and crop seed to use on her field during the season that is possible for growing.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and crop seed to use on her field.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia D. is from Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Aurelia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Aurelia owns & operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Aurelia is just starting this business. Aurelia's previous business was food vending and, with her husband, managing a motorcycle used to transport passengers in the village.

In 2009, Aurelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Aurelia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Aurelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS MILAGROS DE CHIMPAHUAYLLA”; La socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en Chimpahuaylla la provincia  y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Noemi; ella tiene 35 años de edad y la socia es madre soltera, su pareja la abandonó por otra mujer, ella tienen 2 hijos y desde entonces es madre y padre para sus dos pequeños hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con sus dos trabajos, ella trabaja en una fábrica de lácteos en el distrito de Oropesa situado a 20 minutos de su barrio; La socia también se dedica a vender granos secos para la venta los fines de semana en el mercado vino canchón, ella vende  (maíz de diferentes variedades, pallares, cereales, frijoles, lentejas, entre otros productos secos.), La socia desea juntar dinero para los estudios de sus hijos y darles a ellos una mejor calidad de vida, ella también quiere comprar muebles y mejorar su casita; La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos.

La  socia valora y agradece el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer y tener una mejor calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Noemi belongs to the “Señor de los Miagros de Chimpahuaylla” Communal Bank, and lives in the San Jerónimo district of Chimpahuaylla province, Cusco district. She is 35 years old and a single mother, her partner having abandoned her for another woman. Noemi has 2 children and since being abandoned, has been mother and father to them both. She alternates her household activities with working in a dairy plant in the Oropesa distract, some 20 minutes from her barrio. Noemi also sells dry grains on weekends in the Vino Canchón Market. She sells different varieties of corn, and harvests of cereals, beans, and lentils, among other dry products. Noemi wants to accumulate money for her children's studies and to provide them with a better quality of life. She also wishes to buy furniture and improve her little house. Noemi is soliciting a loan to buy dry grains to sell. She values and appreciates the offered loan, since it will permit her to grow and have a better quality of life, and she promises to comply with the schedule of payments.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING DRY GRAINS TO SELL

loans.name: Esvelia

texts.es: Esvelia de 48 años, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su hijo y su madre anciana. Es profesora en un colegio que queda dentro de su localidad, por lo que durante todo el día trabaja, además su hijo estudia hasta muy tarde, es por ello que ha decidido alquilar su casa a  un grupo de profesoras que instalaron un nido para niños de 1 a 3 años, desde entonces lleva 4 años percibiendo estos ingresos, que es importante para la economía de su familia.  Esvelia se siente muy satisfecha por lo rentable que le ha resultado este negocio, y por tal motivo desea restaurar las paredes de su inmueble para ofrecer mayor comodidad y seguridad a sus inquilinos. Es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este crédito le será muy útil, por lo que se compromete pagar sus cuotas oportunamente. Esvelia tiene planeado invertir el crédito en la compra de materiales de construcción, de ese modo seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
Esvelia is 48 years old and lives in her own home along with her son and elderly mother. She is a teacher at a school located in her area. During the day she works and her son goes to school until very late. Because of this, she decided to rent out her house to a group of teachers who run a daycare for children from 1 to 3 years old. For the past 4 years she has received income from this, which is important for the family´s economy. Esvelia is quite pleased with how profitable the business has turned out to be. For this reason, she would like to fix the walls of her house so that she can offer more comfort and security to her renters. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows the loan will be very useful and promises to pay the installments on time. Esvelia plans to invest the loan in the purchase of construction materials, thereby continuing to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina Q. is from the village of East Pob., Rizal. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Cristina runs a grocery store. She has been operating her business for more than five years and earns a monthly income of 2,500 PHP.

In 2006, Cristina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Cristina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the ninth loan that Cristina has taken out from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for the business

loans.name: Everly

texts.en:
Everly L. is from the village of Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 24 years old. Everly is married and has one infant. To make a living, Everly owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice in the local community. Everly has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Everly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Everly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional rice to sell. Everly is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Everly from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita T. is from the village of Panay, Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Emerita is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Emerita owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating service-based services. Emerita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emerita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emerita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,500 PHP from GDMPC. Emerita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Emerita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Don Bosco Group

texts.es:
Zenón participa más de tres años en la alcancía comunal DON BOSCO, los ocho integrantes son personas responsables y muy esforzadas en sus negocios; darles lo mejor a los suyos es su objetivo principal además de otros.
Zenón es un pensionista que trabajó muchos años en la mina, con el dinero que recibió de su liquidación compró un terreno que construyó años más tarde además adquirió un carro con el propósito de alquilarlo, al principio le iba bien en este negocio pero después tuvo que venderlo debido al choque que sufrió su vehículo, la reparación era muy costoso; así que esta vez compró una motocar el cual no ha tenido problemas hasta el momento, mensualmente de da mantenimiento. Los ingresos del alquiler de este bien cubren los gastos de alimentación para su familia y parte de educación a su nieto quien actualmente es ingeniero mecánico. El préstamo será para invertirlo en un pequeño taller electrónico que acondicionará en su casa, donde lo ayudará su hijo. Aquí se arreglarán celulares, radios, computadoras entre otros.  Se necesitará para invertir en comprar accesorios y repuestos para estos equipos.
texts.en:
Zenón has participated in the Don Bosco Communal Bank for over three years.  The eight members are very responsible people who work very hard in their businesses.  Their main objective, among others, is to give the best of themselves to their loved ones.

Zenón is a pensioner who worked in the mine for many years.  With the money that he received as severance pay he bought a piece of land, which he built on.  Later, he also got a car with the intention of renting it.  At first this business went well for him.  Later, he had to sell it because of an accident with his vehicle.  

Repairing it was very expensive.  Therefore, this time he bought a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle).  So far he has not had any problems with it, and he performs maintenance on it every month.  The income from renting it is good.  It covers his family’s food expenses. It also pays for part of the education of his grandson, a mechanical engineer.   

The loan will be used for a small electrical shop that he will set up in his house, where he will help his son.  That is where they will fix cell phones, radios, and computers, among other things.  He needs the loan to buy accessories and replacement parts for this equipment.

loans.use: To buy accessories and replacement parts for mobile equipment and other things

loans.name: Magaret Aba Bentsiwah

texts.en:
Magaret Aba Bentsiwah K. prepares doughnuts for sale at Abura. She is married to a plumber and has seven dependents. She has been in this business for some time now. She assists her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her dependents. The loan will help her to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her dependents.

At the time of visit, Magaret had yet to prepare the doughnuts and so is showing us the flour she is going to use.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Celso Jesus

texts.es:
Celso es un  hombre muy dedicado a su familia, como todo padre tener una casa digna ha sido su anhelo.
Trabaja como conductor desde hace varios años, con su ahorros ha venido mejorando su casa y ahora con el financiamiento de Afodenic logro levantar paredes de concreto. 
Hoy con este nuevo préstamo hará un muro, ya que tiene cerrado con zinc, pero una parte está en mal estado por tal razón levantara el muro, y lograr mejor seguridad para su terreno como mejor seguridad para su familia. Lo que comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros materiales para comenzar esta mejora. contento porque se ha hecho posible la obra.
texts.en:
Celso is a man who is devoted to his family.  Like any father, to have a proper home has been his dream.

He has worked as a driver for several years.  He has been using his savings to gradually make some home improvements.   Now, with financing from Afodenic he was able to erect concrete walls.

Now he will use this new loan to build a wall because he currently secures his property with zinc metal but part of it is in bad shape so he will erect a wall to get better security for his property and family.

He will buy building materials and supplies like: stone, sand, cement and iron rods, among other supplies to start this project.  He is happy because the project is now possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies to erect a wall which will lead to better security for his family.

loans.name: Diro Enrique

texts.es:
En el Carmen,  un municipio   ubicado   al pié del valle denominado “Montes de María”, en el centro del  departamento de Bolívar, tierra que con los ojos del  amor inspiró a   lucho Bermúdez para componer el mas bello   Porro que lleva su nombre, es el sitio donde vive y tiene su negocio Diro Enrique, y que desde hace ocho (8) años inició, aprovechando un espacio donde construyó su local hoy un estadero donde vende refrescos bebidas y también tiene un billar que aglomera a gran parte de la población cuando se trata de divertirse sanamente; él es un hombre viudo con tres hijos en las edades de 18, 22 y 26 años que estudian sus carreras técnicas y universitarias a  base de esfuerzo y  dos de ellos trabajan simultáneamente.
Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el planea comprar unas mesas de billar, bebidas por cajas y realizará reparaciones locativas  en su local comercial. Planea con esta inversión generar mayores ingresos porque con mas mesas sus clientes no necesitan esperar para jugar, teniendo en cuenta que se acercan las vacaciones de final de año, se incrementan clientes oriundos del pueblo y también  turistas  que  se aglomerarán en su negocio y se aumentan las ventas de productos y servicios, en especial en el local de Dirio que está en un corredor comercial concurrido que todo el pueblo conoce, alrededor del cual hay muchos negocios como tiendas panaderías y ferreterías.
Su sueño es ver a sus tres hijos realizados como profesionales exitosos y también lograr que su negocio esté provisto de aire acondicionado para ofrecer confort a sus clientes.

El  mayor desafío que ha enfrentado Diro en su vida,  ha sido la muerte de su esposa, hace apenas seis meses  por eso  aun se encuentra en proceso de duelo, pues fue de una manera intempestiva y ella era su mayor soporte emocional, en el negocio y en el hogar en especial en todo lo relacionado con el apoyo  de sus hijos ; así que toda la familia la extraña .
texts.en:
El Carmen is a municipality located in the valley called “Montes de María,” in the center of the department of Bolívar, a land which inspired Lucho Bermúdez with the eyes of love to compose the beautiful "Porro" which carries his name. This is the place where Diro Enrique lives and operates his business, which he started eight (8) years ago. Taking advantage of the space where he started his business, today he has a game room where he sells drinks and also has a pool room that brings together a large part of the local population for healthy entertainment. He is a widower with three children, aged 18, 22 and 26, who are studying for university and technical degrees thanks to his effort, and two are also working at the same time. 

This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and he plans to use it to buy several pool tables as well as drinks by the case, and he will also carry out some repairs to his place of business. With this investment, he plans to generate more income, because with more pool tables, his customers will not have to wait to play. Taking into account that the end-of-year vacations are approaching, there will be more local customers from the area and also more tourists who will gather in his shop, increasing his sales of products and services. They will come especially to Diro's business, because it is located in a busy commercial corridor known to everyone, surrounded by many businesses such as bakeries and hardware stores. 

His dream is to see his three children become successful professionals and also to equip his business with air conditioning, to offer more comfort to his customers. 

The greatest challenge Diro has confronted in his life has been the death of his wife, just six months ago. He is still in the grieving process, because it was an untimely loss and she was his greatest emotional support, in the business and especially at home with everything concerning the support of his children; because of this, the whole family misses her.

loans.use: Buying some billiard tables and soft drinks by the case, and carrying out some repairs at his place of business

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.fr: Consieu K. est commercant de cabaret (bar), et il est un membre du groupe Tuzamurane.  Il a 63 ans, il est marie, et il a 3 enfants entre 32 ans et 36 ans.  Son niveau d’éducation est 3 ans d’école secondaire.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour son commerce de cabaret.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est de bien attire les clients.  Il voudrait arrive a un niveau ou il peut demander même plus qu’un million RWF.  Il voudrait aussi la progression de la famille et de sa cote financière.
texts.en: Consieu K. is a ‘cabaret’ (bar) owner and a member of the group Tuzamurane.  He is 63 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 32 and 36.  He has three years of middle school education.  He is going to use his loan for his cabaret.  His strategy for business growth is do a good job attracting customers.  He would like to reach a level at which he can ask for more than even 1 million RWF.  He would also like his family to progress, as well as his finances.

loans.use: A 'cabaret' business (snack bar)

loans.name: Tomasa Esperanza

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer emprendedora, mayor de edad, con una hermosa familia. 
Hoy en día labora como conserje, en donde su objetivo ha sido la construcción de su casa. Que ha venido mejorando a través de los financiamientos que la institución ha dado durante diez ciclos.

Hoy con este nuevo crédito, comprara laminas de zinc y cambiar las que están en mal estado.
Contenta porque cada día logra el objetivo de estar en mejores condiciones de vivienda.
texts.en: Tomasa is an enterprising woman, older, with a beautiful family. She currently works as a custodian. Her goal has been to build her home, and she has been improving it through the loans that the institution has given her through ten cycles. Now, with this new loan, she will purchase zinc laminates and change the parts that are in bad condition. She is happy because every day she is achieving the goal of being in better living conditions.

loans.use: she will purchase zinc and other materials to change the roof of her home

loans.name: Yuri Vanessa

texts.es:
Yuris, de 27 años de edad, reside en Usulután, donde vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos de 11 y 13 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida y tortillas, el negocio de comida tiene 3 años de existir  y las tortillas hace un año, este negocio es el único con que cuenta para trabajar y obtener ganancias para aliviar las necesidades del hogar.
Ella tiene por el momento dificultades económicas para hacerle una inversión al negocio,  por lo que solicita un préstamo para que a través de este pueda fortalecer el área de alimentos para preparar  los platillos diarios en el negocio, ya que en este momento debe comprar verduras, carnes y otros que le son necesarios pero no cuenta con los fondos, ella espera que con esta inversión pueda aumentar su producción de alimentos.
Su principal objetivo es mantenerse activa en el negocio ya por su trabajo puede ayudar a sus hijos y estar al pendiente de sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Yuris is 27 years old and lives in Usulután in her own home with her two children, ages 11 and 13.  She sells prepared food and tortillas.  She has been selling food for three years and tortillas for a year.  This is the only job she has and the only way to earn an income to supplement household expenses.

She is currently undergoing economic difficulties and unable to invest in her business and is therefore requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare the meals she sells on a daily basis.  She needs to buy vegetables, meat and other basic products but does not have the money to do so.  She hopes that with a new investment she can increase food production.

Her main goal is to stay active in her business and continue helping her children with all of their basic needs.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for food sales

loans.name: Thès Jarrel

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 26 ans, célibataire avec 1 enfant avec son niveau secondaire, il se lance dans le commerce général en 2007.
Il commence très tôt et fini tard, son lieu d’activité est à un carrefour des taxis/ bus.
Avec un capital de 150.000f, il  a voulu ajouter une machine à glace, en épargnant pendant le premier prêt,

Ses revenus sont compris entre 35000f et 40.000f par jour, il va augmenter cette mise en achetant : 1carton de lait en poudre, 1carton de sardine à huile, 1carton de mayonnaise, 2carton de spaghetti, 25litres d’huile, les bonbons, biscuits, savons de lessive, savons en poudre, javel….
 Pour l’amélioration de ses conditions de vente, 

Sa stratégie est d’ouvrir tôt pour être fidèle à ses clientèles, modérer les prix de ventes, faire des petites soldes par rapport a la saison.
Avec le prochain prêt, il veut agrandir et ouvrir une grande alimentation pour satisfaire aux besoins de ses clients 
à l’avenir avec les revenus qu’il va générer,et les bénéfices de ses ventes il veut  ouvrir une alimentation pour faire la  vente en gros  sa zone.
L’avenir de son enfant est entre ses mains et veut  lui donner  une bonne éducation.
texts.en:
This 26-year old man, who is single with one child, has a secondary school education and began a general trading activity in 2007. He starts very early and finishes very late, and he carries out his activity at a bus/taxi hub. With a capital of 150,000 francs he wanted to add an ice-machine, by saving money during his first loan. 

His income is between 35,000 francs and 40,000 francs a day and he wants to increase this by buying: a carton of powdered milk, a carton of sardines in oil, a carton of mayonnaise, two cartons of spaghetti, 25 litres of oil, sweets, biscuits, washing-up liquid, washing powders, bleach etc.. In order to improve his sales potential, his strategy is to open early to be loyal to his customers, keep his prices at a reasonable level and to have small sales according to the seasons. With the next loan he wants to expand and open a large food store to be able to satisfy his customers' needs. 

The future of his child lies in his hands and he wants to give him a good education.

loans.use: Purchase of a carton of powdered milk, a carton of sardines in oil, a carton of mayonnaise, two cartons of spaghetti and 25 litres of oil

loans.name: Sainte Catherine Plus Group

texts.en:
Germaine M. is the chairwoman of the "Ste Catherine Plus" community bank, which is made up of 11 micro-entrepreneurs united for the same goal of developing their businesses with loans received from Kiva through the IMF HOPE DRC.

Germaine A. M. runs a restaurant in the western suburban area of Kinshasa. She is 57 years old and the mother of nine children between the ages of 17 and 28, three of whom attend school. Germaine began her business in 2007 with capital of US $80. With hard work, able management and good customer service, Germaine’s business has prospered and has a permanent customer base. The business generates a weekly profit of $30. Germaine has already received and successfully repaid three loans from HOPE DRC. She is planning to use this new loan to expand her business by buying smoked and salted fish requested by her customers. Her ambition is to open a shop.

loans.use: to add smoked and salted fish for her customers

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Desde hace 3 años Diana Marcela se dedica a la reparación de celulares, esta labor se la enseñó su esposo que se ha dedicado a esta labor por mucho tiempo. El la región hay muy pocos lugares donde se puede hacer la reparaciones de celulares, es por esto que Diana necesita comprar una planta eléctrica y repuestos para poder ampliar su negocio y ofrecerle mejor servicio a los clientes.

Al ampliar su negocio Diana mejorará su condición económica y además podrá  reunión dinero para iniciar sus estudios universitarios ya que es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Three years ago, Diana Marcela started working in cell phone repair.  Her spouse taught her this work as he has been working in this area for a long time.  In their region, there are very few places where cell phone repair is available, which is why Diana needs to buy an electric generator and parts to expand her business and offer better service to customers.

Upon expanding her business, Diana will improve her economic status and may also start saving money for college, as that is her big dream.

loans.use: To buy an electric generator and cell phone parts.

loans.name: Dilberto

texts.es:
Dilberto es un padre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijas en el sector Villa del Mar del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zona urbana marginal que carecen de servicios básicos.

Dilberto se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi (vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina donde transporta a personas a diversas zonas). El ya tiene diez años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones, asimismo desea realizar una reparación al motor de su vehículo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

Dilberto es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran alguien responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dilberto is a 38 year-old father who lives together with his wife and two daughters in Villa del Mar, in José Leonardo Ortiz district.  This is one of the most populous districts in Lambayeque region and is characterized mainly by its high poverty rates since people generally live in the marginal, urban area and lack access to basic services.

Dilberto provides a passenger transport service in his 'mototaxi' (a vehicle which consists of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting passengers).  He has been in this business for ten years and it has enabled him to cover his family's financial expenses.

Dilberto would like to make some improvements to his home so that his family can live in better conditions.  He would also like to repair his vehicle's engine.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Dilberto is well known and well liked by his work colleagues.  They consider him to be a responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to improve his home and to repair his vehicle's engine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting and build a restroom for family use

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
K. Munira, a 43-year-old married mother of two children, lives with her family in the village of Bakhmal. Engaged in the selling of foods and industrial products for four years, Munira is hoping to receive a loan of 5000 Somoni to maintain and expand her business. This loan will enable her to increase her sales and to earn more money.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy foods and industrial products

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es: La señora Mary  madre de una hija, lucha en la vida por darle una buena educación, la actividad que tiene esta en crecimiento  gracias a los esfuerzos realizados de cada día en la venta de hamburguesas, inicio su negocio hece mucho tiempo atrás de manera muy humilde obteniendo buenos resultados ya que las hamburguesas que prepara son muy agradables para su clientela, debido  a esta razón es que se animo a solicitar un crédito nuevo en la institución para incrementar su capital de trabajo comprando insumos e ingredientes para la elaboración de sus riquísimas hamburguesas por la demanda de la clientela, siendo este un emprendimiento de una mujer dedicada a su trabajo por el cual ese esfuerzo su trabajo lo realiza todos los dias a partir de las 16:00 pm hasta las 24:00 pm, durante la semana para que sus niña y ella misma puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida para un futuro próximo.
texts.en:
Mary is the mother of one daughter and she works hard to provide her with a good education. Mary's business is growing thanks to her daily efforts selling hamburgers. She started her business a long time ago with just a humble operation. She had success early on because her customers really like the hamburgers that she prepares. 

For this reason Mary has requested a new loan from our institution to increase her working capital. She will buy supplies and ingredients to make her delicious hamburgers to meet the demands of her customers. Because Mary is very dedicated to her business she works every day from 4pm until midnight so that she and her daughter can have a better quality of life in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients to make delicious hamburgers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand the merchandise at her grocery store.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has been practicing poultry farming for the last seven years in Kitale town, western Kenya. He employs one farmhand and sells his poultry and eggs to the local market. Farming has been his main source of income. He is 41 years old and married with three school-age children who all attend school.

Samson has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry farm. He intends to use this loan to buy additional stock of poultry and poultry feeds. The extra proceeds from this project will help him improve his family's livelihood. His biggest challenge has been diseases. He hopes to expand his poultry farm in the future by increasing his poultry inventory to 2,000.

loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Orlando Antonio

texts.es: Orlando de 49 años de edad es soltero, labora para Alcaldia de Juigalpa como responsable de sanidad publica desde hace 5años. Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda, cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado y construir un sumidero.Sueña con poder brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Orlando is 49 years old and single. He has been working for the Juigalpa municipality as a public health manager for 5 years. He is asking for his 2nd loan with the goal to improve his home. He will replace his roof because it is in bad shape and he will build a drainage system. His dream is to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to replace his roof.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a single woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and food for the family.

For the past three years, Monica has operated a laundry business, and her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Monica faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. Monica plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase a washing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Jenny Carolina

texts.es:
Jenny Carolina tiene 25 años, Es casado vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Campo Alegre, por la parroquia Guare perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembren maíz y arroz.

Jenny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en Comercial Sin Rival y Comercial Suarez y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes .   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como plagas en los cultivos.Su sueño es tener una casa y viajar a españa para tener mejores condiciones de vida.

En los timepos libre le gusta estar en la casa convercando con los hijos y con los suegros.
texts.en:
Jenny Carolina is 25 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province. 

The San Jacinto community bank is located in Campo Alegre, in Guare parish, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn and rice.

Jenny is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  She buys her products in Comercial Sin Rival and Comercial Suarez and makes her sales in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

Jenny is requesting this loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as pests attacking her crops.  Her dream is to own her own home and to travel to Spain so that she can enjoy better living conditions.

In her spare time, Jenny likes being at home, chatting to her children and her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es:
La Sra. Dorila pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 35 años, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos que están trabajando.

Desde muy jovencita, a la edad de 16 años, empezó a trabajar porque su familia tenía necesidades económicas y ella deseaba apoyar a sus padres. Al poco tiempo se fue a vivir con su pareja, ella estaba acostumbrada a ser independiente económicamente y decidió seguir trabajando, se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto del mercado de su localidad. Se inició con un capital de S/. 300.00. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00,  comprará variedades de verduras, papas y huevos para implementar su negocio  y así conseguir nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales. 

Dorila es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, su sueño es contar con un negocio que vaya creciendo, desea seguir incrementando los productos con más variedad para mejorar sus ventas.  Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle la oportunidad de crecer con sus negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Dorila is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Lameñas” which is located in the District and Province of Lamas, Department of San Martín. She is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children who are working.

At the very young age of 16, Dorila began working because her family had financial needs and she wanted to help her parents. Soon after, she went to go live with her partner. Dorila was accustomed to being financially independent, so she decided to continue working. She started selling vegetables at a stand in the local market. Dorila started her business with capital totaling 300 PEN.

With this loan of 1500 PEN, she will buy a variety of vegetables, potatoes, and eggs to keep her business in operation. This will allow her to attract new customers and keep her existing customers satisfied.

Dorila is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a business that continues to grow. She wants to expand the variety of products that she offers so that she can improve her sales. Dorila is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing the opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes, and eggs.

loans.name: Marco Fermin

texts.es:
Marco, se dedica a un taller de enderezado y pintura, vive con su familia su madre, su esposa y un hijo, solamente Marco trabaja en la familia, aprendió el oficio siendo empleado de otros talleres, actualmente tiene su propio taller en el que se desempeña todos los días para ganarse  el sustento diario.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de repuestos automotrices, también lijas y pintura, con el propósito de lograr un mejor servicio para la clientela.
Su objetivo es ser un empresario de éxito, vivir con su familia y generar las ganancias que le permitan garantizar un mejor futuro para ellos.
texts.en:
Marco operates an automobile paint and body shop. He lives with his family, which consists of his mother, his wife, and his son. Marco is the only one in his family who is working. He learned his trade while he was employed at other repair shops. Marco now has his own business where he works so that he can earn his daily living.

At the moment, he is requesting a loan to buy auto parts, sanding equipment, and paint so that he can provide better service to his customers. His goals are to become a successful entrepreneur, live with his family, and generate income that will guarantee them a better future.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts, sanding equipment, and paint.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Cecile works hard to support her family. She has a machine shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Cecile is borrowing PHP 17,500 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her machine shop business.

Cecile has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 4 children. All of her children are currently in school. Jessica has a business of paper products, which she has had for 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase paper for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Jessica hopes to expand her business.  Jessica is a member of BRAC's small enterprise program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase paper for resale.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 35 years old  and a married  woman. She has two children who depend on her. She has been a farmer for a period of six years.


She knew about KADET through other women registered in her area of residence. She is a nice client who is likely to repay her loan; she is applying for  her first loan from KADET LTD and she wants to use the loan to buy farm supplies such as seedlings, fertilizer.


She hopes to expand her farming and improve the living standard of her family. Her dreams are to see her children being educated and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Fortunetus

texts.en:
Fortunetus is 52 years old, married and has five children.  He does carpentry so as to earn a living for his family.  He has been in the business for twelve years and has employed two people.  He also runs a grocery shop so as to supplement his income.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business hence his living standard.

Fortunetus hopes to become financially stable within five years.  He has requested 30,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber for making furniture.

loans.use: To buy timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Rosadel

texts.en:
Rosadel is 64 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Rosadel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has borrowed and paid back nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading.
Rosadel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Maria Flordelona

texts.en:
Maria Flordelona is 42 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor.  She is married and has three children.

Maria Flordelona owns a general store to earn a living.   She has had this business for four years.  Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan for  PHP 15,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.  

Maria Flordelona has been a member of Paglum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year.

loans.use: buy more stocks for her store

loans.name: Jairo Antonio

texts.es: El señor Jairo Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, el es un hombre de familia responsable tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 6 años a su cargo. A pesar que la situación esta difícil por el precio de la gasolina, el no se desespera porque todos los días se prepara para trabajar. El motivo del crédito es para la compra  de llantas, gasolina, repuestos para su automóvil.  Este es su segundo crédito que realiza y lo va a invertir en la comprar de la materia prima necesaria.
texts.en: Jairo Antonio provides a transport service.  He is a responsible family man who has two children, aged 4 and 6, in his care.  In spite of the fact that his situation is difficult owing to the price of gas (petrol), he does not become discouraged and every day he gets himself ready to work.  He is requesting this loan to buy tires, gas and spare parts for his vehicle.  This is his second loan and he will invest it in buying necessary raw materials.

loans.use: to buy tires, gas (petrol) and spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe est créé le 07 Juin 2004. Le nom signifie "entente" en langue locale wolof. L'activité principale de ses 12 membres est le commerce de détail.
Mme Marie est membre du groupe dont elle est responsable depuis sa création, elle est debout à gauche de la photo avec la main levée. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.Elle a une bonne expérience de son activité pour l'avoir exercée depuis plus de 10 ans. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus, des bijoux et des chaussures qu'elle va revendre.
Avec les bénéfices, Mme Marie va aider son mari pour la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
The group was created on June 7, 2004. The name means harmony or understanding in the local language, Wolof. The main activity of its twelve members is retail sales. Marie is the member of the group who has been its director since its creation. She is standing with a raised hand on the right side of the photo. She is married and the mother of two children. She has a proven track record in her profession, which she has practiced for over ten years.
With this loan, she intends to buy fabric, jewelry, and shoes that she will resell.
With the earnings, Marie will help her husband with the care of the family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, shoes, and jewelry.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
Akou est une femme âgée de 41 ans. Elle est divorcée. Elle a deux enfants.  
Akou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle vend des couches et habits pour bébé pour tous clients au grand marché de Lomé. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. 
Akou a requis son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des couches et des habits pour enfants. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Akou voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akou is a 41-year-old woman.  She is divorced and has two children.  Akou has been working as a reseller since 1996.  She sells diapers and baby clothes to various customers at the Grand Market in Lomé.  She buys her products in Lomé and works alone.  

Akou requested her third loan from WAGES in order to buy diapers and clothes for children.  She would like to reinvest in her business.  

In the coming years, Akou would like to open a shop.  She says that with the profits she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: To buy diapers and clothes for children

loans.name: Askarkhon

texts.ru: Аскархон проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. Имеет четверых детей. Он вместе с сыном занимается развозкой пассажиров по маршруту Куляб – Душанбе. В этой области он уже 20 лет. Кредит берет для обновления салона и ремонта автомобиля.
texts.en: Askarkhon lives in the city of Kulob. He is 56 years old married and has four children. Together with his sons he is running a taxi shuttle business between Kulob and Dushanbe. He has been working as a taxi driver for the last 20 years and need this loan to repair his car and refurbish the car seats.

loans.use: To refurbish the upholstery and repair the car

loans.name: Sayonara Georgina

texts.es:
Sayonara Georgina tiene 21 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en Ventanas provincia de los ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC LAS BRISAS, se encuentra ubicada en las calles 6 de Octubre y Asad Bucaran Sector el hospital, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas Se dedican a labores comerciales en general.
Sayonara tiene un bazar vende maquillaje, bisutería, esmaltes en la casa y además estudia. Las compras lo hace en Guayaquil y las ventas lo hace en la casa en promedio de cada dos semanas.
Solicita el crédito para incrementar la mercadería con productos nuevos como las cremas, collares, perfumes, labiales.  Con la ayuda del crédito podrá incrementar el negocio.
El sueño es poder culminar los estudios y seguir superándose. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir a la iglesia.
texts.en:
Sayonara Georgina is 21 years old, single, and has no children.  She lives with her parents in Ventanas, within the Los Ríos province.

She’s a member of the “VRC LAS BRISAS” communal bank, located on the corner of “6 de Octubre” street and “Asad Bucanran Sector el Hospital,” within the Ventanas settlement.  The members are general merchants.

Sayonara has a shop where she sells makeup, costume jewelry, and enamels out of her home.  She’s also a student.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and sells out of her home on the average of every two weeks.

She is asking for this loan to increase her inventory with new products such as creams, necklaces, perfumes, and lipsticks.  This loan will help her grow her business.

Her dream is to finish her education and continue to succeed.  She likes to go to church in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Armen

texts.ru:
Армен родился в 1973 г. в городе Каджаране, где и окончил среднюю школу. 
Армен женат и у него трое детей. Жена Армена домохозяйка, старшая дочь учиться в школе, а младшая дочь и сын посещяют детский сад. Также вместе с ним проживает его мать-пенсионерка. 
Три года назад Армен переоборудовал подвал своего дома в мастерскую, в которой он изготовляет мебель на заказ. Основной акцент Армен делает на изготовление кухонной мебели и компьютерных столов. Для увеличения пробыли своей семьи, Армен также арендует небольшой магазин, в котором он продает готовую мебель. Благодаря своему бизнесу он смог купить небольшой грузовой автомобиль, с помощью которого Армен привозит сырью из города Капана, а также готовую мебель из Еревана для продажи в магазине. 
Армену необходим кредит на сумму 1.000.000 драм для приобретения необходимого сырья для изготовления мебели. 
Армен работает до позднего вечера и без выходных, что позволяет ему получать доход, необходимый для содержания своей семьи.
texts.en:
Armen finished middle school in Kadjaran, the city of his birth. He's married and has three children. Armen's wife takes care of their household and his elder daughter attends school, while his two younger children go to daycare. Armen's retired mother lives with them. 
Three years ago, Armen converted his basement into a workshop in which he now makes furniture on a by-order basis. His main focus is on kitchen furniture and computer desks. In order to increase his income, Armen rents a a small store where he places products ready for sale. 
Because of his business, Armen was able to purchase a truck. He transports building materials from Kapan and made furniture from Yerevan on it. 
Armen is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 drams to purchase building materials for new furniture. In order to successfully support his family, he works till late without weekends.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for furniture production.

loans.name: G.s. Los Pescaditos Group

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria tiene 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos los cuales, ya todos son mayores de edad y trabajan. Ella se dedica al comercio de productos del mar como pescado, camarones, etc. Ha tenido éxitos ya que la pesca ha estado buena y se ha sacado buenas ganancias. Su mayor obstáculo ha sido transportar la mercadería de la zona costera hacia su lugar donde vende, ya que el transporte es caro. Tiene ingresos adicionales que provienen de la ayuda que le brindan sus hijos. El crédito que esta solicitando es para  invertirlo en la compra de mariscos variados, aduce no tener mucha competencia ya que tiene compradores establecidos. Desea hacer un pequeño acopio de mariscos, ya que de esta manera ganarían mas. La señora Antolina es la otra persona que integra este grupo solidario en cual se unieron para apoyarse una a la otra he invertir en el negocio en estas temporadas buenas.
texts.en: Sra. Ana Maria, 55, is a single mother with 4 children.  Her children are grown and independent.  Ana Maria makes a living buying and selling fish, shellfish, etc.  The business is successful and generates a good income because she only sells the best fish.  Her biggest challenge is carting the fish from the coast, where she buys it, to the place where she sells it because transportation costs are expensive.  Her children help her with some expenses.  Ana Maria will use this loan to buy fish and shellfish that she will resell.  She doesn't face much competition, she says, because she has an established set of buyers.  She would like to build a small wholesale business because that would allow her to earn more.  Sra. Antolina, the other member of the group--a group that she and Ana Maria formed to support one another--has also invested in the business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her fish sales business.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Mrs. Pen is 52 years old and a responsible mother of 4 children, living in Baray district. Pen, as well as other villagers, has been in the business of growing crops throughout the years. She grows rice, a kind of bean, and peanuts, earning in the neighborhood of $1.60 per day. She has been involved in this business for years alongside her husband. At the same time, Pen has also been operating a retail business in a local market. She sells fresh fish, which are caught from the Tonle Sap River by her husband.

At the present, she is looking for some funds from HKL and Kiva to purchase rice and peanut seeds and mineral fertilizers for her farming process. Pen aims to expand her present house in the coming years when she has enough funds and improve her agricultural business successfully with a high rate of output.

loans.use: To purchase rice and peanut seeds and mineral fertilizers for her farming process.

loans.name: Hashim Mohamed

texts.en:
Hashim Mohamed is 18 years old. He studies at Adna University College, faculty of medicine. 

His main challenge is the lack of a laptop, which he can't buy on his own. Kaaba provided him with a laptop that he can pay for in monthly installments.

After university, Hashim hopes to work as a doctors’ assistant at Adna Maternity Hospital.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Rebeca Amparo

texts.es: Doña Rebeca de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda desde hace mas 15 años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, café, sopas, huevos, gelatinas, azúcar, etc. por mayor

loans.name: Aidan

texts.en: Aidan A. is 36 years old. He was born in Razgrad but his wife is from Bourgas and he stays in the city. He graduated mechanics in high school but there were no job for him so he left the country to work abroad. He had lived in Germany, Italy and the Netherlands where he had worked as a driver, painter and even a courier. Aidan saved some money and came back to Bulgaria. This money he used to start his own business. First he starts to sell nuts and candies on market fairs all over the country. Two years ago he found a nut and candy shop on one of the main streets in Bourgas. Aidan A. need $ 2 000 to buy a small bus for supplying his shop.

loans.use: To buy a small bus

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en:
Primitivo has a wood workshop in his house. He began working with a friend who was his teacher. Once he learned it very well he decided to work by himself. At the beginning he only built chairs but now he offers beds, sofas, and other furniture. Primitivo has 10 years with his business and has been able to employ several people of his community. Primitivo wants to increase the diversity of his products. He will use the loan to buy wood and therefore satisfy the demand of retail stores who are his biggest clients. Primitivo is married, and he is 5 years old. And he is convinced that this loan will improve his family economic level and keep on growing his business to generate more employment.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en: Mrs. Thuan is 56. Her husband is 2 years older. They have a son and a daughter. The son is a day laborer. The daughter wants to become a student in 2008. They have a fishpond which is 800(m2) for raising anabas. Their income is $7 per person/month. Mrs. Thuan hopes to get a loan of $75 to invest in raising fish to save money that will be used to support her daughter’s school fees at university next year. They will repay monthly.

loans.use: Raising fish.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
Rodolfo is divorced and has two children, aged 12 and 16. Due to the lack of employment that exists in the country, he decided to start his own business offering his services as a taxi driver. He wants to give his children a good education and help them to what career end that they might have the best opportunities in teh future. This is the strongest motivation that he has to go to work and to strive for more every day.

To be able to offer better service to his customers Rodolfo now needs a credit of $475 that he will use in the repair and maintenance of his taxi, with the objective of preventing whatever sort of accident that could occur. He commits himself to repay this loan in six months. Become an important part in the life of this family and deciD. to aid Rodolfo; he is very grateful for the opportunity to improve that you offer.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Rodolfo es divorciado y tiene dos hijos, D. 12 y 16 años D. edad, ente la falta D. empleo que hay en el país decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo sus servicios D. taxista, él quiere darle a sus hijos una buena educación y ayudarlos a que terminen su carrera para que tengan mejores oportunidades en el futuro, este es el motivo más fuerte que tiene para salir a trabajar y esforzarse más cada día.

Para poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes ahora Rodolfo necesita D. un crédito D. $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la reparación y mantenimiento D. su taxi, con el objetivo D. evitar cualquier tipo D. accidente que pudiera ocurrir, él se compromete a regresar este préstamo en 6 meses. Se parte importante en la vida D. esta familia y decídete a apoyar a Rodolfo, él agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas D. mejorar.

loans.use:
Repair and maintenance of his taxi - 
Reparación y mantenimiento

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Angela Estela

texts.es:
My name is Angela G. and I am dedicated to selling bean burritos with chorizo sausage, chicken, sodas, bottled waters, and a variety of pastries and cookies. I have had my business for two years. My clientel is excellent because my sales location is passed by many people since we are in the center of the capital and right next to my spot is the bus stop. I want to increase my inventory of products so that I can have more sales and be able to make a better income, which I need to be able to provide for my home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Angela G. me dedico a la venta de burritas de frijoles con chorizo, pollo, refrescos, agua en bolsa y variedad de confites y galletas, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientela es muy excelente ya que mi lugar de venta pasa mucha gente porque estamos en el centro de la capital y exactamente a la par de mi puesto esta la parada de buses, deseo incrementar mi inventario de productos para tener mas ventas y asi poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesito para poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase tortillas, chicken, chorizo, sodas, oil, beans, cheese, churros, pastries, bottled water, and cookies.

loans.name: Iyoh

texts.en:
Iyoh is 23 years old and married with two children. She runs a small shop selling snacks and some household items, earning about $7 per day. Her husband Ujang sells food in Bogor and usually earns about $22 a week.

Iyoh needs a loan to buy more goods and complete her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods and complete her shop

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
After over ten years in the agricultural sector, Bertha W. is making the leap to the service sector. She plans to open a stationery shop that will also offer secretarial and printing services, and she requires a loan of $600 to purchase a computer and printer. Her business will be an interesting and useful additional to the rural town of Kiluvia Madukani (about 20km out of Dar es Salaam), where such services are not readily available.

Bertha is a single mother of three, Emmanuel, 15, Catherine, 14 and Erick, 8, and she hopes that her business will enable her to support her young family.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and printer in order to open a stationery and secretarial services shop.

loans.name: Neneng

texts.en: Neneng, 49, is the mother of 2 children. Her husband, A., works at building construction as a day laborer and earns a meager income. She has to work to earn more income for the family by selling salty (pickled) eggs at the market, earning about US$ 4 a day. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$125 to add her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Adding to her business capital

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience Enogieru sells provisions and drinks. She is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. She was born in Edo State, Nigeria, and has been in business since 2007. She needs a loan of $275 to buy more drinks and provisions for sale.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristiano Eraso has been breeding cattle is his barnyard since he was very young. It is located in the Somotillo municipality in the city of Chinandega. He is a hardworking man and has been working most of his life in this business in order to support his family and to cover all their necessities.

Currently he wants to invest in his barnyard by buying a pregnant cow. He has come to Ceprodel to ask for the loan that will enable him to make this purchase, which in turn, will help him improve his family's financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La crianza de Ganado en su corral es el negocio al que se dedica desde muy joven el señor Cristiano Eraso en el municipio Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es un caballero muy esforzado debido a que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a este negocio con el fin de mantener su familia y suplir todas las necesidades de su hogar.

Su necesidad hoy en día es la urgencia de invertir en su corral y la compra de una vaquilla en preñez. Es por este motivo que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan realizar esta compra y así mejora su situación económica y la de su humilde familia.

loans.use: Purchase of pregnant cow to improve his barnyard

loans.name: Mariam's Tuzinduke Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 40 years old and is a married woman with 4 children, aged 12,18,22 and 26. Mariam owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina A. is married and has 6 children; she is 50 years old. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells plantains and yams; she acquired the training for 3 weeks before setting up on her own. Justina needs a loan of $600 to buy more plantains and yams for sales.

loans.use: To buy more plantains and yams

loans.name: Afioga

texts.en: Afioga M., 34, is married with 2 children.  She has many year(s) of experience in the cocoa business. She sells to the villagers/public 4 days per week. She has no previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Afioga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This is her first loan with the SPBD and will help her to generate her business.

loans.use: sacks of cocoa beans, plastic cups and bags.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi L., 50 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2001. After 7 years old membership, she has always used the borrowed money in breeding pigs and chickens. Being hardworking, beside working on the rice field, she always spends time on the animal-breeding projects. Because she has a large backyard, breeding chickens is very convenient for her. She usually releases about 200 chickens after 3 months and earns 1200 USD. She currently has 200 chickens and 4 pigs ready to be released. She has 3 children, two of whom are working and the last one is going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 775 USD to invest in her animal-breeding projects. Her average income is 300 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2001, chị Nguyễn Thị Lân 50 tuổi đã trải qua 7 năm vay vốn, các vòng vốn vay gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà thịt. Là người phụ nữ chịu thương chịu khó nên ngoài việc làm ruộng ra chị luôn giành thời gian chăm sóc dự án chăn nuôi của gia đình, với thuận lợi có vườn rộng nên việc chăn nuôi gà của gia đình chị rất phát triển mỗi một lứa thường gia đình chị nuôi 200 con sau 3 tháng gia đình chị có thể xuất, thu nhập 1 lứa gà 20.000.000đ, hiện tại gia đình chị đang có 200 con gà và 4 con lơn đang chờ xuất, chị có 3 con, 2 con đã đi làm và có thu nhập, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 13.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà thịt. Thu nhập bình quân. 4500.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising pigs and chickens

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth has two children, one 4-year-old boy and a 1-year-old little girl. She has lived in her mother's house since her husband went to work in Brazil.

Eli makes clothing, specifically jeans. She does the seaming and piecing of pre-cut fabric to complete each article. She has worked in this capacity for 69 months. She has competition in her area but, due to her experience, is advantageously positioned. Also, Eli guarantees her work. She works with two shops that make jeans and that simultaneously work with external stores.

The present request is for the construction of two sleeping quarters, a living room and a bathroom on the land that was purchased with a previous loan acquired through Kiva partner Agrocapital. Eli has worked with our institution for several years and has shown herself to be a responsible person in repaying her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth tiene dos hijos, un varon de 4 años y una niña de 1 año. Vive en la casa de su mamá, en un pequeño departamento desde que su esposo se fue a trabajar Brasil.

Eli se dedica a la confección de ropa, especificamente a la confección de jeans, sólo costura y gana a destajo por prenda terminada, a ella la tela ya le entregan ya cortada. Ella se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 69 meses atrás. Tiene bastante competencia en su rubro pero debido a experiencia ella tiene bajo control la misma. También asegura su trabajo ya que trabaja con dos talleres que confeccionan jeans y que a la vez trabajan con talleres externos.

La presente solicitud es para la construcción de dos dormitorios, una pequeña sala y un baño en el terreno que compró con un anterior crédito de Agrocapital. Eli trabaja con nuestra institución desde hace varios años atrás y en este tiempo demostró ser una persona responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.

loans.use:
Home Construction
Construcción vivienda

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 27 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con su familia.
Es una joven con estudios superiores en el área de salud, atiende en su pequeña botica, la cual puso con mucho esfuerzo, con la ayuda de su familia, gracias a Dios, nos dice, hoy en día el negocio es rentable, ya que es muy concurrido por las personas del lugar.Judith se dedica a atender su botica a lo largo de todo el día, lo cual le resulta agotador, pero el poder a ayudar a la gente a mitigar sus dolores, es una gran fuente de aliento para ella, su botica tiene tan solo 6 meses, tiempo en el cual ha generado un gran amor por su trabajo.
Judith quiere asegurar su futuro con su pequeño negocio, para tener un mejor porvenir.
Con el dinero del préstamo podrá implementar su botica, para que a la larga se convierta en una gran farmacia de renombre y prestigio.
texts.en:
Judith is 27 years old, single, and lives in her parent’s home with her family. She is a young woman who has completed post-secondary studies in the field of health, and she has a small pharmacy which she started with much effort with the help of her family, thanks be to God, she tells us, today the business is profitable, and it is a very popular business. Judith works in her pharmacy all day, which is exhausting, but being able to help people alleviate their illnesses and pains is a great source of strength for her. Her pharmacy has been open only 6 months, in which time she has developed a great love for her work. Judith wants to ensure her future with her small business in order to have a better future. With the money from the loan she will be able to expand her pharmacy so that in the long run it will become a well known and prestigious pharmacy.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her small pharmacy so that in the future it becomes a famous pharmacy.

loans.name: Fetulima

texts.en:
Fetulima K., 48, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience running a shop where she sells to the general public 7 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1020 Tala (~425 USD).

Fetulima has three previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Fetulima is an established member of the program running a shop in her village, and she aims to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, chicken, mutton flaps, noodles (ramen), lollies, twisties, bongos, mosquito coils, etc.

loans.name: Mukaddas
