texts.en: Mukaddas is 55 year-old widow and the loving mother of two adorable kids. Since her husband passed away she has had to provide to feed her family. Her business is livestock; she buys cattle, fattens them and then sells them. She wants to borrow money to buy more cattle and also to buy more hay for the winter season.

loans.use: Mukaddas would like to purchase more livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo. Desde hace más de 10 años se dedica al negocio de la venta de abarrotes y productos de pan llevar junto con su esposo, un agricultor dedicado a su familia que con el tiempo pudo comprar e instalarse en su propia casa favoreciéndole aun más en sus ventas, por ubicarse en una zona comercial de su comunidad, entonces ya no paga el concepto de arrendamiento,  lo cual favorece a sus ganancias. La atención que ella brinda en su tienda es diaria y todo el día, ella siempre tiene en cuenta el buen trato a su cliente, tiene muchos planes de crecer para el futuro, y está dispuesta a lograrlo porque desea que su hijo de 14 años siga estudiando. Es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo en MFP, fue recomendada por los mismos integrantes del banco comunal para que integrara el grupo. Gloria solicita este préstamo con el que implementará su tienda con más mercadería como fideos, arroz y menestras.
texts.en:
Gloria is 44-years-old and lives with her husband and son. For more than 10 years, she has sold groceries and bread along with her husband, a farmer who is dedicated to his family. With time, she was able to put her store in her own home, which is even more favorable to her sales because it is located in a commercial zone in their community. So she doesn't have to pay rent anymore, which favors her profits. She attends to her store all day every day. She always keeps in mind the good treatment of her customers. She has many plans of growing her business in the future. She is determined to achieve this so her 14-year-old son can continue getting an education. This is the first time that she has requested a loan with MFP. She was recommended by the members of the communal bank to join the group. Gloria is requesting this loan to purchase noodles, rice, and stew for her store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, and stew for her store

loans.name: Clifford

texts.en:
Clifford A. manufactures palm oil at Ntsiman near Elmina and has been doing so since 1998. Clifford has received a senior high school education. He is married and has 7 dependents. His wife is a trader. He is responsible for the payment of his children's school fees and other utility bills. His loan will be used to buy gas oil and petrol to run his palm oil manufacturing machine. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in his children's education.

The picture shows Clifford by the oil making machine

loans.use: To buy gas oil and petrol to run his palm oil manufacturing machine.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana J. is 33 years old and a divorced woman with two children. Currently all her kids are in school. Juliana has sold frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, meat, etc. in the local market of Abirem in the Eastern region for twelve years now. In addition to that she also sells yam and smoked fish just to help her make more income. Through hard work and self determination, Juliana is doing well in providing the basic needs for her kids, especially their education. Sometimes getting money to pay her kids' education fees becomes a big blow to her. As a single parent, she is doing her best to cater for her kids through the business that she runs.

Juliana does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork and meat to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. It has been her desire to open another branch in the next three towns from where she is selling because customers from those communities come to her village to buy, which she thinks is quite a distance for them. She would be grateful for your support. Juliana belongs to a village bank called ‘Asetenapa’ which means 'good living'. She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, yam and smoked fish, etc.

loans.name: Man's Group

texts.en: Mrs. P., 30, who is the mother of four teenage children that attend school. She currently sells groceries out of her home, selling items such as cooked ingredients, canned goods, and sweets for kid. She is married to Khon, 33, who makes a living by repairing boats for fishermen. Recently, Mrs. P. has sold all of her groceries from her store and she wants to buy more groceries but she cannot because she doesn't have enough money. Therefore, she is applying for a loan to purchase additional groceries to sell. She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Zarafshon

texts.ru: Зардакова Зарафшон проживает в городе Душанбе. Возраст 48  лет.Замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Работает портнихой уже два года. Благодоря имеющемуся опыту может открыть ателье , которое и планирует открыть в данное время. Но для этого, она решила получить кредит и купить швейную машинку и оверлог.Таким образом она сможет привлечь дополнительную работников и создать дополнительные рабочие места. А погасить кредит сможет в течение 18 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zarafshon Z. lives in Dushanbe. She is 48 years old and is married with five children. He has two years of experience of working as a tailor, which allows her to open a workshop. She is applying for a loan in order to buy a sewing machine and an overlocker. This would allow her to create new jobs and attract new work force. She would be able to pay off the loan within 18 months. .

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and an overlocker

loans.name: Shirzi

texts.en:
Shirzi is the son of A. J.. He is 25 and lives in Kabul in a family of seven members. Shirzi is a farmer and he works on the land with his father.

He loves to work hard and to expand his business, so he has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months to buy more seeds and tools for his land.

Shirzi wants to state that this is the only one process that can support an entrepreneur to bring a new change in his business.

loans.use: Buy seeds and tools.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina T. is 41 years old; she is a wife and mother of five kids who are currently in school. She is a trader and sells jeans, blouses, skirts, women's slippers and kids' wear. Amina says her working capital was provided by her husband, but is not adequate for her business. She is not able to purchase high quality products. She has realized that the demand for her goods has increased but meeting that demand requires additional capital. She needs loan support.

Amina believes the loan will help her to purchase good quality and large quantity to scale up sales. She wants to use the loan to purchase jeans, ladies' wear and slippers to increase her inventory. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Jeremiah’.

loans.use: To purchase jeans, ladies' wear and slippers

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita manages a sari-sari store (community-based store) in their village. She converted a small portion of their house into a small store. However, due to financial difficulties, she was not able to improve her store for she used some of the capital for the education of her children. But still, she was thankful because, even though her store was closed for some time, it did not prevent her from sending her children to school.

For this reason, Juanita is seeking financial support for the re-opening of her store. She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 as business capital. She said that she will be very grateful if she will be given the chance to obtain a loan because it will really help her family in reaching their dreams.

Juanita was born in the province of Cagayan in Barangay San Roque, Centro Enrile. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children: Eudato, 19 years old, a college undergraduate but working as a soldier; Jay-Ar, 17 years old, a college student and Janice, 15 years old, a sophomore high school student. Juanita is hoping that they will be able to continue their studies through her hard work and patience.

loans.use: As business capital to re-open her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hokimboy

texts.en: Z. Hokimboy is 30 years old, married, and has three children. All of his life he has devoted himself to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Hokimboy the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting potatoes and carrots that he will sell, because the price will depend on the size. Sorted, they are more profitable, although the potatoes he sells are not in great shape. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market; that is the motivation to continue planting. With the money requested, Hokimboy will buy seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants for his farm. Part of the loan he will also spend on purchasing young cattle. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Abdumalik

texts.ru:
Мавлонов Абдумалик молодой предприниматель, который продвигает свою жизнь при помощи дохода с продажи мужской обуви.  Он привозит товар с Бишкека раз в месяц.
На следующий кредит он планирует привезти летние шлёпанцы. У Абдумалика стабильная торговля и оборотный капитал. Мавлонов доволен всеми условиями Фонда и рад сотрудничать.
texts.en:
Abdumalik M. is a young businessman who makes his way with income earned by selling men's shoes. He brings in his goods from Bishkek once a month. With this loan, he plans to import summer slippers. Abdumalik has a stable business and working capital. M. is happy with all of the loan terms and is glad to cooperate with us.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: selling shoes

loans.name: Agnes Nakazi Group

texts.en:
Agnes is the leader of four members of a group. She is a 28 years old and married with one child aged 1 year. She resides in and rents a one-roomed house where she is living with three people. Agnes doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets two meals a day.

Agnes resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She owns a retail shop in Makerere, one of Kampala’s suburbs, selling home products materials. She sells to an average of fifteen people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. She uses public transport to and from shopping in Kampala City shops. Her major monthly expenses include medication, rent for both her home and business and feeding the family.

Agnes has been in this business for the last two years. Her main challenge is transportation of her products from town to her premises and license fees. She has been with MCDT for over eight months and is servicing her second loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more sugar, salt, soap and cooking oil for her shop. Agnes is aspiring to see her business grow bigger and to own another wholesale shop.

loans.use: To increase on her stock

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta is twenty-three years old and single with one child, a boy who is currently in primary school. She lives with her son in a rented apartment in their community. Alberta bakes bread for the past three years, a skill she learnt from her mum. She supplies to other retailers and beverage sellers in her community and also hawks to sell. Alberta buys bags of flour and other ingredients from Kumasi. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour in bulk to expand her business. She wants to give her son a quality education and to improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy flour in bulk

loans.name: Otgonsuren

texts.en: Otgonsuren D. is 51 years old and currently lives with her husband in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. She has been married to her husband for 36 years and they raised two daughters, 28 and 24 years old. Otgonsuren has a small retail business dealing in raw meat. Since 2003, she has been retailing mutton and beef in small pieces at the Hasu Shopping Center. She rents a small stall for her business. Her husband is a big help in her business. When she purchases whole beef and mutton from the local wholesale market, her husband cuts them into smaller pieces for her retail business. Since the start in 2003, her business has done well. Her business capital has increased from 50,000 MNT to 750,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) in five years. Otgonsuren's ultimate goal is be a herder in the countryside with his own livestock. She requests a loan to purchase more mutton and beef for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more beef and mutton for her business.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne K. is 40 years old and married with four children. She lives in the interior part of Uthiru where there is less competition; hence her business has an opportunity to grow. She has been running her tailoring shop for a number of years now.

Anne was introduced to KADET by her friend who is the Chairlady of her current group. Anne has never borrowed from another financial institution before and this will be her third loan with KADET. She paid off her previous loans very well without any difficulty.
 
Anne’s customers are mostly the neighbors around her and, besides tailoring, she makes other goods like seat covers and supplies to other traders. She wants to buy more materials for her business so as to have a variety for her clients to choose from.

Anne desires to buy more sewing machines and especially an embroidery machine so that she can diversify her skills and products.

loans.use: To buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 50 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Comfort has a bookshop and is requesting N100,000 to purchase more books to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more books to sell

loans.name: Hipolito

texts.es:
Hipólito tiene 45 años, es un hombre muy persistente con sus metas, vive en su casa propia junto a su familia y lo que más desea es darles una buena vida. En estos últimos años se ha dedicado a vender productos naturales recorriendo las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. El poder de convencimiento que posee, junto a su carisma y buen humor, han hecho de él un vendedor muy hábil y ahora cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes estables, que siempre lo buscan para comprarle los productos que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es recomendar a sus clientes lo que deberían usar, lleva 5 años vendiendo este tipo de productos y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar por la calles en busca de clientes, pero sabe que ese es su trabajo y tiene que hacerlo. Para el futuro anhela tener una tienda donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad y comodidad.
Este es el primer préstamo de Hipólito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea meter en problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido pese a ser nuevo en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos naturales para ofrecerles a sus clientes una mayor variedad.
texts.en:
Hipolito is 45 years old and he is a very goal-minded person. He lives in his own home together with his family, and what he wants most is to be able to give them a good life. These past years he has been selling naturopathic products throughout the streets of Juliaca. He has a knack for convincing people, that, together with his charisma and good sense of humour have made him into a very apt salesperson, earning him an impressive clientele. His clients always look for him to buy the products he offers. What he loves best about his work is to recommend products to his clients. He has been selling this type of product for the past 5 years, and what he considers the toughest part to have to walk the streets in search of clients. But he knows this is his job and he just has to do it. In the future he plans on have a store where he will be able to sell his products in greater comfort.

This is the first loan for Hipolito through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows he must be timely with his payments, and he has no intention of getting into difficulties with the other members of the Community Bank. He is highly esteemed by his colleagues in the group. With the one thousand nuevos soles he will purchase a greater selection of natural products to cater to his clients' needs.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock his merchandise.

loans.name: Fazella Group

texts.en: Fazella the group leader of Fazella group. They live in district 4th Kabul Afghanistan and there are four members in this group. The total requested amount is 56000 Afghani. And each of them would like to receive the loan for her own business. Fazella and Shayma want to receive a loan for their tailoring business.Sanam wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store. And Fowzeya wants to take a loan for her business of fresh fruit. They would like to admire this process and want to thank form Kiva too.

loans.use: They want to improve in there businesses to help there family butter

loans.name: Akouavi Victorine

texts.fr: A. Akouavi Victorine est née en 1967 à Adja au centre du Bénin. Akouavi Victorine vit depuis six ans à Louho, un quartier de Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Mariée à SAGBOHAN Ambroise, un enseignant, Akouavi Victorine a six enfants en charge, tous scolarisés, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Les charges de la famille sont supportées à la fois par Akouavi Victorine et son conjoint Ambroise. N'ayant jamais été à l'école, Akouavi Victorine a commencé depuis son bas âge la vente de divers (maïs, riz, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. Akouavi Victorine fait ses emplettes à Pobè, à proximité de Porto-Novo. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. Pour accroître la taille de son activité et satisfaire plus sa clientèle afin de réaliser plus d'économies, Akouavi Victorine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Akouavi Victorine Ameghihoue was born in 1967 at Adja in central Benin. Akouavi Victorine has lived for the last 6 years in Louho, a suburb of Porto-Nova, the capital of Benin. She is married to Ambroise Sagbohan a student and cares for six children who have all attended school with three having children of their own. The family expenses are met by Akouavi and her partner Ambroise. Having never attended school, Akouavi Victorine started at an early age to sell assorted products (corn, rice, manioc flour etc) from her home. Akouavi buys her supplies in Pobe near Porto-Novo. She is a old client of ALIde and has already made two loans which have been duly repaid. To increase the size of her business and satisfy the needs of her clients by becoming more competitive, Akouavi Victorine is requesting this third loan from ALIde.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted products (rice, corn, manioc flour)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beer and soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Nancy Graciela

texts.es:
La señora Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, del distrito D. Pilcuyo, provincia D. El Collao, en el departamento D. Puno, tiene 42 años, es casada y tiene 03 hijos D. los cuales 02 están en Tacna y 01 con ella; estudió hasta el 4to. año D. secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 años, se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa desD. que tenia 16 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 con el que compró mercadería D. lana  como chompas, combinaciones, medias, etc., paralelo a ello se dedica también a la crianza y venta D. ganado vacuno y animales menores y a la agricultura para autoconsumo.

Con este crédito D. S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa comprar más chompas, combinaciones y medias en  la ciudad D. Juliaca para luego vender en la ciudad D. Ilave los días domingos y los días viernes en Desaguadero.

Su deseo es que sus hijos estudien y adquieran bienes para que estén tranquilos y que su negocio mejore.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the community bank "Miraflores" in the district of Pilcuyo, province of El Collao, in the region of Puno. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children, two of whom are in Tacna and one who still lives with her. She attended school through the fourth year of secondary school. Nancy has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She has dedicated herself to the purchase and sale of clothing since she was 16 years old. Her first loan was for S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles and she used it for the purchase of wool products such as sweaters, matching outfits, socks, etc. Along with this business, she also raises and sells cattle and other smaller animals and grows produce for her family's consumption. With this loan of S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, she plans to buy more sweaters, matching outfits and socks in the city of Juliaca so she can later sell them in the city of Desaguadero on Fridays and Sundays. Her wishes are for her children to study and acquire what they need to be comfortable and also to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Colleen Godfrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweaters, outfits, and socks

loans.name: Erlindi

texts.en:
Mrs. Erlindi S. is from the village of Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, a widow, and is blessed with three adult children. Her income comes primarily from her pension of 15,000 monthly.

In 2005, Erlindi joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services and programs. She is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to repaint her house. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC.


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use for repainting her house

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Silongon in Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Evangeline is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Evangeline raises and sells pigs. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Evangeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy piglets to raise & sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Evangeline's 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from her business for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Ombizevua Cell A Ondoru Molly Group

texts.en:
O. Molly is the president of her group. She is aged forty years and is married with six children of whom four are schooling. More so, she is looking after three dependents of whom one is going to school.

Molly has dealt in provisions such as cassava flour, etc., for over fifteen years. She is using the loan to purchase more provisions to sell. The loan will improve her business which is her aim.

Molly is a courageous businesswoman whose dream is to construct a better house for her family and to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: To purchase provisions such as cassava flour, etc., to sell

loans.name: Ceferina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia CEFERINA, pertenecen al banco comunal “PRO DESARROLLO”, la socia vive en Pisac situado en la provincia de Calca departamento de Cusco, está a 40 minutos de la ciudad, es un pequeño pueblo heredero de unas bellas construcciones incas, aquí lugar obligado de paso para todo aquel turista que visita la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 56 años de edad, ella es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de 35, 33, 32, 14 años de edad, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar  con el comercio minorista, la socia vende comida en el mercado, ella encontró un rubro diferente y muy lucrativo en la feria de artesanos en Pisac, la socia cocina y lleva sus diferentes 3 platos a vender en la feria a sus caseras las artesanas y los artesanos, que como están en sus diferentes stands no tienen tiempo para ir a comer a sus casa o a un restaurante, entonces nuestra socia les lleva los platos que preparo y con sus servicios les deja a cada stand que le solicita, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar gallinitas y productos para elaborar sus diferentes menús.

La socia agradece y valora la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio, así mismo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ceferina is a member of the Communal Bank “Pro Desarrollo” (Pro Development). She lives in Pisac, which lies in Calca Province, Department of Cusco. Pisac is located 40 minutes away from the city. It is small town that inherited beautiful Incan structures, which is required sightseeing by all tourists who visit the city of Cusco.

Ceferina is 56 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children (ages 35, 33, 32, and 14). She divides her time between her household activities and her small business. Ceferina sells food at the market. She tried selling in different places but found the artisan’s fair in Pisac to be the most profitable. At the fair, Ceferina prepares three types of dishes to sell to the artisans and craftsmen because they manage their own vending posts and do not have time to go home or to a restaurant to eat. She also delivers prepared dishes to different vending posts upon request. Ceferina needs a loan to buy chickens and other ingredients for preparing different dishes.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing her dishes

loans.name: Kwt Tiing Gading Group

texts.en:
KWT Tiing Gading is an association of women farmers located in the village of Banyubiru, in the district of Jembrana, Bali. The group was formed at the initiative of mothers who wanted to develop businesses, but found it difficult to secure the necessary capital to do so, as the loan application process at banks is complicated and burdensome.
KWT Tiing Gading has 20 members and spans a wide range of businesses, from farming to trading to home-based businesses such as making cookies and chips. Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) Koperasi is working with Kiva to provide the necessary funding for these women to develop their businesses.
KWT Tiing Gading has a leadership team that is comprisesd of three members: Ni Putu Eka Yulianti (Chairman), Ni Made Mili Kasih (Secretary) and Ni Komang Mahayani (Treasurer). 
One of the borrowers, Ni Komang Mahayani, who is also the Treasurer in the leadership team, is a housewife whose tough day-to-day work is to make and supply a variety of cakes to shops or individual customers. In particular, when there are religious ceremonies approaching, cake orders will multiply as Komang Mahayani makes better and more expensive cakes than the artificial cakes and snacks sold in stores. Komang Mahayani is applying for loans through MUK, which will be used to increase her working capital. She will use the additional profit she earns to finance her children’s education, as one is waiting to enter school and the other is currently attending Junior High School.

Note to Kiva Lenders: This group uses a community lending model (commonly referred to as Village Banking) that is very common throughout Asia. In this model, a select number of group representatives will take out a large loan on behalf of their entire group (often an entire village). They will then distribute and manage the loan and collect repayments for the lender. This is a common and efficient practice in the region, but it makes reporting on Kiva somewhat unusual. Unlike most other loans, Kiva’s partner MUK will be in contact primarily with the group leadership team who in turn will be overseeing the end borrowers.  As such, journal updates likely will reflect the performance of the lending group rather than the individual end borrowers.

loans.use: As capital to develop the business

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: El Sr. Mariano nacido el 2 de junio en Villa Barrientos en 1980 casado con doña flora y con un hijo pequeño, el trabaja de agricultor en su propia parcela en cañada sthrogers hace 11 años, en la cual siembra yuca, maiz, y sorgo para hacer escoba y todo lo que produce el saca ha vender al mercado de el torno, es una persona responsable y trabajadora que saca a su familia adelante, esta  muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Mariano was born in Villa Barrientos on July 2, 1980. He is married to Flora and has a young son. He has been working as a farmer on his own land for 11 years, where he raises yucca, corn, and sorghum to make brooms and sells everything in the Torno market. He is a very responsible person who works hard to get his family ahead. He is very grateful to Emprendedor and Kiva for the trust given him by granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wire (fence)

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio  tiene 37 años y esta casado con la Sra. Elida con quien tienen dos hijos en edad escolar secundario. El Sr. A. tiene un terreno grande donde tiene plantación de horticultura por una parte y por otra parte tienen vacas lecheras y también el mismo se encarga de ordeñar y cuidar de los dos trabajos, en la casa tienen una Despensa donde se quedan a atender la señora con sus hijos.
La Despensa tienen bien surtida porque tiene muchos cliente del barrios y también  vienen de otros. El crédito que están solicitando es para la compras de mercaderías que mas venta tiene como; panificados, embutidos, lácteos, carnes, gaseosas, cervezas.
texts.en:
Julio is 37 years old. He is married to Elida with whom he has two high school age children. Mr. A. has a large plot of land where he a horticulture plantation on one part and dairy cows and the other. He does the milking and does both jobs. In his house he also has a store which his wife runs with their children. The store has a good variety of products since he has a lot of customers from the neighborhood and some come from others. The loan he is asking for is to purchase the best selling merchandise such as: baked goods, cold cuts, meat, soda and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as baked goods, cold cuts, meat, soda and beer

loans.name: Codou

texts.fr: Codou D. est âgée de 41 ans, elle est veuve et vit avec ses 3 enfants dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THIECKENE depuis 8ans et demi. Elle est très expérimentée en matière de crédit et dans son domaine d'activité. Elle est vendeuse de fruits; elle achète son produit à bord champ, dans les vergers, et revend au niveau du marché de son quartier et ses bénéfices lui permettent de prend sa progéniture en charge et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Codou D. is 41 years old. She is a widow and lives with her three children for whom she is the sole support. She has been a member of the Thieckene “Banc Villageois” loan group for 8 ½ years, and is quite experienced with regard to credit loans and her area of activity. She is a fruit vendor; she buys her produce in fields and orchards for resale in local markets. Her profits enable her to take care of her offspring and meet her own personal needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her activity as fruit vendor

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan from Preak Raing village in Kandal province consists of 17 members. Mrs. Thorn V. was selected by the other members as the village bank president. The members will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs.Thorn V. is 48 years old.  Her husband is a vice village chief, for which he receives a small salary to support his family.  They have four children: one is a seamstress in a garment factory, one is a labourer, and the other two are students who also support their mother’s business.  Mrs. Thorn V. is a grocery seller who owns a general store. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it, and has thus decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries and expand her business activities.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité  Esperanza se encuentra en su  5to ciclo dentro del programa de comités, son señoras de la zona de  Kokuere San Lorenzo, están trabajando hace  1 año y medio con la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Todas se encuentran muy satisfechas con las actividad es que realizan  y desean continuar con el trabajando ya hasta ahora consiguieron buenos resultados.
Una de ellas es la señora Marina Quien se dedica a la venta de productos de uso domestico, ella tiene 4 hijos en edad escolar y su marido es empleado de una fabrica de jabón.
Actualmente tienen buenos ingresos con las actividades que los dos realizan y en esta  oportunidad solicita el préstamo ya que quieren hacer algunas mejoras en la casa, y deben comprar los material que van  a ser utilizado(ladrillos y cemento).
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” (Hope) committee is in its 5th cycle within the committees program. They are women from Kokuere San Lorenzo zone and have been collaborating with Fundación Paraguaya for a year and a half. They are all very satisfied with the activities they do and wish to continue working as they have done so to date because they have had good results. One of the group members is Marina who is a home products merchant. She has four school aged children and her husband is employed at a soap factory. They earn good income from the activities they each do and are asking for funds to do some home improvements and they need to buy the necessary materials and supplies (bricks and cement).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: 16.04.03 Đông Hai Group

texts.en:
Yen Nguyen Thi (6) is a 23-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Yen is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03-Đông Hải (16-04-03 Đông Hải).


Yen is married and has one infant child.  To make a living, Yen operates a family member's business harvesting & selling river-caught fish in the local community.  Yen has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,700,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2009, Yen joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Yen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,963,500 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell.  The loan will be the second loan taken out by Yen from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Yen plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Vu Thi Nhung (3) is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


2.  Do Thi Van (73) is a 20-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Nguyen Thi Du (1) is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Yen Nguyen Thi (6) là 23 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Yen là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03-Đông Hai (16-04-03 Đông Hai).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ thu hoạch & bán các loại cá đánh bắt ở sông trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Yen thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Yen kiếm được khoảng 1700000 VND.  Vào 2009, Yen đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Yen đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1,963,500 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thiết bị đánh cá bao gồm lưỡi câu & lưới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Vu Thi Nhung (3) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Do Thi Van (73) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Nguyen Thi Du (1) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3079800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kimhong's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mouylen L. is 37 years old and is the leader of group loan who was selected by the group which consists of four members, located in Preak Raing village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mrs. Mouylen L. is a grocery seller who owns a small store at home to support her family. For her grocery business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to enlarge her business activities. She and her husband have a child who is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Akwata Empola Gayaza, Kampala Group

texts.en:
Her down-the-line hard work and self-assured attitude has been her winning calling card in a five-year-old restaurant business in Gayaza, Kampala. This has been the bedrock for the growth of 40-year-old K. Martha’s business.

Basking in the glow of a good marriage has also, in a way, contributed to the stability and longevity of Martha’s business. With the support of her husband, who has always been at her beck and call, this mother of four has gone out of her way to fend off the many challenges that have come her way.

In a week, Martha says she makes profits in the range of 70,000 shillings and she is hoping for improved and fresh conditions on the acquisition of this loan. She started off with a clothes-selling business that she dispensed with after much second thought. With this loan, which is her second, she wants to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs like bananas, beans, soya beans, meat, cassava, etc., for her restaurant

loans.name: Filomena's Group

texts.en:
Filomena Z. is from the village of Malibago. She is 57 years old and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Filomena is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates specialized retail store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $40 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Filomena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Filomena is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Camp Philips, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 56 years old and is married with one adult child.

Elena owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 23,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase medication for her pigs.

Elena is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pigs. This loan will be her 8th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pigs

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Laura 35 años de edad, habitante del barrio la Fuente casada, su esposo trabaja como comerciante en venta de bisutería, mejorar por completo su casa está dentro de sus planes futuros.
Mujer emprendedora, trabajadora con una amplia visión de superación, tiene su propio negocio de ventas de cosméticos desde hace un año lo inicio en su medio de trabajo ella empezó a venderles a sus compañera de trabajo así aumento sus ingresos y las cantidades de producto obteniendo mayores pedidos logrando Mantenerse en el mercado. Hasta la fecha no ha tenido ninguna dificultad siendo de ventajas para el seguir creciendo en las ventas de sus productos. Sus planes en campo laboral es seguir expandiéndose colocar mejor sus bisuterías y obtener mayores ganancias. 
Con el préstamo que solicita invertirá en compra de productos  Avon como: cremas de cutis, perfume de dama, caballeros, vanidad, rubor, shampoo de bebe entre otros para mayores ventas. siendo la institución de gran puerta en su inversión.
texts.en:
Laura is 35 years old and lives in the Fuente neighborhood. She is married and her husband sells costume jewelry. One of her future plans is to totally improve her house. She is and enterprising, hardworking woman with a strong vision of overcoming obstacles. She has had her own business selling cosmetics for a year. She started it through her job. She began selling to her co-workers and in this way she increased her income. She began to have a larger amount of product and obtained more orders and kept herself in the market. Thus far she has not had any difficulties and that has been an advantage to continue increasing sales of her products. Her work plans are to keep expanding, placing her jewelry stores in better locales and making greater earnings. With the loan that she is asking for, she will invest in purchasing Avon product such as: skin creams, women's perfume, men's cologne, blush, baby shampoo and other items in order to have more sales. The institution has been a wonderful door to her investment.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy Avon products such as: women's perfume, men's cologne,  blush, baby shampoo, and other products that are big sellers so that she can diversify her small business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tools and supplies for lock business.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana M. lives in the historic city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its culture. She is a 35-year-old housewife as well as a businesswoman who manages her domestic chores & business very well. She has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both are attending school and getting their education. 

Rukhsana supports her family by doing sewing. She collects orders from neighborhood clients and supplies the finished goods on time to earn an income. Her business is doing well and she earns a reasonable income from it every month.

Her husband is a scrap dealer by trade and operates a scrap shop in the market. Both of their earning help them to support their household and to pay the education expenses of their kids. They have a dream to give their children better education facilities so as to make their future bright by getting good jobs.    

Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Asasah to financially assist her husband in his scrap business. With the loan amount he will buy scrap and increase his earning.  She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 3rd loan. In her previous loans, she maintained a good record and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Purchase scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Thirty-one-year-old Florence Nakityo has been teaching for the past 15 years in Kayunga town. She is a qualified teacher who notwithstanding the low remuneration has set a precedent in most schools she teaches in with her exemplary vigor and enthusiasm whilst she goes about her trivial round. This has in many respects gotten her into the good books of many school head teachers, who all speak glowingly of her high-spirited attitude and line of conduct.   

By her own account, teaching is a profession she is proud of and that is principally the reason she strives to give a good account of herself in whatever school she teaches in. 

Florence is single and has no kids but she has responsibilities that look her in the face every day. She says she is from an extended family and the onus has invariably been on her to pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters. The money she makes as a teacher at times shortchanges her and as a result, she is unable to fully pay up on time. With this loan, however, she says she will be able to meet all the financial school dues for her siblings on time.

loans.use: The school fees of her young brothers and sisters

loans.name: Tsegmid

texts.en:
Tsegmid T. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvs, Mongolia. He and his family live in their ger /Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His wife operates a sewing business by producing a variety of deels, a traditional Mongolian coat, in their home.Tsegmid has been operating a taxi service for the past five years after moving to the capital city of the province. He used to live a nomadic lifestyle in the country, herding his livestock. 

Over the years, he has built a stable taxi service with a monthly revenue of between 150,000 and 180,000 MNT. He wants to change cars and get a more convenient, faster one. He has sold his previous car at 2,000,000 MNT and soon will purchase a new car in Ulaanbaatar. Tsegmid is a very clever and talkative person. He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a new Japanese car at 4,500,000 MNT for his taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a new car

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 49 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, aproximadamente a tres horas y media de camino de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. El cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo en donde ha instalado mango y limón. El cosecha estos productos y los ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras que se encuentran instaladas en la zona. Adicionalmente brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en sus tiempos libres, para ello cuenta con una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte).

Roberto desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos y de ese modo asegurarse una buena cosecha. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

El es una persona responsable y que se esfuerza a diario para sacar adelante a su familia. Anteriormente ya ha tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 49 years old, is married and lives with his wife and two children in the village of Hualtaco, in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area that is located in the Piura province, in the region of the same name. It is approximately 3 and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. 

He works in agriculture. He has a small parcel of land where he has planted mango and lemon. He harvests the fruits and sells them to the processing plants in the area. In his free time he also transports cargo, as well as people, in his mototaxi (a motorized vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached in order to transport passengers or goods)

Roberto would like to purchase fertilizers in order to care for his crop and ensure a good harvest. That is why he has decided to request a loan from 
Edpyme Alternativa.

He is a responsible person who works hard every day to take care of his family. He has had loans with Edpyme Alternativa before and has always been punctual and responsible with his payments.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer in order to maintain his mango and lemon trees

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Agua Viva, tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene un niño de 8 años.
Mercedes es de profesión docente de educación secundaria en el área de sociales trabaja en un Centro Educativo en el distrito de San José de Ticcllas. Tambien vende prendas de vestir y zapatos los días domingos en la feria de Las América distrito de San Juan Bautista, realiza este negocio hace dos años. Solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos variados y ropa de la estación.
Le gusta las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque puede ahorrar y las capacitaciones que recibe los hace extensivos entres sus alumnos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y formalizar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes belongs to the 'Agua Viva' community bank.  She is 35 years old, married and has an 8 year-old child.

Mercedes is, by profession, a high school social science teacher.  She works in a school in the district of San José de Ticcllas.  She also sells clothes and shoes on a Sunday in the Las Américas market in the district of San Juan Bautista.  She has been in this business for two years.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy shoes and seasonal clothes.

She likes the meetings of her community bank because she can save and she extends the training that she receives to her pupils.  Her dream is for her business to grow and to make her business official.

loans.use: To buy shoes and seasonal clothes

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
El señor Enrique D. G. es padre de familia preocupado por el patrimonio y el bienestar de ella misma. Hace tiempo adquirió una vivienda de interés social al que poco a poco le ha hecho mejoras a ella con prestamos de esta institución, el cual agradece por el apoyo brindado ya que por esto el ha podido realizar sus proyectos.
Enrique en este momento esta terminando la fachada de afuera de su vivienda, por lo que el necesita capital para seguir con la construcción y así su casa se vea presentable.
texts.en:
Mr. Enrique D. G. is father concerned about the assets and well-being of his family. Some time ago, he acquired middle-income public housing, and, little by little, he has been renovating it with loans from this institution. He is thankful for the support offered to him because it has enabled him to complete his projects.

At this time, Enrique is completing the façade of his home. To do this, he needs capital to continue with the construction and to makes his home look presentable.

loans.use: To finish construction

loans.name: Fátima Del Socorro

texts.es:
Fátima del Socorro F. es una mujer trabajadora y esforzada la cual es propietaria de un taxi quien invertirá el crédito para renovar el permiso, chequeo y repuestos para mejorar la seguridad de sus clientes. Ella desea poder comprar otro taxi para seguir aumentando y acrecentar su negocio. 
Fuente tiene dos hijos los cuales son mayores de edad uno de sus hijo es quien maneja el taxi.
texts.en: Fátima del Socorro F. is a hard-working and determined woman who owns a taxi.  She will invest her loan in renewing her vehicle's license, having it serviced and buying spare parts so that she can improve her customers' safety.  She would like to buy another taxi so that she can continue growing her business.  F. has two grown-up children.  It is one of her sons who drives the taxi.

loans.use: To renew her vehicle's license, have it serviced and pay for maintenance work

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Eleuteria  tiene 66 años ,tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, ella posee una despensa  con una antigüedad de 20 años con una  buena clientela formada en el barrio donde vive y sus alrededores. 
Es un verdadero sacrificio para ella  porque tiene que madrugar para surtir su negocio y así cumplir con sus clientes .
Eleuteria necesita de este crédito para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad por las fiestas que se aproximan  y así lograr  mejores ganancias . 
En el futuro desea ampliar su negocio y comprar un vehículo para realizar mejor su trabajo
texts.en: Mrs. Eleuteria  is 66 and has 4 children, all grown. She has a 20-year-old store with a good customer base from her neighbourhood and the surrounding area. It is a true sacrifice for her because she has to get up early to stock her business and thus serve her customers. Eleuteria needs this loan for the purchase of merchandise for the upcoming holidays in order to obtain better income. In the future she wants to expand her business and purchase a vehicle to better do her job.

loans.use: The purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, oil, meat, yerba, etc.

loans.name: Antonio Desiderio

texts.es: El Sr. Antonio Desiderio C. E. vive junto a su esposa e hijos. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo. El Sr. Antonio trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa de la zona. Su esposa tambien trabaja como obrera de campo. El Sr. Antonio requiere el crédito para realizar algunos arreglos a su vivienda. Su sueño segun nos comenta es terminar de construir su vivienda y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. El Sr. Antonio está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Mr. Antonio Desiderio C. E. lives with his wife and children. He has his own home in the Pueblo Nuevo district. Antonio works as a farm labourer in a business in the area. His wife also works as a farm labourer. Antonio needs a loan to make some repairs to his home. His dream, he tells us, is to finish building his home and be able to give his family a better quality of life. Antonio is very grateful for the support that we are able to offer him through this loan.

loans.use: home improvements

loans.name: Adriana Katiny

texts.es:
Adriana Katiny M. V. tiene 18 años, vive en Unión libre con su esposo en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. No Tiene  hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. NUEVO AMANECER se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Adriana Katiny se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agros  y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener bienestar en su familia

Le gusta  mirar televisión, y salir a las fiestas
texts.en:
Adriana Katiny M. V., aged 18, lives in a common-law marriage with her husband in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos. She has no children.

The members of the rural communal bank Nuevo Amanecer ("New Dawn") meet on the grounds of San Luís de Zapotal in the canton of Ventanas. This group of 12 members works in agriculture in short-cycle sowing of corn and rice.

Adriana Katiny is a farmer. She grows corn and rice. She buys her agricultural supplies from Farma-Agros and sells her products at the same place.

She applies for a loan to finance her sowing of corn and rice. She needs agricultural consumables and seeds. The loan will help her to pay for the required supplies. She faces challenges such as plagues, diseases and weather changes. Her dream is to enjoy well-being in her family. She likes watching television and partying.

loans.use: To buy agricultural consumables and seeds

loans.name: Hevert Antonio

texts.es: Hevert Antonio se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte y sorbeteria. Desde hace más de 11 años que busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos. Inicio este medio de vida debido a la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, siempre ha sido un padre responsable que se preocupa por sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. El ha buscado la forma de buscar un trabajo que le proporcione ingresos diarios. Este crédito es para la compra de helados, sorbetes y realizarle mejoras a su medio de transporte.
texts.en:
Hevert Antonio provides transportation services and sells sorbet. For more than eleven years, he has worked to find ways to improve his income. He started working out of necessity in order to cover his household expenses. Hevert has always been a responsible father who is concerned about his two dependent children. He has looked for work that will generate a daily income.

This loan will be used to buy ice cream, sorbet, and will help him improve his transportation service.

loans.use: Operating capital for his transportation & ice cream businesses

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino, es un hombre carismático, de 58 años, viudo y padre de 3 hijos que son independientes. Vive en casa de su hermano. Desde muy joven Marino ha trabajado en diversos oficios, y desde que falleció su esposa y sus hijos se independizaron se ha sentido muy solo. Es así como su hermano le ofreció trabajar en su cuadrilla de estibador. Desde entocnes diario madrugan y trabajan con su hermano, para  descargar los camiones con cargas de azúcar y arroz, ya que para las  7  ú  8 de la mañana, hayan logrado descargar hasta dos carros. De este modo lleva su vida Marino,  más tranquilo y seguro de lo que quiere para su futuro. Por ello, esta pensando en construir su propio cuarto en el terreno que le brinda su hermano y, de ese modo mejorar su calidad de vida. A él le han reincorporado a un grupo pequeño, por lo que es su primer crédito con MFP, y dice “que con confíen en él y estén seguros que pagará todas sus cuotas puntualmente”, ya que desea seguir trabajando para progresar. Y, con el crédito que solicita, comprará cemento y arena, para que él mismo construya su cuarto, ya que también conoce mucho de albañilería.
texts.en:
Marino is a charismatic 58 year-old man.  He is a widower and father to three children who now live independently.  Marino lives in his brother's home.

Marino has worked in a number of trades from a very young age.  Since his wife died and his children grew up he has felt very lonely so his brother offered him work in his team working as a docker.  Marino gets up very early in the morning and works with his brother, unloading trucks with cargos of sugar and rice.  By 7 or 8 in the morning they have managed to unload up to two cars. This is how Marino leads his life but it is quieter and safer than he would like for his future.  For this reason, he is planning to build his own room on a plot of land that his brother has offered him in order to improve his quality of life.

Marino has been reincorporated into a small group for his first loan with MFP and he says that they trust him and are certain that he will make all his loan repayments on time since he would like to continue working in order to make progress.  Marino will use the loan money to buy cement and sand so that he himself can build his room since he knows a lot about building work.

loans.use: To buy cement and sand

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es: Pilar tiene 58 años. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Ella dio inicio hace 13 años, por lo que anteriormente como no tenía suficiente ingresos, pero con lo poco que obtuvo logro establecerse y con mucho esfuerzo logro recolectar algo de dinero y emprendedoramente decide establecer su propia pulpería, por lo que con la ayuda de los financiamiento ha logrado invertir cada día en su negocio para satisfacer la demanda. Actualmente con el financiamiento lograra comprar golosinas, jugos, gaseosas y productos para el hogar. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Pilar is 58 years old and manages a store. She started her business thirteen years ago because she was not earning enough income. With much effort over a period of time, she accumulated enough money to open her own store. The loans she has received have helped her invest each day in her business so that she can keep up with demand.

Her current loan will be used to buy candy, juices, sodas, and household products. Her wish is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy candy, juices, sodas, and household products

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn R. is from the village of Ricoro, Gingoog City. She is 31 years old and married, with an infant child. To make a living, Juvelyn runs a sari-sari (variety) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling products for daily use such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, snack food and detergent in the local community. Juvelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juvelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Juvelyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack food to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Juvelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack food to sell

loans.name: Sophanran

texts.en:
Mr. Sophanran E. is 37 years old and his wife, Mrs. Sophan Hun, is 31 years old. They have been married since 2004 and have one daughter who is in first grade. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sophanran is a car repairman who works in Phnom Penh. His wife is an accountant for a company in Phnom Penh as well. Sophanran is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work

loans.name: Bolorchimeg

texts.en:
Bolorchimeg, 39, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Zavhan province of Mongolia. Her oldest son goes to a local secondary school while the youngest attends kindergarten. 

Her husband used to herd husbandry animals bet became a taxi driver in 2010. She operates a shoe-making business in her town. She started her business in 1995 at her home. She makes variety of shoes using leather, rubber, plastic and other materials. Her shoes are well-known for their durability amongst her customers. 

Before her shoe making business she used to conduct a traditional clothing making business for 5 years. Therefore she is quite experienced in managing and operating her business. She is a diligent woman who says, "I want to receive the loan in order to expand my business. I definitely will pay back the loan on time." She is requesting a 1,800,000 Mongolian tugrug (MNT) loan to purchase leather, rubber and some glue for her shoe-making business.

loans.use: To purchase leather, rubber, and some glue

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes at wholesale rate

loans.name: Benicio

texts.es:
Benicio tiene 39 años de edad y vive en una casa familiar en el distrito de OImos ubicado en Lambayeque. Benicio vive en la parte urbana de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos.

Desde hace 6 años, Benicio tien una bodega de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar aceite) la cual cuenta con una clientela establecida. Benicio realiza las compras para su bodega en el distrito de Olmos pero una vez al mes en la ciudad de Chiclayo, pues encuentra mayor variedad de productos y a veces a menor precio. Benicio siempre ha surtido su negocio con capital propio. Sin embargo este ahora no le alcanza.

Benicio solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que utilizará par comprar productos para su bodega, pues su demanda ha crecido y los precios del azúcar y el arroz han subido.
Benicio estaría muy agradecido con este préstamo porque le permitirá no descuida r a su clientela.
texts.en:
Benicio is 39 years old.  He lives a relative’s house in the Olmos district in Lambayeque.  Benicio lives in the urban part of this district, and he has basic services.

Benicio has had a grocery store (rice, sugar, oil) for six years, and he has established customers.  Benicio makes the purchases for his grocery store in the Olmos district.  However, once a month he buys in Chiclayo because he finds a greater variety of products, and at times, lower prices there.  Benicio has always stocked his business with his own capital.  However, he does not have enough now.

Benicio is requesting a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use the loan to buy products for his grocery store.  His demand has grown, and the sugar and rice prices have increased.

Benicio would be very grateful for this loan because it would keep him from disappointing his customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries (rice and sugar).

loans.name: Sott

texts.en:
Sott, 48 years old, lives in the Ang Snoul district. 

She owns a small store in front of the garment factory, which is full of garment workers, and she uses this store to sell breakfast and lunch foods. She generates a profit approximately of US $3 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses. 

She doesn’t have a life partner because she was divorced from her husband several years ago. 

She has four children. Three are single and one is married. She has some income from her son, who works in construction. 

Sott will be using the loan to purchase a used motorcycle for the traveling needs of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for the family.

loans.name: Ligia Antonia

texts.es: Ligia de 27 años es soltera, trabaja como responsable de cartera y cobro desde hace 2½ años, ademas se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata y oro laminado para obtener ingresos adicionales para asi brindarle apoyo a su mamá, pues actualmente no tiene familia propia. Esta solicitando su 3er credito con el objetivo de invertir en su pequeño negocio comprando prendas para poder ofrecer mas a sus clientes y satisfacer sus demandas.  Sueña en el futuro poder tener su propio negocio que le permita brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ligia, 27 years old and single, has worked as an account manager for two and a half years. In addition to this, she sells gold and silver-plated jewelry to earn extra income and support her mother because right now she does not have her own family. She is requesting her third loan to invest in her small business, buying items so she will be able to offer more to her customers and satisfy their demands. Her dream for the future is to have her own business that will allow her to giver her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry pieces to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa  is a single mother of  five children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members.

Kasifa owns a retail shop at Busega. She has been in business for four years and sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.  Kasifa has requested a loan of 1,100,000 from Kiva partner MCDT SACCO to buy more stock for her shop.  Kasifa lives in a home that she rents and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expense includes rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 31 years old, married and has two children. One of his children is currently in school. They live in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.

For less than a year Daniel has had a hardware shop where he sells building materials. He also sells produce.

To help expand his business, Daniel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase building materials for resale.

With the help of his loan from BRAC, Daniel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. In the future, Daniel hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for resale.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eugenia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas” del Distrito y Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 28 años, es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos que están estudiando en el nivel  primario e inicial.

Empezó su negocio por iniciativa de su cuñada quien al ver su necesidad ecnómica le sugirió emprender un negocio. Inicialmente preparaba comida que ofrecía a algunas personas que vendían en el mercado, y poco a poco fue ganando más clientela, con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00, compró una parrilla y decidió vender en el mercado cercano a su casa, empezó vendiendo parrillas y juanes (comida típica). 
Actualmente continúa con el negocio y también vende en su casa chupetes (helado de hielo) y gelatinas, con ello obtiene algo más de ganancias.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 comprará  productos para preparar su comida y además frutas e insumos para la elaboración de chupetes y gelatina. Tiene una vasta clientela que la prefiere por su buena sazón y su amabilidad.
 
Eugenia,  es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un negocio en su casa como la venta de abarrotes, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Sra. Eugenia is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Lameñas” which is located in the District and Province of Lamas, Department of San Martín. She is 28 years old and has two children who are attending elementary school and preschool.

Eugenia’s sister-in-law suggested that she started a business in order to meet her financial needs. She started preparing food and began selling it to people at the market. Little by little, she gained more customers. With her first loan of 300 PEN, Eugenia bought a grill and decided to sell grilled meats and “juanes” (a traditional Peruvian dish of chicken and rice wrapped in banana leaves) at the market near her house. She has continued this business and also sells ice cream and gelatins at home to generate extra income.

With this new loan of 1500 PEN, Eugenia will buy products for preparing her dishes, as well as fruits and supplies for making ice cream treats and gelatin. She has a large customer base who prefer the good taste of her food and her friendly service.

Eugenia is a determined and enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a business in her home, such as a grocery store. She is extremely grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing women like her the opportunity to make their dreams a reality.

loans.use: to purchase meat, bananas, rice, oil, and charcoal.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, de 43 años de edad, es un dichoso padre soltero de tres 3 hermosos hijos: Pamela, Lisbeth y Jordi. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). El producto bandera de esté lugar, es el café. Pero Oscar hace ya 20 años que se dedica no solo a la siembra de este producto, él también, siembra plátano, maíz y yuca, los que le dan buena cosecha y por ende buenos ingresos.
