Pero como buen hombre de campo, es un trabajador incansable; y cuando tienen tiempo, ¡que son pocos!, él se dedica al trabajo de electrificación que promueve el estado peruano, con ello generar luz, en los poblados lejanos de la amazonía peruana; con el dinero que gana en este trabajo, Oscar espera obtener un dinero extra para poder mejorar sus cultivos, y conseguir ser reconocido no solo por los compradores; sino también por las cooperativas de café que siempre buscan un buen grano. Ya comenzó a dar el primer paso en la capacitación que recibió, donde aprendió el proceso de germinado, embolsado y transplantado de los viveros de café. Él pertenece al banco comunal “La Unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde está orgulloso de pertenecer a un banco comunal, donde las personas son muy responsables y honestas. Razón por la que paga puntualmente sus cuotas. Oscar de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para aplicar todo los conocimientos adquiridos en su capacitación.
texts.en: Oscar is 43 years old and he is the lucky father of 3 beautiful children: Pamela, Lisbeth, and Jordi. They live together as a family in their own home, located in the locality of La Union Palomar (central Peruvian jungle). The primary product of this region is coffee. But Oscar has been planting not only this product but also bananas, corn, and yucca for the past 20 years.  These produce good harvests and as a result, good earnings. But as a good agriculturist he is inexhaustible so when he has some spare time (which is not much!) he works as an electrician as promoted by the Peruvian state, bringing electricity to the distant villages in the Peruvian Amazon. With the funds he generates with this employment, Oscar hopes to obtain extra funds to improve his cultivations. He wants to be recognized not only by his buyers but also by the coffee cooperatives who are always in search of good coffee beans. He has already taken the first step with the orientation he received. He learned about the germination process, packaging, and coffee plant transplantation. He is a member of the communal bank "La Union Hace la Fuerza del Palomar", meaning "Unity is the Strength of Palomar" and it is his second loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He is proud to be part of a communal bank where the members are very responsible and honest. This is the reason he will make his payments on time. Oscar, on receiving this support, will invest the funds he requests in the purchase of several sacks of natural fertilizers, to apply as per the knowledge he acquired through his orientation.

loans.use: to purchase several sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Jean Aida

texts.en:
Jean Aida, a 55 year-old-woman, is married but has no children to care for. She is a resident of Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Farming is her main source of income. She often works under the heat of the sun and even under heavy rain just to cope with the time, to finish what needs to be done in a day.  Her life situation looks like this most often, but she managed to withstand it for 5 years until the present time. Every month, Jean Aida gets a total of PHP 10,000 from her work.

Earlier this year, Jean Aida became a GDMPC member. She is applying a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for land preparation costs. She hopes to start planting the crops allotted for the area soon, and expects a large harvest made possible by this loan. Jean Aida plans to purchase the required fertilizers for quick growth and pesticides to protect the plants from harmful pests.

loans.use: pay to prepare her land for farming

loans.name: Khudoiberdi

texts.ru:
Худойберди добрый, умный и честный человек. Он любящий и ответственный муж. Худойберди вот уже более 5 лет занимается выпечкой национальных лепешек. В течение 2 года расширил свой бизнес в два раза и дальше настроен усовершенствовав навыки и умения, обогатить свой ассортиментам разными видами национальных лепешек. По мимо этого он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Худойберди хотел бы получит займ в размере 1300$ США для покупки муки и скота. Он заранее благодарен вам всем за вашу доброту!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Khudoiberdi is a kind, smart and honest man. He is a loving father and a responsible husband. Khudoiberdi has been baking traditional flat breads for more than five years. During the two years he expanded his business by twice and plans to further develop his skills and abilities and to enrich his assortment production with different kinds of flat breads. He also does feeding and breeding of cattle. Khudoiberdi wants to receive a loan in the amount of $1,300USD to buy flour and cattle. He is thanking you all in advance for your kindness!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy flour and cattle

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is 27 years old  married with three children. Two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Viola requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase or order more charcoal to sell. She says that she will use the extra income for building a store for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hard-working business woman aged 39. She is married and blessed with four children. For the last 13 years, she has been managing a salon to earn a living. She has grown her business with her previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  

In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy a hair blow dryer and hair braids.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and hair braids.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa cuenta con 47 años de edad es casada tiene 1  hijo que depende de ella el cual estudia la secundaria su esposo se llama Filiberto el cual se dedica al campo.

Rosa se dedica al comercio vende pollos el cual surtió su granja comprando cajas de pollos, ella dice que la beneficio mucho ya que surtió su negocio y tuvo más ganancias.

A ella le gustaría que su negocio incrementara aun más ya que le gustaría establecer una granja más grande.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old, married and has a dependent son going to secondary school.  Her husband’s name is Filiberto and he works in the fields.

Rosa is a chicken merchant.  She stocked her farm buying crates of chickens.  She says that this benefitted her much because she stocked her business and earned higher profits.

She’d like her business to grow still more because she’d like to have a larger farm.

loans.use: to buy crates of chickens.

loans.name: Moyniso

texts.ru: Мойнисо проживает в районе Вахдат. Она замужем. Ей 31 год. У нее двое детей. Ее муж занимается строительными работами по найму. Сама Мойнисо у себя дома занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Moyniso lives in the Vahdat district.  She is 31 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is involved in to-hire construction work.  Moyniso is involved in animal husbandry at home.  She breeds livestock for subsequent resale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a bull.

loans.use: to purchase a bull

loans.name: Dany Maria

texts.es: Dany Maria tiene 30 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos menores de edad. Ella se describe como una persona de carácter fuerte y muy decidida, es también una mujer emprendedora que todos los días tiene el deseo de superación buscando el bienestar de su familia. El motivo del crédito es para la compra telas, hilos, agujas, tijeras, botones, cintas. Esta inversión le ayudará a que su negocio. Su sueño es poder tener un local mas grande y así obtener buenos ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Dany Maria is 30 years old.  She is a single mother and has two dependent children.  She describes herself as a person of strong character who is very determined.  She is also an entrepreneurial woman who always wishes to do well and provide for the well-being of her family.  Dany Maria is requesting this loan to buy fabric, threads, needles, scissors, buttons and ribbons.  This investment will help her business.  Her dream is to have larger premises, to make good income and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, needles, scissors, buttons and ribbons

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is aged 28 and is married with four children. Only one of her children attends school.

Jeanette has worked as a tailor for more than four years. She has requested this loan to buy an additional sewing machine. If she is able to realize extra profits from her business, she plans to buy more fabric for use in her tailoring.

loans.use: to buy an extra sewing machine

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en:
Kamene, age 40, has operated a maize-selling business for the past eight months. She offers her maize for sale to local area residents. Her primary challenge is when debtors do not pay off their debts on time. She dreams of expanding her business.

Kamene and her husband have four children who are all working. They own a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Kamena's greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 
 
With the loan of Kshs 10,000, she wants to purchase more stocks of maize. She decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize to offer for sale

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en:
Jorenda is a married woman, having four children. Jorenda is 41 years old, residing at Ozamis, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Jorenda owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as soaps, snack foods and etc. to earn a living and she's been 11 years in this business. Each month, she earns 10,000.00 doing this type of business. 

Jorenda has requested a loan of 25,000.00 to purchase additional product to sell. Jorenda has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Jorenda wants to build her own house and to pay for the studies of her children.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
La Sra. Nilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres de la Colina II”, del Distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo, Provincia y Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 38 años, es conviviente y tiene 04 hijos que están estudiando.
Con cuatro hijos que mantener, se vió en la necesidad de iniciar un negocio para ayudar a su esposo que trabaja en construcción civil, con los gastos de su hogar, se inició vendiendo frutas por las mañanas en la vereda de sus casa, cuando ingresó al banquito comunal tuvo la oportunidad de iniciar con otro negocio que la ayude con sus gastos, con un capital inicial de S/300.00 compró una parrilla para dedicarse a la venta de comidas preparadas de 5:00 pm a 9:00 pm en la esquina de su casa, por la afluencia de  clientela y porque su casa viene siendo refaccionada para poder trabajar desde allí.
Actualmente cuenta con una amplia clientela que la busca por la amabilidad y el buen trato que les brinda, además de su rica preparación, así sale adelante con su familia.
Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 soles comprará  productos para implementar su negocio con pollos vivos, ingredientes para sazonar, carbón para asar sus  parrillas, para así captar nuevos clientes y mantener satisfechos a sus clientes actuales, pues su negocio está bien ubicado.
Nilda,  es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora,  su sueño es contar con un restaurante donde pueda trabajar desde su  casa y atender a sus hijos, está muy contenta de trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que da oportunidad a mujeres como ella de independizarce económicamente.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to the “Mujeres de la Colina II” (Women of the Hill II) communal bank in La Banda de Shilcayo District, San Martín Province and Department.  She’s 38 years old, has a spouse and four children who are attending school.

With four children to support she needed to start a business to help her husband who works in civil construction with household expenses.  She started out selling fruit in the morning in front of her house.  When she joined the communal bank she had the opportunity to start another business to help with expenses.  With a 300 sol capital she bought a grill to start selling prepared meals from 5pm until 9pm at the corner at her house because there is a high number of customers there and her house is being remodeled so that she can work from there.  She currently has a large clientele that seeks her out because of her kind service and the pleasant time she provides in addition to the delicious food and this is how she gets ahead with her family.

She will use this 800 sol loan to buy ingredients to stock her business with live chickens, seasoning ingredients, charcoal for the grills to attract new customers and keep her current ones happy because her business is well-located.

Nilda is a tenacious, enterprising woman. Her dream is to have a restaurant where she can work from home while caring for her children.  She is very happy to work with the Manuela Ramos Movement which gives opportunities to women like her to be economically independent.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Nyamjargal

texts.en: Nyamjargal is 31 years old and lives with his wife and son in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Nyamjargal has an undergraduate degree in IT engineering, and he opened an internet cafe business in early 2011. He also works as an IT engineer in a major corporation. His wife runs the business and his son goes to kindergarten. Nyamjargal's internet cafe currently operates ten computers; however, these are not enough to run his business. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy six additional computers.

loans.use: to buy six additional computers for his internet cafe business.

loans.name: Tomas Manuel

texts.es:
El señor  Manuel , es un humilde agricultor de café , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar siempre en sus estudios a sus hijos  ; ya que la situación del país está muy dura económicamente , lo cual se ha visto en la obligación de laborar como guarda de seguridad tres veces a la semana y el resto del tiempo se lo dedica al cultivo , el necesita con mucha urgencia comprar fertilizantes e insumos para poder aplicarlo sobre las plantas ya que estas carecen abono y este año la producción no fue tan buena y solo logro sacar los costos .
Espera que para el próximo año sea diferente porque es el mayor  recurso con el que cuenta para poder apoyar a su familia y salir adelante .Agradece el apoyo que brinda Afodenic atraves de los fondos Kiva ya que sin ellos no podrían lograr sus sueños .
texts.en:
Sr. Manuel is a humble coffee farmer. His plans for his family include improving their living conditions and providing constant support for his children’s studies. The financial situation in the country is very difficult, so he meets his obligations by working as a security guard three times a week. Manuel spends the rest of his time farming. He urgently needs to purchase fertilizers and supplies for his crops because his production for this year has not been good. So far, he has only managed to recover his costs.

Manuel hopes that next year will be different and result in more income so that he can support his family and help them move forward. He appreciates the support from AFODENIC by providing Kiva funds, which have helped to make his dreams possible.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Luan

texts.en:
Luan and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 54 and has two daughters. Her husband earns an income working as a refrigeration maintenance worker.

She has been earning a living by operating a store from the door of her house for the past three years. She sells a variety of soft drinks and fruit juice. 

Luan would like to borrow money to expand her current business by buying additional fruit and soft drinks. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fruit and soft drinks

loans.name: Gs Manos Asendozas Group

texts.es:
La  Señora Juana, tiene 49 años de edad, no tiene hijos a su cargo y es madre soltera, Su actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de prendas de vestir para damas, ropa de cama y cobertores de muebles contando con una experiencia de mas de 20 años, Doña Juana, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de telas para la elaboración de faldas, camisas, pantalones y uniformes escolares para la buena atención de sus clientes, su negocio lo tiene en su hogar, con el apoyo del préstamo que reciba Doña Juana, le contribuirá a tener un mejor negocio, y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Juana uno de sus sueños es tener un taller de costuras y a su vez un centro de enseñanza como modista.
La Señora Juana, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas ella cuenta con  4 años de experiencia.
La Señora Zuelen, se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa nueva cuenta con un año de experiencia.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Telas para su negocio

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Married and a mother of four children, Madam Efua K., is 42 years old is the 2nd wife of her husband. Having never attended school, her businesses is cassava processing, called «cassava flour». She learned this from her mother 30 years ago. Not having the land or the strength to farm cassava, she requests a loan of $ 950 to strengthen her capacity to buy a cassava farm in order to grow her production and income. Since that career is difficult and dangerous, she requests a grater which will be used by all the village women. So, the requests will serve to buy cassava farm and realization of this project will contribute greatly to her family living condition improvement.

Translated by Farron Blanc

Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Madame K. Efua, âgée de 42 ans est la 2ème femme de son mari. N’ayant jamais mis pied à l’école, elle a comme activité la transformation du manioc en farine appelée « gari ». Elle a hérité cette activité de sa maman depuis 30 ans. N’ayant pas de force ni de terrain pour faire elle-même la culture du manioc, elle sollicite un crédit de $950 pour renforcer son pouvoir d’achat de champs de manioc afin d’accroître sa production et de facto augmenter ses revenus. Aussi, ce métier étant difficile et dangereuse, elle sollicite une râpeuse qui sera mise à la disposition de toutes les femmes du village. Ainsi, le crédit sollicité servira à acheter des champs de manioc et à acquérir une râpeuse. Il est tout à fait évident que la réalisation de ce projet contribuer énormément à l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: to buy cassava farm and grater

loans.name: Kalenda

texts.en: I am a married man and father of 7. I do my business in Bumala in the Busia district. I am the main bread-earner for my family. I deal in and repair second-hand electronics. I believe the loan will help me increase my business skills and educate my dependants.

loans.use: I will use the loan to widen my businesses.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha N. J. has been running her grocery store for more than a year. This is the only source of income for the family, since she supports her parents who are elderly. She is requesting for a loan to buy more merchandise for the store and to buy coolers for the sale of soft drinks and cold cuts.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La sra. Bertha N. J. tiene aproximado mas de un año con su negocio de abarrotes es su ingreso familiar ya que ella mantiene a sus papas por que son personas mayores. Solicita el préstamo para surtir mas la tienda y poner hileras para la venta de refrescos y carnes frías.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Маtluba

texts.en:
Matluba Asoeva is 21 years old. She has a secondary education. She is single. Matluba grew up in a poor family so she had no opportunity to continue her education and she learned how to sew national dresses and caps for women. She acquired sewing skills very fast and became a professional seamstress. Summer is wedding season, so she sews dresses and caps for brides and in winter she knits woolen clothes to provides warmth.

Her business brings a good income to her family. She has three years of experience in this business. For the loan amount for $1000, Matluba is going to buy materials for dresses and national caps. Also she is going to buy yarn to knit warm clothes, because in winter the yarn will be more expensive. This loan helps to increase the range of women's dresses and provides inexpensive materials for knitting warm clothes, thus providing good-quality cheap clothes. Matluba is going to pay off the loan for 12 months.

loans.use: To buy materials (fabric, yarn)

loans.name: Mirgia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Mirgia R., I’m a merchant. I have business of selling creams, perfumes, shampoos etc. located in downtown. I have been doing this type of activity for several years, which generates an income that allows me to cover my expenses and other commitments with suppliers. I’m a single mother and I’m a senior, thanks to this business I can generate an income for my daily sustenance, which makes me quite happy because I still feel strong and I have a big desire to carry on.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Mirgia R., mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de cremas, perfumes, shampoos etc. ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos y demas compromisos con los proveedores, soy madre soltera y de la tercera edad, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos para mi sustento diario, lo que me satisface porque todavia me siento fuerte y con deseos de salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy creams, lotions, perfumes, cosmetics, shampoos

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur is a single man. He has his own shop where he sells household goods. He is 23 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz. He has four years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods to improve his business and get more income.

loans.use: To buy goods for improving his business

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mrs. Ven S. L., age 45, is a vendor in the market earning about $2 per day. Her husband makes $2 per day by driving a horse-cart to transport passengers. They have five children, two who are married and live away from home and three who are students living at home. She would like to request a loan of $500 in order to purchase to purchase a new horse. Their current horse is sick and cannot work, so their income has been cut in half. She will use the loan to purchase a horse to continue her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse to operate a horse-cart business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
My husband and I have been running a business from home for a year. Thank God we have been successful, but now we would like to invest a bit in the purchase of more merchandise because we need to have some products that our customers have asked for. With this investment, both our sales and our earnings will increase. I am requesting $800.00 USD to invest in the purchase of more merchandise for my business.
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
“Mi marido y yo tenemos un negocio en mi casa desde hace 1 año gracias a dios nos ha ido muy bien pero ahora nos gustaría invertir un poco en la compra de más mercancía,  ya que necesitamos tener algunas cosas que nuestros clientes nos solicitan y así tendremos más ventas y por la tanto más ganancias”. Solicito $ 800.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en: Loveth U. is 41 years old. She is married with five children. She is from Edo state, Nigeria. She sells baby products and cosmetics. She has been in business since 1998. She needs the loan amount of $425 to buy more baby products and cosmetics for re-sale

loans.use: To buy more baby products and clothing for sale

loans.name: Xiomara Lissette

texts.es:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Senora Xiomara Mondragon has been selling clothing for ten years, starting her business with no location of her own, and selling very small quantities of clothing. She is married with one son, and together with her husband they do all they can to provide good care and education for their child.

She has been able to grow her business thanks to the loans from Ceprodel, which enabled her to buy more stock and improve her stand in the market of Somotillo where she works. Her greatest need now is to purchase more merchandise and continue to offer her excellent service to her clients.

En el municipio de Somotillo, la señora Xiomara M. se dedica desde hace 10 largos años al negocio de la venta de ropa comenzando el negocio sin tener absolutamente ningún tramo propio y vendiendo mínimas cantidades de ropa. Es madre casada y con un hijo que junto con sus esposo se esfuerza para brindarle la educación que el se merece.

Actualmente, ha logrado surtir su negocio y esto lo ha llevado a cabo gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel otorgándole créditos que los ha invertido en la compra de la ropa y mejora de su tramo en el mercado de Somotillo que es donde ella labora. Su necesidad mayor hoy en día es la adquisición de la mercadería pero una ves mas acude a Ceprodel para obtener el crédito y así continuar en su bello negocio brindando un excelente servicio a sus clientes.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE FOR HER CLOTHING BUSINESS.

loans.name: Evandre Celio Joaqui

texts.en:
Evandre is 24-years-old and originally from Namaacha, a village bordering Swaziland and one of the most developed districts in the Maputo province. Evandre is single and currently lives with 3 younger sisters and his mom.

In 2002, soon after Evandre completed 10th grade in Namaacha, he moved to Manhica to attend a teacher’s professional school. After 2 years he was granted a title to teach primary students up to 7th grade, focusing in mathematics for 6th and 7th grades. Evandre makes MTn 4,700 (around US$190) per month. His family is currently living with him, along with his sisters and mom, he also supports a nephew.

Although Evandre is happy with his new job and his life’s progress, he feels that his income is not enough to start his dream, the construction of his own house. Evandre is very conscious that if he loses his job all his family won’t have a place to live. Therefore, Evandre approached Hluvuku for the first time, after hearing from his sister who is also a client. This loan of MTn 10,000 will be used to buy construction material and start construction. He already has the land, sand and stones and the architect’s plan and approval to build his house. In the future, Evandre would like to build a studio adjacent to the house where he would be able to play music with his friends and eventually record.

loans.use: Buy construction material

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling Andean products became the most important and vital activity for Hilda’s family. She acquires her merchandise from the fairs in small villages near Juliaca, the city where she lives. She then distributes them wholesale to later be sold in Lima, the capital city of her country. With this business she manages to cover the costs of the most urgent needs of her family and the education of her three children. Her dear husband Wilber also actively participates in the business, and along with him she puts forth her greatest effort in order to expand and increase her family’s income day by day. Her desire is to increase the amount of capital invested in her business and they both believe that by achieving this, they will grow their revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio de compra y venta de productos andinos se convirtió en la actividad más importante e indispensable para la familia de Doña Hilda. Ella adquiere su mercadería los días de feria en los pueblitos aledaños a la ciudad donde radica, Juliaca, y los distribuye al por mayor para ser vendidos en la ciudad capital de su país – Lima. Con este negocio logra cubrir las necesidades más urgentes de su familia y la educación de sus 3 hijos, en este su negocio también participa activamente su querido esposo Wilber, con quien en todo momento pone su mayor esfuerzo con el fin de ampliar y aumentar día a día sus ingresos familiares. Su deseo es ampliar el monto de inversión en su negocio y ambos creen que concretando este propósito mejorará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Injection of business capital to increase product sales

loans.name: Olita

texts.en: Olita P., 48, is married with 4 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Ice cake business. She sells to the school children and village people 6 days per week. She has 5 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Olita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be use to start the business. Husband  also had a job at the Ministry of Transport to support her business.

loans.use: Purchase To finance what is needed for her new project.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Marina makes embroidered wallets and crafts, as well as working as domestic help in the southern area of La Paz: she has three children who attend school. She was widowed 5 years ago.

Her home is located in the area of lower San Antonio, one of the most dangerous areas of the city due to the quantity of robberies and assaults: although the house is small and old, the rent is quite high.

This is the second credit she has received from IMPRO, but it will be the first time that Kiva has offered help. She will use the money as work capital and buy primary materials in order to drive forward her artesenal business (as even if she already has a stable employment as a domestic employee, se will be able to increase her income through developing this creative activity.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Marina elabora carteras con hilo y artesanías, igualmente, trabaja como empleada doméstica en la zona sur D. La Paz, tiene 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela y es viuda desD. hace cinco años.

Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona D. San Antonio Bajo (una D. las laderas más peligrosas D. la ciudad pO. la cantidad D. robos y asaltos), aunque la casa es pequeña y vieja, los alquileres son bastante altos.

Este es su segundo crédito en Impro, pero será la primera vez que Kiva le brinD. su apoyo. Ella usará el dinero para capital D. trabajo y compra D. materia prima para impulsar su negocio D. artesanías (puesto que si bien tiene estabilidad como empleada doméstica, sus ingresos podrían ser mayores fomentando una actividad en la que es bastante creativa).

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Víctor Alfonso

texts.es:
Victor is 23, is single and studying to become an Accounting Technician, he lives alone, in a house that he built on a lot that his mom gave him. He owns a “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized cart) that he drives and manages. For this young and hardworking entrepreneur there are no limits, reason why he keeps going.

The most important thing for him is to finish school, so that he can work on the business full time. He works from 6 a.m. to 4 p.m. and goes to school at night. He likes what he does because he can put in practice what he is learning in school. Sometimes it’s difficult when he has too much to study, homework or presentations and there’s not enough time.

Victor asks for a loan to purchase parts and fix his motocarro to work with no problems, in the future he would like to sell parts and own a carwash.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Víctor tiene 23 años, es soltero y estudia para ser técnico en Contabilidad, vive solo, en una casa que construyó en un terreno que le facilitó su madre. Es propietario de un motocarro que él mismo maneja y administra. Para este joven emprendedor y trabajador no existe límites, es por eso que sigue adelante.

Lo más importante es terminar sus estudios y así dedicarse a fondo al negocio, trabaja desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, ya que por las noches estudia, le encanta su trabajo porque es una manera de poner en práctica los conocimientos que va aprendiendo. A veces le resulta difícil cuando tiene mucho que estudiar o tarea que presentar y el tiempo no le alcanza. Trabaja para solventar los gastos de sus estudios y apoyar en lo posible a su mamá.

Víctor solicita este préstamo para comprar repuestos y mandar a reparar su motocarro, y desde luego seguir trabajando sin perjuicio alguno, posteriormente quiere dedicarse a la venta de repuestos hasta llegar a tener un lubricentro.

loans.use: Purchase parts to repair his mortorcycle.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio Lomas del Memorial Sandino, es casado y tiene dos hermosos hijos, su esposa es ama de casa. El negocio de don Wilfredo es la venta de utensilios escolares entre otras variedades, son ocho años los que lleva en las ventas. El inició vendiendo cartera y llaveros,  con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en el negocio en la compra de útiles escolares, para mantener siempre la variedad que lo ha caracterizado. Sus planes son incrementar el volumen de ventas, y obtener nuevo segmento de mercado a través de la oferta de nuevos productos
texts.en:
Mr. Wilfredo is 31 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Sandino Memorial Hills with his wife and two beautiful children. Wilfredo has worked in sales for 8 years. At the beginning Wilfredo sold wallets and key chains, but over time he has expanded his business to the sale of school supplies and other variety items. Wilfredo is requesting this loan in order to purchase a greater quantity of school supplies, and thus continue to provide good variety to his customers. Wilfredo plans to increase his sales and gain a better foot hold within the market by offering new products.

Translated from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school supplies for retail sale.

loans.name: Mr. Hun Tan's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan which is located in Tbeng Khpos Village in Kampong Chhnang Province consists of nine people. They will use the loan which they obtain for different purposes. Mr. Hun T. is the village bank president and a farmer who owns two-hectare to cultivate rice. Aside from this, he is a construction worker who can make a small income to support his household. His wife, Mrs. On Nam, helps him on the plantation. On this plantation, they face a problem because their field is infertile which affects their crops. To solve this problem, Mr. Hun T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field in order to make their crops more productive. Mr. Hun T. is 53 years old and the father of a child who is attending the local school. Two men among the three have come to get a loan instead of their wives because they are busy with their work.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Five members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. The EoT loans allow them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field in order to make their crops more productive.

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru:
Юлдошева Фарида, 1976 года рождения, у нее 1 ребенок. Начала свой бизнес с продажи детской одежды. У нее 8 лет опыта в предпринимательской деятельности. Она торгует на рынке Мубориз Гисарского района. У нее широкий ассортимент детской одежды, начиная с комплектов нижнего белья до одежды младенца и детей до школьного возраста. Это комплект одежды для младенца, нижнее белье, джемпера, носки, спортивная одежда, шапочки и т.д. Фарида в осеннее-зимний сезон хочет закупить джемпера и спортивные костюмы. Покупает свой товар на оптовом рынке Корвон.
Фарида хочет получить с помощью программы Кива займ в сумме 4000 сомони чтоб закупить детские джинсовые брюки и костюмы.
texts.en:
Farida Y. was born in 1976 and has one child. She began her business selling children's clothing and has eight years of experience as an entrepreneur. She sells at the Muboriz Gisarski district market. She has a wide variety of children's clothing for babies to school age kids that includes underwear, jumpers, socks, sport clothes, caps, etc. In the autumn-winter season, she would like to stock up on jumpers and sport suits. She buys her stock at the Korvon wholesale market. With Kiva's assistance, she hopes to take out a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to stock up on denim trousers and suits for children.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of denim trousers and jackets

loans.name: Antenor

texts.es: Antenor es un joven soltero de 21 años, vive con sus padres. Cultivar plátanos es una de las actividades que desde muy niño aprendió a  realizar, ya que sus padres  son agricultores, pero desde hace tres años empezó a trabajar  de manera independiente, ya que es una de las actividades que le agrada realizar  ya que siempre le gustó estar en contacto con la naturaleza y lo que puede  obtener de ella. El cultivo de plátano para é es algo muy rentable, siempre  hay gran demanda de este producto y cabe señalara que le ayuda a pagar sus estudios superiores en la ciudad, sin embargo lo difícil de su actividad es que tiene que  enfrentar el duro sol del día que debilita a cualquiera, sobre todo en la temporada donde hay que sembrar sus plantaciones. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Antenor está dispuesto a incrementar su producción, para ello invertirá en la compra de mayores plantaciones de plátanos y café.
texts.en:
Anteno2, 21, is a single man who still lives with his parents. He learned to grow bananas as a young boy, since his parents are farmers. Three years ago he started working independently because he enjoys being outdoors, in contact with nature, and enjoys Bananas have been a profitable crop as there is a constant demand for this fruit. Anteno is paying for his college education in town with the profits from the bananas. But working and studying is tough as he must work all day under the harsh, debilitating sun, especially in planting season. This is the first loan he requests through MFP. Antenor's goal is to increase his production, so he will invest in purchasing more banana and coffee plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing banana and coffee plantations

loans.name: Sampson

texts.en:
Sampson A. sells terrazzo chips. This is a special type of stone which is cracked into chips; it is a building material used for finishing a wall or floor due to its beauty. Sampson's work site is at Abrobeano near Elmina. Sampson has received senior high school education. He is married and has 5 dependents. His wife is a businesswoman.

Sampson has been selling terrazzo chips since 2003. He is responsible for meeting the family's basic financial needs and also paying the children's school fees. His loan will be used as additional capital to buy more terrazzo for re-sale to meet increasing demand. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to invest in his children's education.

In the picture he is seen sieving the chips.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more terrazzo for re-sale

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 35 años, es casada, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposo y sus hijas. Vende cosméticos desde hace un año, incursionó en este negocio debido a la necesidad de generarse más ingresos económicos, empezó con poca mercadería, pero con el avance del tiempo pudo mejorar sus ingresos, ahora se está preparando para la próxima campaña de ventas, por lo que necesita abastecerse de cosméticos para empezar a buscar a sus amistades y personas cercanas a quienes pueda vender sus productos mostrando previamente sus catálogos, así como los muestrarios. Soledad se está preparando en reunir capital para invertirlo en otro negocio como la venta de ropa. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está satisfecha por la labor que realiza dentro de su banco comunal, además, es una de las integrantes que alienta a los demás a seguir trabajando juntos. Soledad está solicitando esta cantidad para usarla en su totalidad en la compra de cosméticos.
texts.en:
Soledad is 35 years old, married, and lives in a rented house with her husband and daughters. She has been selling cosmetics for a year. She started this business because she needed to make more money. Initially, she had only a little merchandise but with time she earned more and is now getting ready for the next sales campaign. She needs to start sourcing cosmetics and samples so that she can show her friends and people close to her to whom she may sell her products and to whom she has already shown her catalogues. Soledad is getting ready to raise funds to invest in another business, such as selling clothes. This is her second loan with MFP. She enjoys the ongoing work with her community bank, and is one of the members who encourages the other to continue working together. Soledad is asking for this loan to buy cosmetics exclusively.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Akhtar Mohammad

texts.en:
Akhtar Mohammad is the son of Wally Ziada and lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He owns a shoe shop in the city and needs a small loan for his business.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 16 months to increase his inventory and expand his business. Akhtar is very happy about this process of getting a small loan in Afghanistan and wants to thank Kiva lenders from around the world.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and expand the business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Este nuestro socio se llama Miguel Angel, el es natural de la provincia de Urubamba, el tiene 25 años y  es casado tiene 01 hijo de 2 años.

Este socio alquila una combi para prestar servicio de transporte público desde Urubamba a la ciudad del Cusco, diario, el desea poder comprarse a futuro su propia mobilidad para que el dinero que le ingresa sea líquido para el y así no tener que dividir sus ganancias con el dueño.

El socio agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a pagar la deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
This member of the Asociación Arariwa, Miguel Angel, is from the province of Urubamba. He is 25 years old, married, and has a 2 year old son. Miguel Angel rents a van in order to provide public transportation services daily from Urubamba to Cuzco. In the future he would like to be able to buy his own van so that the money he earns will be his own, and he will not have to split his earnings with the owner of the van. He is very grateful for the loan and promises to repay it within the time allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Van Rental

loans.name: Sakina Iftikhar Ali Group

texts.en:
Sakina Baji is a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan.  Sakina’s husband, I. A., has run a catering business for six years.  She is applying for a loan to buy material (tent, table covers) for his catering business.

Sakina is the mother of three kids: two daughters and one son.  All are enrolled in school and getting an education.  She operates a knitting clothes business in order to get income.  She gets orders from cloth shops and uses her income to pay the school fees of her kids.  

She is the group leader of this group.

Akeka Kosar Baji wants a loan to buy material (taps, pipes) for her sanitary business.

Suraiya Begum Baji wants a loan to buy fruit for her fruit selling business.

Khurhseed Baji wants a loan to buy an embroider machine to embroider dresses. 

Maqsoodan Baji wants a loan to buy leather to sell. 

Mussarat Baji wants a loan to buy shawls to sell.

This is a group loan.  Funds will be distributed among group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.   The members mutually guarantee each others loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy material for various businesses.

loans.name: Fankjah

texts.fr: Madame W. a pour activité  la vente de produits américains, plus particulièrement les médicaments et les cosmétiques génériques.  Elle a commencé à vendre ses produits de sa maison en 2005.  Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des produits américains de la marque Forever et d’autres produits cosmétiques.  Madame W. habite à Sogbossito, une banlieue de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.  Elle et mariée, et elle a 3 enfants.
texts.en:
Fankjah's business is selling American products, particularly generic medicines and cosmetics. She began selling these products out of her home in 2005. Wishing to expand her stock so as to make more sales and better satisfy the demand of her clientele, she is requesting her first loan to buy American products of the Forever brand and other cosmetic products. Fankjah lives in Sogbossito, on the outskirts of Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is married and has 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of health products for re-sale

loans.name: Lilian Patricia

texts.es: la sra. Lilian H. tiene 35 años de edad, ella tiene un local de venta de comidas y golosinas en el mercado los Dolores de La cuidad capital, ella comienza a las 5 de la mañana a cocinar para el desayuno y almuerzo y tenmina a las 5 de la tarde con sus ventas de golosinas, ella trabaja todos los dias y los fines de semana son mucho mejor las ventas ya que los fines de semana las gente va al mercado a hacer sus compras para la semana y ahi es cuando ella mas vende ya que siempre le compran comida., cabe mensionar que ella tiene 12 años de tener este negocio ahorita ella quiere comprar mas comida ya que hay dias que se queda sin vender. por tal razon necesita el credito
texts.en:
Señora Lilian H. is 35 years of age. She has a place where she sells meals and sweets in the Los Dolores Market in the capital city (Tegucigalpa). She begins cooking at 5 a.m. for breakfast and then lunch, and she finishes at five in the afternoon selling sweets. She works every day and the weekends are better for sales since that is when people go to market to do their week's shopping. That's when she does her best business since they always buy her meals. It bears mentioning that she has been in this business for twelve years. Right now she would like to buy more food since there are days when she has nothing to sell. That's why she needs this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans cooking oil, lard, tortillas, pork, chicken, drinks, butter, cheeses and plantain bananas.

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru: Сайфуддинова Гулистон проживает в районе Пяндж. Вдова , осталась одна с двумя детьми на руках. После чего занялась бизнесом. Открыла столовую , которая расположена в центре районного рынка.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить и обновить инвентарь. Это поможет улучшить качество обслуживания , что поможет привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
S. Guliston lives in the Pyandj region. She is a widow and was left alone with two children on her hands. After this she started a business. She opened a cafeteria which is located at the center of the regional market. She plans to get a loan in order to purchase and get new inventory. This will help her to improve her service quality which will help to attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “zapatito Veloz” trabaja junto a  Pro-Mujer hace más de tres años,  a la fecha  cuenta con doce socias activas, ellas han  demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría estan casadas y con un promedio de 5 hijos, se ven en la necesidad de buscar  otras fuentes de ingresos ya que las necesidades de sus hijos aumentan día a día.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de zapatos, tenis, víveres, cosméticos otras también se dedican al  trenzado de mantas en macramé. La mayoría de ellas venden sus productos en ferias de la ciudad Necesitan capital para poder comprar mayor cantidad de productos, de esta manera generara mayores ingresos que les permita ofrecer bienestar a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Zapatito Veloz" group has worked with Pro-Mujer for more than three years. They currently have 12 active members and have proven to be organized regarding their loan payments. The majority of the group are married, with an average of 5 children. They have had to look for other sources of income to meet the growing needs of their children. There are different businesses within the group, such as sale of shoes, tennis shoes, supplies, cosmetics and others make macramé placemats. Most sell their products in markets. They need capital in order to buy a greater quantity of products which will allow them to generate more income for their families.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta O. is from the village of Danao. She is 49 years old. Julieta is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Julieta owns and operates a manufacturing business making necklaces. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing these necklaces and selling them to local businesses and community members. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Eldefonsa

texts.en:
Eldefonsa S. is a 54-year-old woman of industry and courage. She believes that everyone has an equal right to live a normal life far from poverty. She is a mother to four and all of the children are already of legal age. She is married to Efren, a 58-year-old fisherman. She lives in the island village of Kinabaogan, Binangonan, Rizal province.
In 2004, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines with the hope of having access to capital to strengthen her business. Among her secondary businesses are fishing, general store and resale of peanuts. But just recently, she focused on the resale of ready-to-wear products as her primary business. Now on her seventh loan, she proposes a loan of 20,000 pesos as additional capital for the resale business. The loan will be used to pay for 36 pieces of slacks, t-shirts, pants, and many other ready-to-wear products.
She is hopeful that her business will grow and will catch the public demand. With the profits that she can earn from her business, she plans to help her grandchildren with their school fees and be able to save for their future.

loans.use: To purchase ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Glody

texts.en:
Glody M. is 40 years old. She has nine children ranging in age from 3 to 20 years old. She is married to Danilo Moteno, a 50-year-old fisherman. Glody and her family live in the North Peninsula of Antique, which is in Pandan. The place is rich in natural resources. Pandan is surrounded by verdant mountains and a blue ocean that sparkles during the day time. 

Having been trained in cosmetology, such as manicures, pedicures, hair cutting, and hair curling, Glody has been practicing her trade for the last three years. This has been her business and her source of income. With the profits from her business, she has helped her husband to augment the family income. 

Glody's ASHI loan has supported her business and her husband's fishing business. Because she was able to repay her first loan, she is now qualified to apply for another loan for a higher amount. She plans use this loan, and future loans, to invest in her growing business. She wishes that some day she will own a beauty shop in their village where she can give her custumers comfort and good quality services.

Glody hopes that all of her children will graduate from college. That is why she wants her business to succeed. Her loan from ASHI is a very important factor that could lead her toward fulfillment.

loans.use: Cosmetic products

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Hardwork, dedication and prayer are three elements that 39-year-old Mrs. Miraluna S. of Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, believes can make her life easier. Mrs. S. and her husband, Mr. Clemente S., work hard together to support their four children.

Mrs. S. started her sari-sari (general) store soon after she joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon. She was determined to help her husband earn additional income for the family. But Mrs. S. didn't stop at her sari-sari store. She continued to look for other investment opportunities and sources of income, and she decided to try the fishing business.

Using the loan she got from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she bought a motorized boat and fish nets, and started her fishing venture which, over time, proved to be a lucrative source of income for her and her family. For her 22nd loan cycle she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she plans to use partly to buy additional fishing equipment and the other part as additional capital for her sari-sari store. Part of the income from these ventures she hopes to save for her children's education.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment and for use as capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mr. Chim C., 48, and his wife, Mrs. Sokhoeun Am, 52, were married in 1982 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of their daughters is a garment factory worker and the other two children attend school. The family lives along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Chim has been selling piglets for more than thirty years. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. In the past, she used to sell lotus flowers in the local market. Chim’s motorbike is old so he wants to purchase a new one, but he doesn’t have enough money. Thus, he is asking for a loan of $500 in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en: M. Marhabo is 44 years old. She is a widow with two children. Marhabo has been running her own small business for 15 years already. She has a place in the local market for selling products such as macaroni, sweets, detergents, soap, washing powder, shampoo, toothpaste, and other items. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her elder son helps her in the store registering the stock and serving the clients. Marhabo and her son are very friendly and polite, which allows them to keep their clientele. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 US dollars. Marhabo is planning to spend the loan purchasing more goods for selling, thus increasing the range of her stock. Marhabo thanks everybody who has decided to support her. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history and diverse culture, which is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet influence, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions. It served as a key post along the Silk Road and marked the end of Alexander the Great's extensive rule. It was the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina. And it is home to epic mountain passes, communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON’s History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To increase her stock, purchasing goods for selling

loans.name: Palwasha Group

texts.en: This is the Palwasha group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. Palwasha and M. Alam want to take a loan for their carpet weaving business to expand and progress for their businesses. And Shayma wants to take a loan for her quilte business to open a shop in future. And also they want to complete their necessary materials for their businesses. They want to say that these loans to help businesses progress and make businesses larger are very useful. They all want to thank Kiva for making possible the process in Afghanistan to support poor people.

loans.use: they buy necessary materials for their business

loans.name: Patrick Barasa

texts.en:
Patrick is 40 years old, married to Asha, and blessed with six children. His business is located at Makutano in Eldoret.

He was introduced to KADET by a friend. With the loan he is requesting from KADET, he intends to expand his business by adding more food items to sell, particularly maize. His future plans are to expand his business and educate his children.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy maize to sell

loans.name: Moriamo

texts.en:
Moriamo sells children’s clothes and sarongs and has been in this business for a long time. She is married with three children and she is 39 years old. She hopes to give her children a quality education so that they can become graduates. She is a hardworking woman and she uses her hard work to ensure that there is food on her table for her immediate family members.

This is the high season for her sales and the demands for her goods are high. She hopes for a loan of N150,000 to purchase more children’s clothes and sarongs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders. She hopes to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more children's clothes and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Hermelinda tiene 36 años de edad, es madre de 05 hijos (03 varones y 02 mujeres), su hijo mayor tiene 12 años de edad, ella estudió hasta 5to de secundaria, vive en el  Distrito de Pilcuyo, Provincia El Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Desde hace un año integra el Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, con su primer crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles aumentó su capital y compró un ganado vacuno, actualmente continúa  dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de ganado vacuno y paralelo a ello vende ropa desde los 14 años de edad.

Con este préstamo de 600.00 nuevos soles, comprará 01 ganado vacuno.

Su sueño es incrementar su capital, comprar ganado vacuno mejorado y criar con alimento balanceado y dedicarse a la crianza de ganado mejorado.
texts.en:
Sra. Hermelinda is 36 years old and the mother of 5 children (3 sons and 2 daughters). Her oldest child is 12 years old. She studied through the 5th year of secondary school. Hermelinda lives in the District of Pilcuyo, El Collao Province, Department of Puno.

One year ago, she joined the Miraflores Communal Bank. Her first loan of 500 soles increased her operating capital so that she could buy a cow. Hermelinda continues to dedicate herself to buying and selling cattle, but at the same time, she has been selling clothing since she was 14 years old.

With this new loan of 600 soles, she will purchase one head of cattle. Her dream is to increase her capital so that she can buy a better breed of cattle, provide her animals with a balanced diet, and improve her livestock rearing techniques.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase 1 head of cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en:
Our featured entrepreneur is Marianita S., a barangay (village) health worker from Sumirap, Tangub City. She is 28 years old and is married to Mr. Jovie S.. The couple are blessed with 3 school-aged children.
 
Marianita has supplemented her family's income selling snacks and clothing to add to the family income since Jovie's income is not enough to support them. In addition to this, Marianita is now expanding to a motorcycle-taxi service business, to be manned by her husband. She is taking out a second loan of P7,050 to use as a down-payment for the motorcycle. Marianita plans to use the profits from the business to repay her loan and to further her business. 


About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Down-payment on a motorcycle for commercial hire

loans.name: Lelis

texts.es: El Sr. Lelis tiene la actividad de carpintero, su taller se encuentra en la casa de la suegra que esta ubicada en la zona de ovejuyo, actividad con la cual sustenta a toda su familia que esta compuesta por 4 hijos y esposa quien realiza trabajos del hogar, se pudo comprobar en la visita domiciliaria que  el cliente vive modestamente ya que el trabajo que realiza solo le alcanza para mantener a su familia y cubrir sus prestamos, demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Lelis is a carpenter. His shop is in his mother-in-law’s house, which is located in the Ovejuno area. This activity supports his whole family, which is comprised of four children and his wife. His wife does the household chores. It was evident during the home visit that the client lives modestly. His work only suffices to support the family and cover his loans. He demonstrates punctuality and responsibility.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material (wood)

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, de 28 años, es un joven muy trabajador y alegre, vive en la casa de sus familiares y está dispuesto a trabajar muy duro para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Con mucho esfuerzo logró implementar un locutorio (Centro de llamadas telefónicas) en uno de los mercados más importantes de la ciudad de Juliaca. Gracias a la buena ubicación que tiene, los clientes no le faltan, y poco a poco su negocio está creciendo. Ahora siente que fue una buena idea invertir su dinero en este negocio, ya que el principio tenía algunas dudas.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede aprovechar la línea de Internet que usa su locutorio. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro de su negocio. 
Para más adelante, anhela incrementar el número de cabinas que tiene para poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el primer préstamo de Julio con MFP y está dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy querido ya que es el más joven del grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados instalará una nueva cabina para poder atender a mayor cantidad de personas a la vez.
texts.en:
Julio, 28 years old, is a very hardworking and cheerful young man. He lives with his family and he is willing to work as hard as it takes to improve is life. With a lot of effort he managed to set up a call center in one of the most important markets in Juliaca city. Thanks to the good location there is never a shortage of customers and little by little his business is growing. Now he feels it was a good idea to invest his money in this business, although at first he had his doubts. What he likes the most about his job is using the call center's Internet connection. He has been running the business for 4 years and he feels that the hardest part is having to stay all day inside. For the future, he longs to increase the number of individual telephone booths to increase his income. This is the first loan Julio asks of MFP and he is committed to paying all his installments on time. He is very well loved in his communal bank because he is the youngest member. With the 1,000.00 PEN he asks for he will install a new phone booth so as to be able to give service to more people at the same time.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a phone booth

loans.name: Euth

texts.en: Mrs. Euth O. is 40 years old and a widow with three children. Two of her children are laborers and they also help their parent with the farming in the local village. The youngest child is a student in the public school. They all live in Phngeas village, Takeo province. Mrs. Euth O. is a farmer who owns a two-hectare field to grow rice to earn a living for herself and her child. In order to grow crops in the dry season, Mrs. Euth O. decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and use as working capital.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticide and use as working capital.

loans.name: Senon

texts.es:
El Sr. Senon nacio en la Provincia Padilla del Departamento de Santa Cruz el 2 de junio de 1973, tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar es casado con la Sra. Serafina quien le ayuda en la siembra de sus productos hace 17 años compro una parcela en Santo Corazon en donde vive y trabajan en la agricultura, siembra sandia, maiz y arros, tambien tienen su camion el saca madera para los carpintenros, el viene trabajando en emprender hace 4 años porque segun el en la institucion tiene suerte, es muy trabajador y resposable con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, el destino del credito sera para la compra de semillas y asi poder incrementar su capital de trabajo, Uno de sus deseos es de hacer construir su casa, esta muy agradecido con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
						
Si quieres saber mas de la provincia Padilla visita esta pagina http://padilla.gov.bo/?modulo=info_t&pagina=historia.
texts.en:
Senon was born on June 2, 1973 in the province of Padilla in the Santa Cruz department. He has three school-aged children and is marred to Serafina. His wife helps him with his farming. He bought a parcel of land in Santo Corazon, where they now live and work the land. They grow watermelon, corn, and rice. They also have a truck that delivers lumber to carpenters. He has been working with Empender for the past four years and has had some luck. He is a responsible hard worker and pays his debts on time. He will use the money from this loan to buy seed and to increase his working capital. He would like to build a home someday. He is very grateful to Empender and Kiva for the trust they have placed in him in helping obtain this loan. If you would like to know more about the province of Padilla, visit its official website: http://padilla.gov.bo/?modulo=info_t&pagina=historia

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To seal his walls.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 43 años, vive con su pequeño  hijo en casa de un familiar.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica  a la compra y venta de animales, sus  hermanos le ayudan a verificar que los animales que adquiere  se encuentren  en buen estado de salud. Cada vez que acude a los lugares de comercialización de animales  siempre se asegura de pedir sus  registros de compra, que le permiten calcular sus ganancias, luego vende esos animales que ha conseguido en las  ferias  ganaderas mas conocidas de la zona. Este negocio le ha resultado rentable porque no invierte casi nada  en mantener a los animales pues los tiene en su poder  por unos días, hasta que llegue el fin de semana, además  la ganancia que recibe por cada cabeza de ganado es considerable. Para el futuro quiere incrementar su capital de trabajo para tener la capacidad de comprar mayor cantidad de  animales.Es la tercera oportunidad que  tiene un crédito y promete ser  muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Betty tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mas cabezas de ganado, y de esta manera  incrementará  su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Betty, who is 43 years old, and her small son live with a family member. For 10 years she has made her living purchasing and selling animals. Her brothers help her verify that the animals she acquires are in good health. Each time she goes to the animal commercialization sites, she is sure to ask for her purchase record, which allows her to calculate her profits. She then sells the purchased animals in the most well known livestock markets in the area. This business has been very profitable for her because she hardly invests any money in the maintenance of the animals; she only has them in her care for a few days, until the weekend. Furthermore, the profit she receives for each head of livestock is considerable. In the future, she wants to increase her working capital and be able to purchase a greater quantity of animals. This is her third opportunity to receive a loan, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She thanks all those who made the loan possible. It will be very useful to her in advancing her business. Betty plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of additional heads of livestock, and in that way she will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will purchase several heads of livestock

loans.name: Jude

texts.en: Jude is a 45-year-old married man who has three children in school.  He has been offering medical services for the past eight years.  He is also employed as a doctor.  He uses his income to pay his three employees and to support his family.  He is a member of Fadhili group which consists of entrepreneurs who meet on weekly basis to save their money and also guarantee each other for loans in Faulu Kenya.  He has requested a loan of 75,000 KES to buy medical equipment. He hopes to have a well established business in the future.

loans.use: To buy medical equipment

loans.name: Norma Silvana

texts.es:
La  señora  Norma Pérez tiene 25 años es socia del bankito Damas Responsables, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay  situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana y  es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia en el Ecuador  caracterizándose  por mantener la tranquilidad y hermosura de una ciudad antigua y sobre todo  su centro histórico  que fue declarado Patrimonio Cultural  de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

Norma  se encuentra casada y tiene dos hijos de  7 y 3 años, la mayor estudia en una escuelita de la localidad  y el pequeño pasa en casa con ella, su esposo trabaja en su taller de carpintería ubicado en su casa propia, mientras que  ella se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y en sus momentos libres ayuda a su esposo en la carpintería desde que se casaron. 

Se encuentra en su tercer ciclo gracias a la invitación de su hermana,  los créditos le han beneficiado para  comprar  material para la carpintería de su esposo, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar planchas MDF, trupan, madera, clavos, cola blanca, etc. Además tiene como sueño salir adelante junto a su esposo e hijos e ir incrementando su carpintería para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma Pérez is 25 years old and is a member of Damas Responsables (Responsible Ladies), a small bank. She lives in the large city of Cuenca, the capital of Azuay province located on the meridian of the Andean mountain range on the equator, which is the third-most important city in Ecuador, and known for maintaining the peace and beauty of an ancient city, and most of all for its historic downtown that was declared a Cultural Heritage Site by UNESCO in the year 1999.

Norma is married and has two children who are 7 and 3 years old. The older one studies in the area school and the little one spends the day at home with her. Her husband works in his carpentry shop in their home while she does the housework and in her free time helps him in the shop. It has been this way since they got married.

She is now on her third loan cycle thanks to her sister's invitation. The loans have helped her buy materials for her husband's shop, and with the new loan she will buy plywood, Trupan, wood, nails, white glue, etc. It is her dream to get ahead with her husband and children and keep growing the carpentry shop to provide better service to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Materials

loans.name: Serigne Mor

texts.fr:
Monsieur Serigne Mor F. est un jeune marié âgé de 26 ans. Il est un agent de sécurité de l'agence Dalalbi Presta. Il vient récemment d'être recruté  après avoir servi deux entreprises comme vigile.
