C'est parce que ses deux entreprises lui doivent de l'argent qu'il jugea nécessaire de contacter les agences de sécurité pour trouver un emploi. 
En fin, cet homme, père de 2 enfants, souhaitait avec le crédit demandé achever la construction d'une chambre qu'il avait commencé  dans la maison familiale.
texts.en:
Mr. Serigne Mor F. is married and 26 years old. He is a security agent at the Dalalbi Presta agency. He was recently recruited there after being employed as guard by two companies. He found it necessary to contact the security agencies to find a job, as both his previous employers owed him money. This father of two children wishes to use the loan requested to finish building a room he had started working on in the family home.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: finish building a room

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en: Annabel D. is from the village of Lantay, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Annabel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Annabel operates a service-based business. The main source of income for her business comes from providing computer games to children in the local community. Annabel also peddles snacks once in awhile. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Annabel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. Annabel is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This will be the third loan taken out by Annabel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide better service

loans.name: Hermilita

texts.en: Hermilita C. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 54 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Hermilita owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Hermilita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2005, Hermilita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hermilita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Hermilita is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Hermilita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Group 4

texts.en:
Crispina B. is from the village of Tuburan Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old. Crispina is the group leader for a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are jointly responsible for paying back the full amount if one member is delinquent or defaults.

Crispina is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Crispina owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling nuts to local community. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Crispina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crispina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Crispina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a nut-selling business

loans.name: Tsengel

texts.en:
Tsengel I. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger - a traditional Mongolian housing tent. 

Tsengel operates a children's day-care business called Tselmeghen. She has been operating her business since 2005. The kindergarten she rents is located in a ger district so she is able to get subsidized from the Government of Mongolia.  

Tsengel is a hardworking and modest person who says, “I would like to create my own kindergarten by successfully operating my business.” Tsengel is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase construction materials in order to complete a new kindergarten building.

loans.use: To complete a new kindergarten building

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
Maximiliana es una madre D. familia D. 50 años D. edad que vive en el distrito D. Chepén, una zona agrícola D. considerable movimiento comercial, pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre y se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega – tienda instalada en su domicilio, el negocio funciona desD. hace seis años, durante los cuales ella ha venido trabajando arduamente por salir adelante, actualmente cuenta con una clientela estable que siempre recurre a su negocio a adquirir los productos que ofrece. Con los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad se encarga D. solventar los gastos D. su hogar.

Maximiliana desea adquirir mas productos D. modo que pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ventas, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 2000 nuevos soles.

Maximiliana es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia, en la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos con Nuestra Institucion y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento D. asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is a 50-year old mother who lives in the Chepén district. This is a farming zone and a busy traD. area. It belongs to the province of the same name and is located in the La Libertad region, one hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells convenience goods and groceries in a store located in her home. The business has been going for six years, during which time she has worked very hard to make ends meet. She currently has a steady client base of regulars who return to her business to buy the products she offers. With the income she receives from this work, she is able to cover the household running costs. Maximiliana would like to buy more products so that she can expand her business and increase sales. To achieve her goal, she thought it would be a good idea to request a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Maximiliana is a hard-working woman who is devoted to her family. Her neighbours and acquaintances say she is a quiet and responsible woman. She has already received loans from our organisation and has been punctual and responsible with regards to making her repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries in order to expand her home-based grocery store.

loans.name: Rayito De Luz Group

texts.es:
La señora Silvia M. G. es la representante del grupo Rayito
de Luz, Ubicado en la comunidad de Felipe Neri, Tlalnepantla, en el estado de Morelos, México, el grupo es de 5 integrantes y son vecinos este es su primer préstamo con Fundación Realidad.
Las integrantes del grupo son Silvia M. G. va a comprar con su préstamo mercancía refrescos, galletas, sabritas, dulces para surtir su tienda de abarrotes, la señora Gloria A. C. va a comprar un comal, lamina para techar su local, mesas, sillas, verduras, jitomates, tomates para elaborar sus antojitos mexicanos , la señora Silvia G. R. va a comprar abono orgánico por bulto para abonar sus árboles y producir su fruta, la señora Amada G. R. va a comprar maíz por carga para elaborar su tortillas a mano, Felipa García S. va a compra haba, calabaza, durazno, Limón por mayoreo, bulto para surtir su negocio.
La señora Silvia tiene 30 años de edad estudio hasta el tercer año de secundaria, tiene su certificado, vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos todos varones son: Carlos Ángel tiene 12 años, José Ismael tiene 8 años los dos estudian, Jorge Eduardo y Luis Eduardo tienen 3 años de edad y son gemelos. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes se llama abarrotes los Ángeles y solicito su crédito para comprar sabritas, galletas, pan Bimbo, refrescos, agua, dulces, cacahuates, lunetas, gomitas para ofrecerles a su clientela  la mayoría son  turistas que pasan con su auto por la carretera y se detienen a descansar y compran productos de la tienda, también los estudiantes y los vecinos acuden a su tienda a comprar, en tiempos de lluvia y frió baja la venta del agua y del refrescos, su hijo Carlos Ángel le ayuda a atender el negocio.
Inicio su negocio hace 4 años, vio que donde vive es paso de turistas es orilla de carretera y le pareció bien poner la tienda de abarrotes, su esposo le dio para comenzar a surtir la tienda y esta muy contenta con el préstamo que le van a proporcionar ya que tiene la oportunidad de invertir en el negocio. Para ella es muy importante su negocio porque es un apoyo económico, es un ingreso extra, esta cayendo dinero del diario y no le falta nada en el hogar, si sus hijos quieren algo de ahí lo taman.   
En Felipe Neri el clima es fresco, hay mucha vegetación, muchos árboles  por ahí pasa el corredor Chichinautzi es un área protegida, es bosque hay muchos árboles, venados, panteras, siembran forraje para los animales, avena, evol, maíz, en el mes de diciembre que hace mucho frió el agua se cristaliza se forman una capa de hielo. El negocio ha ayudado a su familia porque de los ingresos que va obteniendo tiene para los gasto de su casa o de algún gasto que se tenga que hacer de ahí se ocupa.
La señora Silvia M. G. Quiere decir a kiva y a Fundación realidad “les agradezco por este tipo de apoyos que nos brindan y voy a tratar de no quedar mal para que mi sigan apoyando con mas prestamos”. Mis sueños son superarme, sobresalir y entre mas crezca el negocio mejor, meter nuevos productos y las ganancias volverla a invertir y apoyar a mis hijos a que tengan una profesión. 
El negocio enfrenta la competencia hay otra tienda al lado de la suya.
texts.en:
Silvia M. G. represents the Rayito de Luz [Little Ray of Light] group, located in the community of Felipe Neri, Tlalnepantla, in the state of Morelos, Mexico. The group has five members, who are neighbors. This is her first loan with Fundación Realidad. The members of the group are: Silvia M. Granada, who will use her loan to buy merchandise including soft drinks, cookies, chips, and candy to stock up her grocery store; Gloria A. C., who plans to buy a griddle, roofing for her locale, tables and chairs, and vegetables, tomatoes, and green tomatoes to make her Mexican street foods; Silvia G. R., who plans to buy sacks of organic fertilizer to treat her trees so she can grow fruit; Armada G. R., who will purchase loads of corn to make her handmade tortillas; and Felipa García S., who plans to buy broad beans, pumpkins, peaches, and limes in bulk wholesale to stock up her store. Silvia is thirty-years-old. She completed her third year of secondary school and has her certificate. She lives in a common-law marriage and has four sons. Carlos Ángel, 12, and José Ismael, 8 are both in school. Jorge Eduardo and Luis Eduardo are 3-year-old twins. She has a grocery store called the “Los Ángeles Grocery.” She is seeking a loan to buy chips, cookies, Bimbo-brand bread, soft drinks, water, candy, peanuts, chocolate candies, and gummies to offer her customers. Most of them are tourists driving by on the highway who stop to rest and buy things at her store, or students and neighbors who come during the rainy and cold seasons looking to buy water and soft drinks. Her son Carlos Ángel helps her out in the store. Silvia started her business four years ago, after noting that where she lived beside the highway was a thoroughfare for tourists and seemed like a good place to have a grocery store. Her husband gave her the money to open and stock the store. She’s very happy with the loan she’s going to get because it will give her the opportunity to invest in her business. The business is very important to her because of the financial support it provides. It brings in extra income, she’s got money for everyday needs, and she wants for nothing at home. If her sons want something, they can have it. The climate in Felipe Neri is refreshing. There are lots of trees and vegetation, and the Chichinautzin Corredor passes through there. It’s a protected area with heavily-treed forests with deer and panthers in them. The people plant forage food like oats and corn for the animals. In December when it’s really cold the water crystallizes into a layer of ice. Silvia’s business has helped her family because she uses what she makes for household expenses or any other expenses that might worry her. She wants to tell Kiva and the Fundación Realidad, “I appreciate the kind of help you give us and I am going to try not to embarrass myself so you’ll keep supporting me with additional loans.” Her dream is to better herself, stand out, and most of all, grow the business into something better, and add new products. She will reinvest her earnings and support her sons so they can have a profession. Her store does face competition; there’s another one next door to hers.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chips, cookies, bread, soft drinks, and water

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer D. is from the village of Cabaruan. She is 27 years old. Jennifer is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Jennifer owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish in the local community. Jennifer has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jennifer joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jennifer has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jennifer is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jennifer from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Demberel

texts.en:
Demberel L. is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two adult aged sons in Uvurhangai province in central Mongolia. The family members live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home. Both of his sons works as assistant builders. Demberel owns and operates a small store in his town selling a variety of grocery and stationary products. His wife works as a servant for the local company. His grocery shop is located nearby school where attracts many customers. His monthly sales revenue is 500,000 MNT. Demberel started his shop in 2008 after moving from an other province and has built a stable operation. He is a very modest and accurate man. 

He is requesting a 900,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Francisca Isabel

texts.es: Francisca Isabel B. D. M. D. 50 años D. edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos D.: 15 y 23 años D. edad quienes se dedican a estudiar, y junto a los cuales vive en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Francisca posee una tienda D. productos perecederos, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación, negocio el cual le permite contar con todo lo necesario para el hogar y sus familia, es por esta razón que ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda  contar con el dinero necesario para equipar su negocio con todo lo necesario para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en muchas ocasiones se ve obligada a perder algunas ventas, ya que no posee los productos que le solicitan, circunstancias las cuales ella desea poder cambiar, para mejorar y salir adelante con su negocio. Francisca es una señora muy visionaria quien siempre desea salir adelante e ir creciendo día con día por el bienestar D. ella y su hogar, ya que para ella es muy importante poder aportar a su casa y D. esta forma poder vivir D. una manera tranquila en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para sus hijos, su esposo y ella.
texts.en: Francisca Isabel B. D. M. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, aged 15 and 23 years old, who are in school. They live together in the town of Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. Francisca has a perishible products store located in her house. This business allows her to have what she needs for her home and family. That is why she is asking for a loan with which she can have enough money to outfit her business with everything it needs to offer her customers a better service. On many occasions she has had to lose some sales since she doesn't have the products they are asking for. She would like to be able to change these circumstances to improve and get ahead in her business. Francisca is a visionary woman who always wants to get ahead and keep growing day to day for her and her home's wellbeing. For her it is very important to be able to contribute to her home and in this way be able to live in a calmer way with everything she needs for her children, her spouse, and herself.

loans.use: To buy perishable products.

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Ek

texts.en: Mrs. Ek A., shown in the photo, is 50 years of age and a married womA.. Since early 2009 she has been a grocery trader who sells various items from her store in front of her home. Additionally, Ek A. will work in the field during the coming growing crop season. She currently lives with her husband and three single children, while another four of her children have already married and have their own apartments to live in. Mrs. Ek A. lacks capital to continue investing in her business and is asking for a loA. in order to buy more grocery inventories to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Viviana Narcisa

texts.es:
En la parroquia Ayacucho del  cantón Santa Ana se reúnen cada quince días el Banco Comunal Amigas Por Siempre. Este lugar es conocido por su gran vegetación pero sobre todo por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por turistas locales y de otras ciudades.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Viviana, ella tiene 22 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y fruto de esta linda relación tiene una hija de tres años de edad que es su más preciado tesoro. Su esposo se dedica al comercio.

Ella además de ser una muy buena madre y ama de casa se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, además tiene varios clientes que le realizan pedidos ya que la ropa que ella lleva para sus clientes es seleccionada. Trabaja los sábados y domingos  desde las 8h30 hasta las 15h00  aprovecha que su hija la deja en casa de su mamá eso días, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente.

Este crédito es para comprar más mercadería ya que esta temporada que se avecina es muy buena, lo que más va a comprar es ropa de mujer y de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio,  es la fiscal de pagos del Banco y lo hace con mucho agrado. Su sueño es tener algún día su propio almacén.
texts.en:
In the Ayacucho district, within the county of Santa Ana, the Amigas por Siempre (“Friends Forever”) cooperative bank meets every fifteen days.  This area is known for its grand vegetation, but most of all, for beautiful fresh water spas that are frequented by local and foreign tourists.

This is where we find Viviana, who is 22 years old and married.  The result of this beautiful relationship is a three-year-old daughter, who is her most precious treasure.  Her husband is a merchant.

In addition to being a wonderful mother and homemaker, she dedicates herself to commerce.  She sells all types of clothing door-to-door, and also has several customers that place orders since the clothing she carries is select.  She works Saturdays and Sundays from 8:30 am to 4:00 pm, taking advantage of the fact that her mother can care for her daughter on those days.  She delivers on credit, and charges once per week.

This loan is for the purchase of more merchandise, as the coming holiday season is a good one for sales.  She wants to purchase mostly women and children’s clothing.  She has been a member of the cooperative bank since its inception and is the overseer of payments, which she does gladly.  Her dream is to one day have her own store.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, especially women and children's.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan S. has been a farmer for many years. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Since 2007, Phan has owned and operated her farm to cultivate rice crop, as well as selling corn next to her house, from which she earns a daily income. Phan is married to Sok Channa, age 37, who is a local farmer and also works in construction. They have been married for years and have one child who attends school. Phan hopes to increase her business and is applying for a $400 loan to be used to buy a larger amount of corn to sell. The rest of the loan will go towards accruing capital for her husband's construction business.

loans.use: To buy more corn to sell and to accrue capital for her husband's construction business

loans.name: Enma

texts.es: Enma, de 28 años, es una mujer soltera y trabajadora, que junto a su mamá Miguelina de 51 años, luchan por salir adelante. Ellas viven en casa de sus padres ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Está hermosa y valiosa mujer, todos los días trabaja en la venta de papa al por mayor y menor, ya tiene 10 años dedicándose a ello, pues desde que era joven ayudaba a su mamá en la venta de papa por kilos. Pero con el tiempo su mamá enfermó, y Enma tuvo que dedicarse al negocio familiar, ahora en el mercado mayorista, donde ella vende, todos la admiran y respetan por su buen corazón y su dedicación, ya que al mes genera una ganancia de 2 mil a 3 mil nuevos soles. La otra actividad de Enma es la agricultura, donde siembra papa, zanahoria y hortalizas en los terrenos agrícolas de sus padres, donde todos los fines de semana echa abono, riega y cultiva. Ahora ella está ahorrando para comprar su propia casa. Es el sexto crédito con MFP, y como presidenta de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa por dirigir a un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá comprar 50 sacos de semilla de papa, Con ello podrá sembrar 2 hectáreas de terreno agrícola.
texts.en:
Enma, 28, is a single, hard working woman who together with her mother, Miguelina, 51, struggles to get ahead.  They live in their parents’ house in the city of Tarma.  This beautiful and brave woman works daily selling potatoes at wholesale and at retail.  She has been in this business for 10 years. Her mother became ill and Enma had to take over the family business, now in the wholesale market, where she sells.  Everyone admires and respects her for her kind heart and dedication.  Her monthly profits are around 2000 to 3000 new soles.

Enma is also a farmer.  She grows potatoes, carrots and leaf vegetables on her parents’ farmland.  Every weekend she spreads manure, waters and cultivates.  She is saving up to buy a house of her own.

This is her 6th loan with MFP.  She is President of her communal bank and feels proud to lead a group of enterprising women.

If she were to get the requested loan, she will be able to buy 50 sacks of potato seed that will allow her to plant two hectares of farmland.

loans.use: To buy 50 sacks of potato seed.

loans.name: Anne Marie

texts.fr: Madame Anne Marie S. est une commerçante qui a ses activités dans un marché de la place à Mbour. Elle est veuve et s'occupe de la survie de sa famille avec son commerce. Elle évolue dans se secteur depuis plusieurs années et vend des tissus,des produits aleo vera dans ses temps libre ; elle fait aussi de la teinture. En quelque elle est dans tout ce qui peut lui procurer de l'argent. Ainsi, pour asseoir ses besoins elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer sa boutique
texts.en: Ms. Anne Marie S. is a merchant who operates at a local market in Mbour. She is a widow who is busy supporting her family with her business.  She has been advancing in this sector for several years selling cloth, and she sells aloe vera products in her spare time.  She also dyes cloth.  In a manner of speaking, she is into anything that can bring in money. Thus, to meet her needs, she is requesting this loan to bolster her shop.

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Levy Azucena

texts.es:
Doña Levi, D. 40 años D. edad, se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. piñatas, vive con sus hijos: Gloria D. 21 años y Carlos D. 19 años D. edad, es madre soltera, residen en San Francisco Gotera departamento D. Morazán, ella tiene más D. 10 años D. dedicarse a este negocio, le ayudan sus hijos y una hermana, su horario D. trabajo es D. 8:00am a 5:00pm.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales como papel periódico y papel crespón, alambre y pega, esta compra le ayudara a fabricar más piñatas, además D. tener la oportunidad D. aumentar la producción también aumentaran sus ventas, generando D. esta manera ingresos abundantes para solventar las necesidades del hogar.
Ella quiere cancelar puntualmente el préstamo, aumentar sus ingresos para poder montar un local amplio adecuado para fabricar y comercializar las piñatas.
texts.en: Mrs Levi, age 40, makes piñatas. She lives with her children: Gloria, age 21, and Carlos, age 19. She is a single mother. She lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan department. For over 10 years she has worked in this business. Her children and one of her sisters helps her. Her work schedule is from 8 am to 5 pm. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials such as newspaper and crepe paper, wire and glue. This purchase will help her to make more piñatas, in addition to having the opportunity to increase her production and sales, thus generating more income to cover her household costs. She wants to repay the loan punctually and increase her income to open a well-stocked business to make and sell her piñatas.

loans.use: the purchase of materials such as newspaper and crepe paper, wire and glue

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en: Celestin sells goats. He is married and has four children who are between one and twelve years old. His wife is a business woman who sells cooking oil and sugar. Celestin has been selling goats for fifteen years. He needs this loan to buy more goats to sell. He intends to use the profits from this business to build his new planned house. In the future, he would like to hire his own vehicle for transporting goats instead of making contributions to various goat dealers.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Esteban Lidovino

texts.es:
Esteban pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Margarita Ocongate” y vive en la ciudad de Ocongate provincia de Quispicanchis departamento del Cusco, Perú. El socio vive junto con su esposa y su hija Crisanta de 5 años. (La ciudad de Ocongate se encuentra ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad del Cusco). 

Esteban estudiaba la carrera profesional de derecho en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco pero por motivos de dinero no pudo culminar su carrera. Decidido a empezar una nueva vida, Esteban se dedicó a ayudar a abogados realizando documentación entones, él aprendió el oficio de defensor jurídico (Asesora asuntos judiciales: materia penal, civil y laboral y también realiza contratos, transferencias, minutas y otros.). Después de trabajar en varias ciudades del departamento del Cusco como asesor jurídico, Esteban decidió establecerse en la ciudad de Ocongate donde trabaja y abrió una oficina de asesoría jurídica. Esteban requiere el préstamo para comparar materiales de escritorio como por ejemplo papel, lapiceros,  y muchas cosas más. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Esteban belongs to the “Las Margarita Ocongate” community bank and lives in the city of Ocongate, in Quispicanchis province, in Cusco department, Peru.  He lives with his wife and his 5 year-old daughter Crisanta.  The city of Ocongate is two hours from the city of Cusco.

Esteban studied law at the National University of San Antonio Abad in Cusco but he was unable to complete his degree for financial reasons.  He decided to start a new life.  Esteban worked helping lawyers write documentation and then trained to become a legal counselor (someone who provides advice on legal matters including criminal issues, civil issues, labor issues, contracts, transfers, fees, and other cases).  After working in different cities in Cusco department as a legal counselor, Esteban decided to set up in the city of Ocongate and opened a legal counseling office.  Esteban requires this loan to buy stationery supplies such as paper, pens and many other products.

Esteban is grateful for this opportunity and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy stationery supplies

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 32-year-old farmer.  He mainly does crop farming.  He has been in business for ten years and has experienced a lot of growth since he joined Faulu Kenya.  This is because he used his previous loan from Faulu Kenya to buy a water pump and expand his farm.  He hopes to own a vehicle for transporting farm produce in the future.  With 20,000 Kes, he will buy manure and pressure pipe.

loans.use: To buy manure and a pressure pipe

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en:
Darisuren, 48, is married and lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. They live in a ger, a nomadic tent, on a small plot of land that was loaned to them by the government. She wants to own her own land and build a house where they can have a comfortable life.

Darisuren has made felt-related crafts since 2008, after attending a vocational school.  As an experienced tailor, her business is stable and she has many customers.  She is a hard worker with a lot of initiative.  Darisuren wants to expand her business and is requesting a loan of 1,350,000 MNT to purchase more felt and other materials. 

Her husband has worked as a school janitor since 2009.  Her older son is employed by a beverage company and her younger son attends school.

loans.use: To purchase more felt and useful materials

loans.name: Violita

texts.en:
Violita L. is from the village of Kamanikan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old. Violita is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling taro (a root vegetable treated like a potato) or lutya (a squash-like vegetable) in the local community. Violita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Violita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional lutya or camote (sweet potato) to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional lutya or camote to sell

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Mrs. SoV. V. is 39 years old and her husband, Mr. Bunthin But, is 40 years old. They have been married since 1993 and have five children. They live in a small village on National Road Number 2, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.
SoV. and her husband are farmers. Besides farming, Mr. Bunthin But is also a construction worker. SoV. is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase neighboring land to expand her property and buy a water pump to spray her rice farm.
The photograph shows Mrs. SoV. V. and her young son peeping out behind her.

loans.use: to purchase neighboring land and a water pump

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a caring lady who spends her time at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. She belongs to a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Chichawatni which is famous for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of A. Nagar in a 2-room brick house for many years.  

She is the mother of three children. All of them are getting education from a local school. Her brother also lives with her and he is involved in a plastic crockery sets sales business. He operates his business in the market and financially contributes Sakina and her family. 

Sakina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother who wants to buy crockery to sell to his customers and earn better profits. Sakina is hopeful that her brother who has been operating this business for the past four years will successfully be able to further grow his business after the loan investment and increase his profits. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy plastic crockery for resale.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI de BALIMAYA - TON - MASSABLACOURA est composé de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans, 2 enfants et vivant dans de familles conjugales nucléaires avec leurs enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans la ville de BOUGOUNI qui relève de la 3eme région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles se sont connues par des relations de commerce. Dans l’intention de développer leur commerce en faisant assez de stock enfin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois  et cela pour faire le commerce de céréales, de savons, de la pâte d’arachide et divers condiments alimentaires.
Avec ce prêt Batoma T. compte acheter 15 boites de 2kg de concentrée de tomate, 5 sacs de 25kg de sel, 10 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses autres qualités de condiments. Les produits sont payés auprès des grossistes de Bamako pour les revendre ensuite en détail et au comptant au marché de BOUGOUNI à une clientèle composée d’hommes et  de femmes.
Avec ce prêt ces femmes  espèrent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 FCFA par mois qui dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’activité et l’autre partie sera utilisé dans les frais de santé familiale.
texts.en:
The BENKADI group of BALIMAYA - TON - MASSABLACOURA is composed of married women who average 36 years of age and two children each, and who live in nuclear conjugal families with their children and spouses. They live in the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through their commercial activities. 

They sell cereals, soap, groundnut paste, and various food condiments. Hoping to expand their businesses by boosting their stock to better meet customer demand, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. This is their first loan cycle.   

Batoma T. will use this loan to buy fifteen 2 kg boxes of condensed tomato, five 25kg bags of salt, ten 100-unit packets of Maggi cubes, and various other grades of condiments. She buys her stock from Bamako wholesalers for resale at retail and for cash at the BOUGOUNI market to a clientele composed of both men and women.

With this loan, the group members expect to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA each, to be reinvested in the business and to help pay for family health care.

loans.use: to buy condiments for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 50 hundred-weights of corn to get better sales in the northern part of the country

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna, 40 years of age, is married, and blessed with three school-aged children. She is engaged in a direct selling business in which she sells cosmetics and apparel products such as make-up, lotions, talcum powder, and clothes. She earns PHP 9,000 monthly. She would like to request a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more make-up and perfumes to sell. She hopes to create another income-generating source for the family's daily needs and to gain more income.

loans.use: to purchase more make-up and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA D. LIMA D. CONCHACALLA”; La socia vive en el distrito D. Conchacalla la provincia D. Anta,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Margarita; tiene 63 años D. edad y La socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos D. los cuales todos ellos son independientes; la socia se dedica a la agricultura la socia tiene un terreno en el cual cultiva maíz, papa, la socia también cría vacas y toros aparte D. otros animales menores como cuyes, pollos, la socia desea ahora poder comprar una vaca y ovejas para luego vender; la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. una vaca y D. ovejas. 

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta D. productos agrícolas, otros a la ganadería y una D. las socias tiene su tienda D. abarrotes, venta D. chicha, crianza D. animales menores.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad D. vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Margarita, 63, is a member of the “Santa Rosa D. Lima D. Conchacalla” communal bank.  She lives in Conchacalla District in Anta Province, Cusco Department.

She is married and has six children, all independent.  She is a farmer.  She has a plot of land where she farms corn and potatoes.  She also raises cows and bulls asiD. from other minor animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She now wants to buy a cow and sheep to sell later on.  She is asking for the loan to buy a cow and sheep.

The other members buy and sell farm products, some raise livestock; one of the members has a grocery store, another sells chicha (drink maD. from corn) and another raises small farm animals.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan because it allows her to grow in business and improve her quality of life.  At the same time, she commits to pay her installments according to the stipulated time frame.

loans.use: to buy a cow and sheep.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
El señor Dario tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Eusebia, tienen 8 hijos, 7 mujeres ya mayores de edad y 1 varon en edad escolar, vive en la ciudad de Ita. El se considera un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, no teme trabajar para poder darle a su familia todo lo que ellos necesitan para poder vivir decorosa y dignamente.
El Sr. Dario realiza diversas actividades comerciales desde muy joven, posee un horno propio donde produce y vende carbón en su domicilio, también posee 3 carritos con caballo que utilizan sus hijas para la venta de sus productos.
El señor Dario ha demostrado ser una persona responsable, sacrificada y emprendedora, gracias a eso ayudó a sus hijos para que puedan estudiar, ser trabajadores y responsables.
Solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de sus hornos de carbón y para reparación de los carritos, piensa que este crédito le sera de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Dario, age 49, is married to Eusebia, and they have eight children.  Seven of the children are girls, and they are now adults.  The other child is a school age boy.  They live in the city of Ita.  He is considered to be a very responsible and hard-working father.  He is not afraid to work in order to be able to give his family all of the necessities.  That way they are able to live in a suitable and decent way.

Dario has engaged in diverse commercial activities since he was very young.  He has his own oven where he produces and sells charcoal at his home.  He also has three horse drawn carts, and his daughters use them to sell their products.

Dario has demonstrated himself to be a responsible, self-sacrificing, and enterprising person.  Thanks to this, he helped his children so that they could go to school and become hard-working and responsible people.

He is requesting the loan for maintenance on his charcoal ovens and to repair the carts.  He thinks this loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his charcoal ovens and his carts.

loans.name: Alexandra Candelaria

texts.es:
Alexandra Candelaria tiene 33 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Alexandra se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz  y frejol. Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es sembrar en grandes cantides cacao.

Le gusta hacer la limpieza en la casa.
texts.en:
Alexandra Candelaria is 33 years old.  She is married, and she lives with her husband and their children in the  Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.

The members of the “Luchando Por Una Misma Causa” (Fighting for the Same Cause) Communal Bank is in the La Primavera neighborhood in the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to growing short cycle corn and rice.

Alexandra grows corn, rice, and beans.  She buys her products at the Comercial Peña, and she sells at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan to grow corn and rice.  She will buy supplies and fertilizers for her crops.  The support from the loan will help meet her needs.

Her dream is to plant great quantities of cacao.

She likes cleaning house.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose De La Rosa

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque . Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera de los pobladores.

José se dedica desde algunos años a la crianza y comercialización de ganado porcino (cerdos), su corral los tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada, una vez que lleguen a su crecimiento óptimo lo puede ofrecer a sus clientes o a los distintos mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque y con los ingresos que obtenga pueda solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar más cerdos para su venta, también piensa incursionar en la comercialización de arroz, con la finalidad de que obtenga  más ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida.  José es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable que lo único que quiere es que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
José is a 30 year-old father who lives with his wife and children in his own home which only has electricity.  It is located in the rural area of Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for the farming and livestock raising carried out by the local people.

José has been raising and selling pigs for some years.  His pen is located behind his home.  He gives his animals balanced feed and, once they have reached an optimum level of growth, he can sell them to his customers or in the markets in Chiclayo and Lambayeque.  He is able to cover his household expenses with his income.

José has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more pigs to sell.  He is also planning to start selling rice with the goal of making more profits so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.  José is a hard-working and very responsible person.  The only thing he wants is for his family to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and also rice so that he can start out in a new business

loans.name: Señor De Puquin Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; la socia tiene 28 años; la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, la socia se dedica a la atención de sus restaurantes, la socia tiene su propio negocio y ella se dedica  a la atención diaria de sus restaurante la socia suele ofrecer paltos de sopas o cremas, segundos, y refrescos, la socia también saca extras diversas para sus clientes, la socia en esta oportunidad desea compra una olla a presión para su propio uso para el hogar, ella desea poder hacerlo para facilitar la cocción de sus diversos platos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una olla a presión.

Los socios se dedican a la venta de artefactos, presta servicios de taxi, venta de comidas caseras, atención de la tienda de abarrotes, todos los socios solicitan el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería y de comprar algo para reinvertir en sus negocios o actividades.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Justina belongs to the “SEÑOR DE PUQUIN” communal bank, which is located in Huanchac district, in Cuzco province and department. She is 28 years old, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She has her own business running her restaurants every day, where her menu includes soup or custard dishes, main courses and beverages. She also provides an assortment of extras for her customers. On this occasion, she wants to buy a pressure cooker for her home to facilitate cooking her various dishes. She requests the loan to invest in the purchase of a pressure cooker. 

The members of this communal bank sell appliances, provide taxi services, sell home-cooked food and run grocery stores.  All the members are requesting loans to buy merchandise and thereby re-invest in their businesses. 

Sra. Justina is very pleased and appreciative of the support she has received and is committed to paying off her debts by the established due date.

loans.use: to purchase a pressure cooker.

loans.name: Atyrkul's Group

texts.en:
Atyrkul, 44, is the leader of this group. She is married and lives in the town of Balykchi. Atyrkul and her husband have different spheres of work. He is a truck driver and she is a chemistry and biology teacher in a local high school. However, the free time of both of them is devoted to taking care of cattle. It’s been five years since the couple started widening their household and building appropriate conditions for livestock.  The monthly profit from breeding and reselling of cattle is 4 200 soms. Atrykul’s big wish is to support financially her son’s ambitions for studying abroad. Therefore, she applied for a loan in order to pay her son’s college tuition. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for her son's college tuition.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transport.

For the past ten years, she has operated a firewood sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge from the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing another business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kshs loan, Fatuma wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married to a driver. Together with her husband, she brings up two sons. The older son studies at school and the second is not yet in school; he is preschool age (under seven).  Five years ago, the family sold a good harvest (fruits and vegetables) and with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, Nazgul started to sell grocery goods. She sells beverages, cookies, oil, flour, etc. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more products to increase the commodity turnover of her business. In the future, Nazgul plans to expand the store.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour, beverages, oil, etc

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a hardworking businesswoman aged 23. She is married and blessed with two children. For the last two years, she has been selling clothes to earn a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more business-oriented.  In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes and handbags.

loans.use: To buy clothes and handbags.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang was born in 1963. She lives in Ngoc Loi village with her husband and three children. Her husband is a carpenter. He has been working at his workshop with Sang's help. They have had this business for three years. They have a monthly income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

Since 2006 Seda has participated in SEDA. The last time she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood to produce furniture.

loans.name: Florevel

texts.en:
Florevel is 31 years old and lives in Cabgan, Pta. Miray, Baliangao. She is married and has five children. 

Florevel works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase 5 boxes of fish to sell. 

Florevel has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: buy 5 boxes of fish

loans.name: José

texts.es:
A sus 52 años de edad, José es un hombre soltero y sin hijos, proviene de una familia muy pobre, razón por la cual desde muy pequeño se vio en la necesidad de buscar un trabajo para ayudar a sus padres, y comenzó desde ese entonces a vender Lotería,  por temporadas también vende otro tipo de mercancía como ropa, accesorios y artículos de moda.

José, sueña con tener su propia casa para tener un lugar donde descansar tranquilo y con la certeza que nadie lo va sacar de allí, es por eso que actualmente trabaja para conseguirlo, y por eso necesita un préstamo con el fin de comprar la mercancía y las loterías para fin de año donde las utilidades por el aumento de ventas se aumentan.
texts.en:
José is 52 years old, and single, without children. He comes from a very poor family, which is why from a very early age he saw the necessity of looking for work in order to help his parents and he began at that time to sell lottery tickets. He also, on and off, sells other types of merchandise such as clothes, accessories and fashionable items. 

José dreams of having his own home where he can have a place to rest peacefully with the certainty that nobody will kick him out, and this is why he working to achieve it, and why he needs a loan to buy merchandise and lottery tickets for the end of the year when profits increase as sales increase.

loans.use: to buy clothes, merchandise and lottery tickers to help increase end of the year profits
